En este lugar conocimos a la señora Fernanda, tiene 23 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 4 y 1 año de edad, el mayor esta en jardín de infantes. Su esposo trabaja en una empresa de agua.

Nuestra amiga se dedica al comercio, ella en sociedad con su papá tienen un negocio de venta de sabanas, toldos, toallas y ropa en general. Ellos se desplazan hasta otras ciudades muchas veces a ciudades del Oriente ecuatoriano donde sus productos se venden muy bien, por el momento ella  no viaja ya que su hijo está muy pequeño, pero cuando esté un poco más grande su bebé piensa dejarlo donde su mamá y realizar sus viajes junto a su papá y realizar de nuevo sus ventas.
 
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: toldos, sabanas, toallas y  ropa de todo tipo. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 5 ciclos, es la tesorera del banco  y le gusta estos créditos que son de mucha ayuda en su negocio. 

Su sueño es tener su casa propia ya que vive donde sus suegros.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the 'El Paraíso' (Paradise) community bank meets in Picoaza parish, in the city of Portoviejo.  This place noted for being a very commercial area.  It is also known for its traditional San Pedro and San Pablo fiestas and the cheerfulness of the local people.

Here we meet Fernanda who is 23 years old, married, and has two children from her marriage who are 4 and 1.  Her eldest is in kindergarten.  Her husband works for a water company.

Our friend is a retailer.  In partnership with her dad, she has a business selling sheets, canopies, towels and clothes.  They travel to other cities; often to cities in the east of Ecuador where their products sell very well.  Right now she doesn't travel as her son is still very young but when he is a little older she plans to leave him with her mom and resume her trips with her dad so that she can start making sales again.

Fernanda will use this loan to buy more merchandise such as canopies, sheets, towels and all kinds of clothes.  She has been a member of her community bank for five loan cycles.  She likes these loans which are a great help to her in her business.

Fernanda's dream is to own her own home as she currently lives with her in-laws.

loans.use: to buy canopies, sheets, towels and clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy eggs, flour, butter, cheese, etc.

loans.name: Carmen Mercedes

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal El Paraíso se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Carmen, tiene 44 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen 5 hijos, 4 de ellos mayores de edad y la menor de 9 años que estudia en escuela, dos de sus hijos  aun vive con ella. Su esposo es comerciante.

Ella tiene un local en el centro de Picoaza en el cual vende de todo un poco en lo que se refiere a prendas de vestir, allí también sus clientes pueden encontrar sabanas, toldos, almohadas, carteras, cortinas entre otras cosas. Trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta  las 18h00 con la ayuda de su hija y su esposo, nos cuenta que hasta su negocio llegan muchas personas ya que en su local encuentran los productos más barato y de la mejor calidad. Ella compra en Huaquillas o en Guayaquil cada vez que necesita más mercadería. Tiene este negocio 15 años y le va muy bien ya que cuenta con mucha clientela.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar más mercadería como: ropa de todo tipo, toldos, sabanas, carteras entre otras cosas que vende en su local. Está en el Banco Comunal 2 ciclos y le gustan los créditos ya que son de mucha ayuda. 

Su sueño es seguir aumentando su local.
texts.en:
The communal bank El Paraíso [Paradise] meets bimonthly in the Picoaza parish in the city of Portoviejo, a place known as a commercial zone as well as for its traditional festivals of San Pedro and San Pablo and for its friendly people.  

Here we meet Señora Carmen who is 44 years old.  She is married and has 5 children, 4 of whom are adults and the youngest is 9 years old and attends school.  Two of her children still live with her.  Her husband is a merchant.  

She has a shop in the center of Picoaza where she sells a little of everything with regards to clothing.  Her customers can also find sheets, canopies, pillows, purses, curtains, etc.  She works all day from 8:00 am until 6:00 pm with the help of her daughter and husband.  She tells us that many people find that she offers cheaper products that are of better quality.  She does her buying in Huaquillas or in Guayaquil when she needs more merchandise.  She has had this business for 15 years and things are going well for her as she has a lot of customers.  

With the loan she will buy more merchandise such as canopies, all types of clothing, sheets, purses and other things she sells.  She has been in the communal bank for 2 cycles.   She likes the loans as they help her a great deal.  

Her dream is to continue improving her shop.

loans.use: purchase clothing, canopies, sheets, purses, etc.

loans.name: Jose Alberto

texts.es:
José, vive con su esposa y tres hijos de 5, 8 y 14 años de edad, el se dedica a administrar una tienda y un molino de nixtamal, y fue iniciado a través de su madre hace 12 años, trabaja de lunes a domingo.
El solicita un préstamo para invertirlo en productos para la tienda como pan, arroz, maíz, gaseosas, frijoles y sopas instantáneas, el préstamo le ayudara para mantener mejores ventas y aumentar los ingresos de la familia, manteniendo surtido el negocio.
Las aspiraciones de él es que a través de préstamos pueda desarrollarse y ofrecer un mejor servicio a la clientela, también en su familia espera que la calidad de vida sea mejor.
texts.en:
José lives with his wife and three children, aged 5, 8 and 14  years old.  He works managing a store and a corn mill.  He started in this 12 years ago, and was introduced to it by his mother.  He works from Monday through Sunday.

He is requesting a loan to invest in products for his store, such as bread, rice, corn, sodas, beans and instant soups.  The loan will help him keep up his strong sales and grow his family income by keeping his business fully stocked.

His hopes are that through the loans he can develop his business and provide a better service to his customers.  He also hopes that his family's quality of life will improve.

loans.use: to buy household goods: bread, rice, corn, sodas, beans and soups.

loans.name: Mirian Katiana

texts.es:
En el balneario de San Clemente  cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal 1 de Diciembre. Este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que son visitadas por muchos turistas nacionales y extranjeros,  ofrece diversidad de lugares hermosos y una rica variedad de platos típicos de la región.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Mirian, tiene 36 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos de 16, 12, 6 y 4 años, los dos mayores estudian  en colegio y los menores en escuela y jardín de infantes. Su esposo es Ing. Eléctrico.

Nuestra amiga es  una gran ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de productos Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y trabaja cinco  días a la semana de una a dos horas diarias y en los momentos que está desocupada ya que no tiene un horario fijo. Deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana. Tiene ocho  años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien, nos cuenta que lo que más vende son los perfumes ya que son muy buenos.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y bisutería. Lleva más de dos años  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer.
 
Su sueño es tener un almacén de repuestos de carro.
texts.en:
In the seaside resort of San Clemente the communal bank 1 de Diciembre (December 1st) meets bimonthly.  This place is known for its beautiful beaches that are visited by many national and international tourists as well as offering a diversity of beautiful places and a rich variety of local cuisine.  

Here we meet Señora Mirian who is 36 years old and has young children in school and kindergarten.  Her husband is an electrical engineer.  She is a great homemaker who brings in her own income selling Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and accessories for women).  She sells door to door and works 5 days a week for one to two hours daily and also when she is not busy as she doesn't have a fixed schedule.  She sells her products on credit and charges weekly.  She has been doing this for eight years and things are going well.  She tells us that she mostly sells perfumes since they are very good.  

With the loan she will buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, and imitation jewelry.  She has been a member of the communal bank for two years and she likes it because of the easy payment terms.  
 
Her dream is to have a warehouse for spare car parts.

loans.use: purchase perfumes, creams, cosmetics and imitation jewelry.

loans.name: Juan Pablo

texts.es:
Juan, administra una tienda, vive con su esposa y una hija de 15 años de edad, él posee la tienda desde hace 17 años, esta surgió por la necesidad, pero actualmente se encuentran otras tiendas cercanas que le hacen la competencia.
Actualmente quiere fortalecerla con la compra de mercadería como huevos, frijoles, gaseosas, jugos, pan, aceite, esta inversión le ayudara para mejorar la atención a los clientes y las ventas, logrando ganar más afluencia de estos.
Su objetivo es que a través de préstamos pueda aumentar la mercadería en la tienda, atrayendo a nuevos clientes para que sus ganancias sean mejores para la familia.
texts.en:
Juan manages a store.  He lives with his wife and 15-year-old daughter.  He has had the store for the last 17 years.  It arose out of need, but currently there are other stores nearby which are posing competition.

Currently he wants to strengthen his business by purchasing merchandise such as eggs, beans, soda, juice, bread, and oil.  This investment will help him improve his customer service and his sales, bringing him more affluence.

His goal is that through these loans, he can increase his store's merchandise and attract new customers so that his earnings will be better for his family.

loans.use: to buy eggs, beans, soda, juice, bread and oil for his store.

loans.name: María Antonia

texts.es:
María soltera, sus hijos ya mayores de edad, mujer trabajadora, emprendedora, ella renta apartamentos desde hace un tiempo. Ha sufrido de algunos robos siendo una dificulta. Inicio con fondo propio y gran esfuerzo de salir adelante. 
Sus planes es seguir mejorando la infraestructura así ofrecerle mayores comodidad a sus inquilinos. Con el préstamo comprar materiales de construcción: cemento, arena, ladrillos, tubería entre otros para mejorar los servicios sanitarios.
Agradece a la financiera por el apoyo para el desarrollo de su negocio y nivel de vida.
texts.en:
María is single with grown children.  She is a hard-working woman, who is entrepreneurial.  She has been renting out apartments for a while.  She has suffered from several robberies, which remains a difficulty.  She began with her own funds and great effort to move ahead.  Her plans are to continue improving her infrastructure and so provide better comfort for her tenants.  

With this loan she is going to purchase construction materials: cements, sand, bricks, and pipes among other things, to improve the sanitary provisions.

She is grateful to the financing organization for the development of her business and standard of living.

loans.use: to improve the sanitary provisions in the apartments she rents out.

loans.name: Blanca Edita

texts.es:
En el balneario de San Clemente  cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal 1 de Diciembre. Este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que son visitadas por muchos turistas nacionales y extranjeros,  ofrece diversidad de lugares hermosos y una rica variedad de platos típicos de la región.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Blanca, tiene 53 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tienen tres hijos los mismos que ya son mayores de edad, uno de ellos aun vive con ella y estudia en Universidad. Su esposo es comerciante.

Nuestra amiga para ganarse la vida y  la de su familia junto a su esposo se dedican al comercio, ellos tiene una tienda de comestibles en su casa en la cual juntos  trabajan día a día para que esta mejore aun mas, allí  venden  todo tipo de productos, como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, entre otras cosas, trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y veces hasta más tarde, además de estos productos también venden carne, pollo, pescado, y útiles escolares. Los productos los compra en Portoviejo ya que allá le salen más baratos y algunos los  recibe en su local. Lleva más de 15 años con su negocio.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos y otros productos de primera necesidad. Está en el Banco Comunal hace más de  5 años  y le gusta por los beneficios que brinda la institución.
 
Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y que su tienda crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
In the spa town of San Clemente, the Communal Bank "1 de Diciembre" meets every two weeks.  This area is well-known for its beautiful beaches with are visited by many national and international tourists.  It has a variety of beautiful places and a delicious variety of dishes that are typical of the region.

In this place, we meet Señora Blanca.  She is 53 years old and married with three grown children from the relationship.  One of them still lives with her and studies at University.  Her husband works in retail.

To earn money for herself and her family, our friend works in retail with her husband .  They have a food store in their home where they work together on a daily basis so as to do even better.  They sell all types of products, such as rice, sugar, oils, and detergents among other things.  She works every day from 6 a.m. until 8 p.m. and sometimes later.  In addition to these products, they also sell meat, chicken, fish and school supplies.  They buy the products in Portoviejo, as they are sold there more cheaply and some aren't found in their area.  She has been working in this business for more than 15 years.

This loan will be used to stock up her store.  She will purchase rice, sugar, oil, detergent, sausages, and other everyday products.

She has been in the Communal Bank for more than five years, and likes it because of the benefits the institution provides.

Her goals are to continue moving forward with her business, and for her shop to grow more every day.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergent, sausages, and other everyday products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy fertilizer and pay for labor.

loans.name: Lidia Estebana

texts.es:
Lidia, administra un molino y venta D. granos básicos y artículos D. primera necesidad, ella vive con su esposo y un hijo, ella administra el negocio que le ha permitido tener ingresos para la familia.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra D. frijoles, arroz, café, azúcar, para el negocio, también comprara abono para los cultivos D. su esposo, el préstamo le ayudara para estabilizar la tienda y además para poder cuidar del cultivo.
La aspiración D. Lidia es tener buenas referencias D. este préstamo, que le permita tener acceso a más para poder apoyarse y crecer económicamente.
texts.en:
Lidia manages a mill, and sale of basic grains and goods.  She lives with her husband and a son.  She handles the business, which has allowed her to have income for the family.
She is currently requesting a loan to purchase beans, rice, coffee, sugar, and for her business she will also buy fertilizer for her husband’s crops.  The loan will help her set up the store, and also to take care of crops.
Lidia aspires to have good references with this loan, which will give her access to more, so as to have support and expand financially.

loans.use: buy beans, rice, coffee, sugar.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria tiene 62 años , vive con su madre en su casa propia. Desde su niñez se dedica a las tareas del campo de las cuales aprendió lo esencial, actualmente es jubilada y por su avanzada edad ya no es posible realizar mucho esfuerzo físico en el campo. Por tanto ha optado por dedicarse en la venta de comida al paso, especificamente en la preparacion de salchichas con papas fritas, en un stand móvil, que es su principal herramienta de trabajo. Esta actividad lo realiza por las tardes hasta alta horas de la noche. Por otro lado, también se dedica al tejido a mano, producto final que son vendidos. Estas actividades que realiza la mantienen con mucha vitalidad y disfrute de su vida. Es la primera vez que esta solicitando un crédito no MFP, fue invitada a formar parte del grupo solidario a la que integra por medio de uno de sus vecinos y por la información que ha recibido ha decidió tener un préstamo de la que tiene definido el uso que le dará. Y en esta ocasión comprará  al por mayor cubiertos y platos descartables al por mayor, mondadientes, aceite y algunos ingredientes mas para su negocio de comida.
texts.en:
Maria is 62 years old, and lives with her mother in her own home.  Since childhood, she has worked in the fields, where she learned what was essential. Currently she is retired, as due to her advanced age it isn't possible for her to expend much physical effort in the fields.  For this reason, she has opted to work selling food as a street vendor, specifically preparing hot dogs with french fries from the mobile stand which is the principal tool required for her work. She does this activity in the evenings, until the late hours of the night.  On the other hand, she also works doing weaving by hand and selling her finished products.  These activities keep her going with great vitality and enjoyment of her life.

This is her first time requesting a loan from MFP.  She was invited by one of her neighbors to be part of the solidarity group she joined, and based on the information she received, she decided to take a loan that will be used for the purpose she describes.  On this occasion, she will purchase disposable cutlery and plates at wholesale, toothpicks, oil, and other additional ingredients for her food business.

loans.use: to buy disposable cutlery and plates, and ingredients for preparing food.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel de 38 años de edad, vive con su familia en su casa propia, cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Esta zona es agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

Manuel se dedica a la agricultura, tiene sus propias tierras de cultivo donde siembra limón, actividad que realiza desde hace varios años, además de ser un producto consumido diariamente por las personas, una vez que realiza su cosecha lo comercializa en los diferentes mercados de la zona y fuera de ella,  con los ingresos que adquiera puede brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos y esposa.  También cría y comercializa animales de corral, lo que le permite tener otro ingreso para su casa.

A observar que su negocio va creciendo y a creído necesario solicitar un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles para la compra de fertilizante para mejorar sus tierras como su producto y alimento balanceado para sus animales, con las ganancias que obtenga podrá pagar su crédito y solventar las necesidades diarias de su familia.  Manuel con trabajo y dedicación le brinda lo mejor a sus hijos, con la intensión de brindarles otra oportunidad académica en un futuro.
texts.en:
38-year-old Manuel lives with his family in his own home.  The only service his home receives is electricity.  His home is located in the rural part of Tambogrande district, in Piura department.  The people in this area work in farming, livestock raising and handicrafts.

Manuel is a farmer.  He owns his own farmland where he grows lemons.  He has been in this business for several years.  This is a product which is consumed daily and once he harvests his crops he sells them in the different markets both within and outside his area.  He uses the income that he makes to provide his children and wife with a better quality of life.  He also raises and sells farmyard animals which allows him to make an additional income for his household.

Noting that his business was growing, Manuel decided he needed to request a loan for 1,500 soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy fertilizer to improve his land and his crops.  He will also buy balanced feed for his animals.  With the profits he makes he will be able to repay his loan and cover his family's daily needs.  Through his work and determination, Manuel will be able to provide his children with the best in life.  HIs aim is to provide them with more academic opportunities in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to improve his land and to buy balanced feed for his animals

loans.name: Cleto Marcelino

texts.es: Cleto Marcelino 70 años, su actividad es la venta y elaboración de tortillas. Hace más de 20 año que busca la manera de mantener a su familia. Don Cleto es un hombre emprendedor, el es su propio jefe de su negocio pues se levanta todos los días temprano para ofrecer sus tortillas caliente a sus clientes. el desea el préstamo para invertir en la compra maíz, bolsas, leña, cal y comal. Por lo que se compromete a pagar sus cuotas en tiempo y forma.
texts.en: Cleto Marcelino is 70 years old.  His business is making and selling tortillas.  He has been looking for a way to support his family for more than 20 years.  Cleto is an entrepreneurial man.  He is his own boss and he wakes up early every morning so that he can offer warm tortillas to his customers.  He would like this loan to buy corn, bags, firewood, lime and a 'comal' (special pan for making tortillas).  He pledges to make his repayments in full and on time.

loans.use: to buy corn, bags, firewood, lime and a 'comal' (special pan for making tortillas)

loans.name: Maritza Monserrate

texts.es:
En el balneario de San Clemente  cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal 1 de Diciembre. Este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que son visitadas por muchos turistas nacionales y extranjeros,  ofrece diversidad de lugares hermosos y una rica variedad de platos típicos de la región.

En este lugar vive la señora Maritza, tiene 25 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 4 y 2 años de edad. El marido se dedica  a la pesca. Lleva 9 ciclos en el banco comunal y le agrada por los beneficios que ofrece la institución.
 
Nuestra amiga además de ser una muy buena ama de casa también se dedica al comercio, vende de ropa de todo tipo, para lo cual ella tres a cuatro veces por semana se desplaza por toda su localidad ofreciendo sus productos. Todas las tardes y noches ella también se dedica a la venta de comidas rápidas y lo que más vende son los chuzos (carne en palito) y alitas de pollo asadas con plátano asado, nos cuenta que lleva más de dos años dedicada a estas actividades y dice que le va bastante bien.

Este crédito lo va a invertir en sus dos negocios, va a comprar productos para preparar sus bocadillos como: alitas de pollo, plátano, carne de res, salchichas y sodas,  también va a comprar ropa de todo tipo para la venta.

Sus metas son seguir adelante en sus negocios y que sus hijos tengan lo mejor.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the 1 de Diciembre Community Bank meets in the coastal town of San Clemente. This place is known for its beautiful beaches, which are visited by many national and international tourists, has many different beautiful places, and a rich variety of traditional regional food.

Maritza lives here, is twenty-five years old, and, with her common-law husband, has two children, a four year old and a two year old. Her husband is a fisherman. She has received nine loans from the community bank, and is happy with the benefits the institution offers.

In addition to being a very good housewife, our friend is also a businesswoman. Three or four times a week she travels around her town offering the wide variety of clothing that she sells. She also sells fast food every afternoon and evening. Her biggest sellers are chuzo (skewered meat) and roasted chicken wings with roasted platano. She tells us she has spent more than two years working this way, and says that she is doing pretty well.

She plans to invest the loan in her two businesses. She is going to purchase ingredients to prepare sandwiches: chicken wings, platano, beef, sausage, and soda pop. She also is going to purchase a wide variety of clothing to sell.

Her goals are to get ahead with her businesses and to provide the best for her children.

loans.use: To purchase chicken wings, platanos, beef, sausage, soda pop, and clothing.

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.es: Candelaria tiene 68 años. Ella se dedica a una ferretería, a pesar de su edad es muy emprendedora pues todos los días se levanta temprano a las 6 de la mañana pues hay ciertos clientes que llegan muy temprano en busca de sus productos. Ella solicita este financiamiento para la compra de martillos, clavos, pega, candados, llaves, adhesivos, taladros, llaves destornilladores entre otros.
texts.en:
Candelaria is 68 years old and manages a hardware store. Despite her age, she is a very enterprising woman who wakes up early every day at 6am. There are certain customers who arrive very early in search of products.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy hammers, nails, glue, locks, keys, adhesives, drills, screwdrivers, and other items.

loans.use: to buy hammers, nails, glue, locks, keys, adhesives, drills, screwdrivers, and other items.

loans.name: Carmen Julia

texts.es:
Carmen es una madre de familia de 31 años de edad, vive con sus hijos en su casa propia,  cuenta con servicios de agua y luz, ubicada en la zona rural del departamento de Lambayeque.  Toda esta zona sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y turismo.

Carmen se dedica a la venta de cerveza, esta actividad los realiza desde hace 5 años, su negocio lo tiene en su misma casa. Últimamente se ha incrementado las ventas de cerveza en la zona donde vive, lo que le ha favorecido para poder incrementar sus ingresos y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.

Teniendo la oportunidad de crecer Carmen ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar mayor cantidad de cerveza y realizar algunas mejoras en su vivienda, con la finalidad de obtener mayores ganancias y así sus clientes aumenten, para solventar el crédito otorgado y para que su familia se supere poco a poco.
texts.en:
Carmen is a thirty-one year old mother who lives with her children in her own home, which has light and water service and is located in the rural region of the Lambayeque department. Throughout the region, people work in agriculture, ranching, and tourism.

Carmen sells beer, and has been doing so for the past five years. Her business is based in her home. Lately, beer sales have increased in the region where she lives, which has allowed her to be able to increase her profits and improve her family’s quality of life.

Carmen has requested a loan of 1000 PEN ($375) from Edpyme Alternativa to purchase a larger quantity of beer and to make some improvements in her home. Her goal is to earn greater profits, and, in that way, increase her clientele so that she may repay the loan awarded, and so that her family situation improves little by little.

loans.use: To purchase a larger quantity of beer so that she can commercialize her business.

loans.name: Zuleyka Alejandra

texts.es:
En el balneario de San Clemente  cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal 1 de Diciembre. Este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que son visitadas por muchos turistas nacionales y extranjeros,  ofrece diversidad de lugares hermosos y una rica variedad de platos típicos de la región.

Aquí conocimos a Zuleyka tiene 20 años  de edad, está soltera y vive en casa de sus padres.  Ella estudia Auditoría en la Universidad Técnica De Manabí, está en el séptimo semestre. Lleva en el Banco Comunal 8  ciclos, es la secretaria del banco y le gusta por que recibe ayuda a través de los créditos para tener su negocio y así poder seguir con sus estudios.

Ella trabaja de lunes a viernes en un cybert y  también se dedica a la venta de productos por catalogo de la marca Avon (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas). Ella trabaja de lunes a viernes  en las tardes  ya que en las mañanas estudia. Sus ventas las realiza en sus tiempos libres aunque también aprovecha para vender a sus compañeras de estudio y en el lugar donde trabaja, deja a crédito y cobra semanalmente, nos cuenta que lleva dos años que se dedica a esta actividad y que le va bien.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar perfumes, bisutería, cosméticos, cremas y bisutería.

Sus metas son terminar sus estudios y tener su propia empresa.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the 1 de Diciembre Community Bank meets in the coastal town of San Clemente. This place is known for its beautiful beaches, which are visited by many national and international tourists, has many different beautiful places, and a rich variety of traditional regional food.

Here we meet Zuleyka, who is twenty years old, single, and lives in her parents’ house. She studies Auditing at the Universidad Técnica De Manabí [Manabí Technical University], and is in her seventh semester. She has received 8 loans from the Community Bank, is its secretary, and likes the bank because she has received help through the bank’s loans to be able to have her own business and to be able to continue with her studies.

She works from Monday to Friday in an Internet café and also sells Avon catalog products (beauty items, cosmetics, perfumes, and ladies’ accessories). She works in the afternoons from Monday to Friday since she studies in the mornings. She makes sales in her free time although she does take advantage of the opportunity to sell items to her classmates, and also in her workplace. She offers credit and charges weekly. She tells us she has spent two years working this way, and it’s going well for her.

She will invest this loan by purchasing perfumes, costume jewelry, cosmetics, creams, and costume jewelry.

Her goals are to finish her studies and to have her own business.

loans.use: To purchase perfumes, creams, cosmetics, and costume jewelry.

loans.name: Francia Elena

texts.es: Francia tiene su actividad que es una pulpería. La mayoría de sus clientes llegan a su vivienda a buscar los diferentes víveres que necesita. Ella tiene 3 años con este negocio, por lo que ha podido obtener una gran experiencia  al brindarles lo que ellos necesitan. El motivo del crédito que solicita es para la compra de granos básicos, detergentes, pan, galletas, cremas, leche, fósforos, sopas y enlatados.
texts.en:
Francia owns a general store.  The majority of her customers come to her home to look for different foodstuffs that they need. She's had her business for 3 years, and has gained a lot of experience in providing them with what they need. 

The reason she is applying for a loan is to buy bulk grains, bread, cookies, creams, milk, matches, soups and canned goods.

loans.use: To buy bulk grains, detergents, bread, cookies, creams, milk, matches, soups, and canned goods.

loans.name: Laureano

texts.es:
Laureano tiene 68 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijo en su casa propia, no cuenta con servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Esta zona la actividad que desarrollan es la agricultura, ganadería y artesanía.

Laureano desde hace algunos años se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado vacuno (vacas), su corral se encuentra en la parte externa de su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada y pastos naturales para que tenga una buena producción de leche, la que ofrece a los mismos pobladores de la zona donde vive, cuenta con clientela fija por la buena calidad de leche que tiene, con sus ingresos solventa sus obligaciones familiares.  También cuenta con tierras de cultivo donde siembra limón y una vez que cosecha, contarà con otro ingreso para su hogar.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1200 nuevos soles para comprar alimento balanceado y de fertilizantes para mejorar sus tierras como su producto, con ambos ingresos podrá pagar su crédito y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.  Laureano es una persona trabajadora y muy responsable que lo único que quiere es que sus hijos tengan otras oportunidades de estudio.
texts.en:
Laureano, 68, lives with his wife and son in his own house which does not have basic utilities and is located in the rural part of Tambogrande District belonging to Piura Department.  This zone’s activities are farming, raising livestock and crafts making.

For several years now, Laureano has been raising cattle (cows) to sell.  His corral is located in the outside of his house.  He feeds them nutritionally balanced feed and natural grasses so that they will have good milk production that he sells among the local residents in the area where he lives.  He has a regular clientele because of the good quality of the milk he has and his income allows him to cover family expenses.  He also has fields where he plants lemons and once they are harvested he has an additional source of household income.

He has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 1200 new sol loan to buy nutritionally balanced feed and fertilizer to improve his land and his crops.  With both incomes he will be able to repay the loan and improve his family’s quality of life.  Laureano is a hardworking, very responsible person whose only wish is that his children have better opportunities for schooling.

loans.use: to buy nutritionally balanced animal feed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Magdalena María

texts.es:
En el balneario de San Clemente  cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal 1 de Diciembre. Este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que son visitadas por muchos turistas nacionales y extranjeros,  ofrece diversidad de lugares hermosos y una rica variedad de platos típicos de la región.

La señora Magdalena es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos ella empezó su negocio que aunque no es tan grande le ha ayudado a salir adelante. Tiene 64 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad, uno de ellos aun viven con ella. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca.

Nuestra amiga se dedica al hogar y tiene un local en su casa donde vende pescado, carne, pollos, camarón y otros mariscos por libras, trabaja todos los días desde las 8h0 hasta las 16h00, nos cuenta que hay temporadas muy buenas en la que llegan muchos turistas y sus ventas aumentan mucho, aunque también hay épocas en que las ventas bajan pero ella ya sabe cómo es eso ya que lleva más de 15 años que se dedica a esta actividad y que ha tenidos sus altas y bajas en su negocio.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar  pescado, carne, pollos, camarón y otros mariscos que vende en su local. 

Su meta es seguir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
The 1 de Diciembre Communal Bank meets every two weeks in the beach resort of San Clemente.  This place is known for its beautiful beaches that are visited by many national and foreign tourists.  It offers an abundance of pretty spots and a rich variety of regional dishes.

Magdalena is a founding member of the communal bank.  She likes the bank because, thanks to the loans, she started her business, which has helped her to get ahead even though it is not so big.  Magdalena is 64 and married; she and her husband have three grown children, one of whom still lives at home.  Her husband is a fisherman.

Our friend works at home and has a store in her house where she sells fish, meat, chicken, shrimp, and other shellfish by the pound.  She works every day from 8 a.m. to 4 p.m.  She tells us that there are very good periods when there are lots of tourists and her sales increase, although there are also times when sales go down.  She knows how this is, though, since she has worked in this business for more than 15 years and has had her ups and downs in her work.

Magdalena is going to use this loan to buy fish, meat, chicken, shrimp, and other shellfish that she sells in her store.

Her goal is to get ahead in her business.

loans.use: to buy fish, meat, chicken, shrimp, and other shellfish.

loans.name: San Miguel De Arcangel Group

texts.es: La Sra. Bertha D. 58 años D. edad soltera , es una D. la socias que conforman la Alcancía comunal San Miguel D. Arcángel ,se le dio en este segundo ciclo el préstamo ya que Bertha al igual que sus demas compañeros  demostraron  en el anterior ciclo trabajar en equipo  y ser puntuales en cuanto a sus pagos .Bertha se dedica actualmente a la  venta D.  animal vacuno  en las ferias D. Chupaca ,Ahuac.Solicita este  préstamo para poder  comprar buenos alimentos para sus animales ,para que así pueda  vender a un buen precio los animales .Quisiera para el futuro  tener un buen espacio para que ella misma pueda sembrar los alimentos para sus animales. En la foto viste  una  casaca color negro, polo color blanco y un sombrero color crema .Todos los integrantes la Alcancia comunal San Miguel D. Arcangel  estan muy agradecidos  por el prestamo obtenido .
texts.en:
Sra. Bertha is 58 years old and single. She is one of the members of San Miguel D. Arcángel communal bank. This is the bank’s second loan cycle, since Bertha and the other members of the group demonstrated in the previous cycle that they worked as a team and were punctual in making their payments. 

At present, Bertha sells cattle in the street markets of Ahuac district, in Chupaca province. She is requesting this loan to buy good feed for her animals so that she can then sell the animals at a good price. She would like in the future to have a good space so that she can plant food for her animals herself. 

In the photo Bertha is dressed in a black jacket, a white polo shirt and a cream-colored sombrero. All the members of San Miguel D. Arcángel communal bank are very grateful for the loan obtained.

loans.use: to buy feed for her animals.

loans.name: Ana Rosa

texts.es: Ana Rosa tiene 36 años de edad, su actividad económica es la venta de comida, ella es una joven muy activa y dinámica, le gusta mucho su trabajo, esta no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos pues ha sido muy satisfactorio para mantener a sus clientes. Actualmente solicita este financiamiento para la compra de  granos básicos, verduras, bolsas, paltos desechables entre otros. El deseo de Ana es que su hijo logre mantener este negocio.
texts.en: Ana Rosa is 36 years old.  Her business is selling food.  She is a very active and dynamic young woman who really enjoys her work.  This is not the first time she has taken out a loan.  Loans have helped her to keep her customers.  She is currently requesting this loan to buy basic grains, vegetables, bags, disposable plates and other items.  Ana's wish is for her son to keep this business going.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, vegetables, bags, disposable plates, etc.

loans.name: G.s. Santa Ana Ii Group

texts.es: Teófilo y Martha conforman el grupo solidario Santa Ana. Martha tiene su negocio que es la venta de ropa, desde hace más de 4 años tiene 3 hijos que dependen de ella. El crédito es para la compra de toallas, sabanas, pantalones, camisas, faldas, trajes y vestidos. Ella sueña con mejorar el servicio con sus clientes y proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en: Teófilo and Martha make up the Santa Ana community bank.  Martha's business is selling clothes.  She has been in this business for more than four years.  Martha has three children who are dependent on her.  She will use her loan to buy towels, sheets, pants, shirts, skirts, suits and dresses.  She dreams of improving her customer service and improving her home.

loans.use: to buy towels, sheets, pants, shirts, skirts, suits and dresses

loans.name: Briceida Elizabeth

texts.es:
En el balneario de San Clemente  cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal 1 de Diciembre. Este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que son visitadas por muchos turistas nacionales y extranjeros,  ofrece diversidad de lugares hermosos y una rica variedad de platos típicos de la región.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Briseida, tiene 26 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tienen un bebé de seis  meses de nacido. Su esposo es guardia de seguridad.

Ella en sociedad con su mamá tienen un restaurante en el cual venden desayunos,  almuerzos y platos a la carta, nos cuenta que la mayoría de sus clientes prefieren los mariscos pero  ellas tienen de todo para satisfacer a sus clientes ya que esto es su mejor carta de presentación, trabajan todos los días desde las 5h00 hasta las 16h00 y llevan 8 años con su negocio y  les ha ido muy bien.
 
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar arroz, carne, pescado, mariscos y otros víveres para la preparación de los alimentos. Está en el Banco Comunal cinco años, es la fiscal de pagos del banco  y le gusta porque el grupo es muy unido y responsable.

Su sueño es tener otro restaurante pero para ella sola.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the '1 de Diciembre' community bank meet in the seaside resort of San Clemente.  This place is known for its beautiful beaches which are visited by lots of domestic and international tourists.  The area offers a variety of beautiful places to visit and a rich variety of dishes which are typical of the region.

Here we meet Briselda who is 26 years old, married, and has a 6-month-old baby from her relationship.  Her husband is a security guard.

Briselda, in partnership with her mom, has a restaurant in which she sells breakfasts, lunches and à la carte dishes.  She tells us that most of her customers order seafood but they offer a bit of everything in order to keep their customers happy as this is their best letter of introduction.  They work every day from 5.00am to 4.00pm.  They have been in this business for eight years and it has done very well.

Briselda will use this loan to buy rice, meat, fish, seafood and other food products for preparing her meals.  She has been a member of her community bank for five years.  She is in charge of overseeing payments and she enjoys this role because her group is very united and responsible.

Briselda's dream is to own another restaurant of which she is the sole owner.

loans.use: to buy rice, meat, fish, seafood and other food products

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es: Oscar tiene 38 años, es jefe de familia que vive al lado de su esposa y su menor hijo en casa de un familiar. Desde hace 5 años se dedica a brindar el servicio de transporte, él posee un auto que es su esencial  herramienta de trabajo que le permite sostener a su familia. Trabaja todos los días, en distintos horarios, desde la madrugada hasta la noche, de acuerdo a la demanda de sus clientes. Su sentido de prudencia en el manejo hace que evite los accidentes que son un riesgo para su trabajo. Considera que esta actividad es muy rentable en sus ganancias y esto lo anima a proyectarse en grande para el futuro, ya que desea tener más vehículos y con ello tener su propia empresa de transporte. Es su cuarto crédito de trabajo que tiene con MFP, considera que trabajar con préstamo es una forma adecuada y más rápida para mejorar el negocio que una persona tiene, su propia experiencia le ha permitido aprender sobre la importancia del aspecto financiero y de cómo administrarla. En esta ocasión invertirá su crédito en el pago del mantenimiento mecánico de su carro.
texts.en:
Oscar, age 38, is the head of the family.  He lives with his wife and their minor son in the family home.  He has been providing transportation service for five years.  He has a car, which is the essential work tool that allows him to support his family.

He works every day, and he has different schedules.  He works from the early morning until night time, according to his customers’ demand.  The carefulness with which he drives makes him avoid the accidents that are a risk for his work.  He considers this business activity to be very profitable in its earnings.

This encourages him to plan big for the future.  He wishes to have more vehicles, and to form his own transportation business with them. 

This is his fourth loan that he has had working with MFP.  He considers working with the loan a suitable and quicker way to improve the business that one has.  His own experience has allowed him to learn about the importance of the financial aspect and how to manage it.

This time he will use the loan to pay for mechanical maintenance on his car.

loans.use: to pay for mechanical maintenance on his car.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys es una madre de familia de 41 años, vive con su familia en su casa propia, cuenta con servicio solo de luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Zona de actividad agrícola, ganadería y artesana.

Desde hace 2 años Gladys se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, confección, crianza y venta de ganado porcino, su negocio lo tiene en su casa, cuenta con su propia clientela, con los ingresos que obtenga en ambas actividades podrá brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 500 nuevos soles para comprar más productos de belleza y de prendas de vestir innovadoras para exhibir y vender a su clientela y así podrá obtener mayores ganancias para tener una mejor calidad de vida.  Gladys es una mujer trabajadora y una madre que siempre trata que su familia salga adelante a pesar de las dificultades que a veces se presentan en la vida.
texts.en:
Gladys is a 41-year-old mother who lives with her family in her own home.  The only basic service her house receives is electricity.  It is located in the rural part of Tambogrande district, in Piura department.  The people in this area farm, raise livestock and make handicrafts.

For two years, Gladys has been selling beauty products and clothes, and raising and selling pigs.  She runs her business from home and has her own customer base.  She uses the income that she makes from both businesses to provide her family with a better quality of life.

Gladys has requested a loan for 500 soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy more beauty products and the latest clothes to display and sell to her customers.  This will enable her to make more profits so that she can enjoy a better quality of life.  Gladys is a hard-working woman and a mother who always tries her best to get her family ahead in life in spite of the difficulties that life sometimes puts in her path.

loans.use: to buy beauty products and clothes for her business

loans.name: Dolores Miladis

texts.es:
En el balneario de San Clemente  cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal 1 de Diciembre. Este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que visitadas por muchos turistas nacionales y extranjeros, ofrece diversidad de lugares hermosos y una rica variedad de platos típicos de la región.

En este lugar vive la señora Dolores, tiene 53 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 25, 19 y 14 años, los mayores estudian en la universidad en Manta y el menor estudia en colegio. El marido es obrero. Lleva más de 6 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos salen muy rápido y sin tantos requisitos.

Es una gran ama de casa que para ganar el sustento diario y ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar hace seis años decidió instalar un bar en su casa, en este bar vende bocadillos y comidas rápidas, además de sodas, aguas, jugos, entre otras cosas. Trabaja todos los días desde las 15h00 hasta las 21h00, nos cuenta que le ha ido muy bien en su negocio y que gracias a su negocio sus hijos están estudiando en universidad.
 
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar sodas, aguas, jugos, bocadillos entre otras cosas para vender en su local.
 
Su sueño es tener un gran restaurante.
texts.en:
Every fifteen days, the 1 de Diciembre communal bank meets in the resort town of San Clemente. This area is known for its beautiful beaches which are visited by many tourists both international and local. The region offers a variety of beautiful locations and a rich variety of traditional local dishes.

Dolores lives here. She is 53 and in a common-law marriage from which she has three children ages 25, 19 and 14. The oldest children study at the University in Manta, and the youngest is in school. Her husband is a skilled worker. She has been a member of the communal bank for over six years, and she likes it because she gets fast access to credit without as many requisites.

She is a wonderful housewife who decided to open a pub in her home six years ago in order to help her husband and make an income. There she sells sandwiches and fast food, as well as soda, water, pop, and other items. She works every day from 3:00 pm to 9:00 pm. She tells us that her business has gone very well for her, and that thanks to her business her children are studying in university.

She will use this loan to purchase soda, water, juice, sandwiches, and other items to sell in her pub.

Her dream is to have a big restaurant.

loans.use: to buy sodas, water, juice, sandwiches, etc.

loans.name: Lorenza

texts.en:
Lorenza is 37 years of age and widowed with one child. She is engaged in a hog-raising business. Sometimes she sells the meat from her pigs. From this business alone, she is able to earn about PHP 4,000 a month. She uses her income for their daily needs, to pay the electric bill and for the allowance of her child.

Lorenza would like to maintain her business so that she is able to support her child in her studies. Due to the high cost of basic commodities, she is asking for additional capital amounting to PHP 15,000, which will be used to buying pigs and feed for her hog-raising business. She hopes that she can get this loan to further increase her income so that she can save enough money for the education of her child.

loans.use: to buy pigs and feed

loans.name: Muon

texts.en:
Muon (pictured with her loom) is a silk weaver. She has one son and four daughters. She is living on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. 

Silk weaving is a traditional profession. Muon is asking for another loan of $300 USD to continue her weaving business by buying silk materials.

loans.use: To purchase weaving materials

loans.name: Mach

texts.en:
Mach (in the photo), age 31, is single. She lives with her parents about twenty-five kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Mach is a garment worker. She is asking for a loan of 1100 USD to assist in her brother's farming business by buying fertilizer and a water pumping machine.

loans.use: to assist in her brother's farming business by buying fertilizer and a water pumping machine.

loans.name: Thoeun

texts.en:
Thoeun is a silk weaver and her husband, Neang, is a fisherman. They have been married since 1980 and have six children: five sons and one daughter. The daughter is a garment worker, one son is married and lives outside the family home, two attend school and the other two stay at home. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Thoeun is asking for a loan of $300 to purchase fishing nets for her husband and to buy weaving materials for her weaving business.

Photo: Thoeun and her husband.

loans.use: To purchase fishing nets and weaving materials

loans.name: Kanha

texts.en:
Kanha is a rice farmer and her husband has full-time employment in Phnom Penh. They live in a village about 17 kilometers south of Phnom Penh City. They have two sons and one daughter. Two are in school and one is still young.

Kanha hopes to supplement their income with a new business raising chickens, so she is asking for another loan of $1,000 to buy baby chickens to raise. She will also use a part of the loan to build a kitchen where she cooks.

Kanha and her husband are pictured.

loans.use: To buy chickens to raise and to build a kitchen

loans.name: Nary

texts.en:
Nary (in the photo) is 41 years old. Her husband, Sokhom, is 48 yeas old. They have three sons and three daughters. Five of the children are in school, including one in the university and one is still young. The family is living in a village on National Road Number 2, about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Nary and her husband are farmers. They grow on their farmland in the village where she lives. Nary is asking for a loan of $500 to pay school fees for her daughter who is in the university.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her daughter

loans.name: Soklai

texts.en:
Soklai (in the photo), 31, is a garment worker. Her husband Phansy is a construction worker. They have been married since 2008 and just have a young daughter. They are living in a village along National Road number five approximately 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Soklai is asking for a loan of $1,000 to buy a motorbike for commuting.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Kong

texts.en:
Kong (pictured with her granddaughter) is a farmer. She grows tomatoes, eggplant and corn. Her husband, Kol, is a builder of wooden houses. They have one son who is married and lives in the family home. The family is living on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Kong is requesting a loan of $1,000 to buy a motorcycle for commuting.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Chanhorn

texts.en:
Chanhorn and her husband are weavers. Besides weaving, Chanhorn’s husband is also hired by villagers to farm. He gets paid with fees. The couple has been married since 2003 and has two young sons. They are living on an island in the Mekong River approximately 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Weaving is a traditional profession. Chanhorn is asking for another loan of $100 to continue her weaving business by buying weaving materials.

Photo: Chanhorn with her loom.

loans.use: To purchase weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Sokleap

texts.en:
Sokleap (pictured here), 27, is a tailor. Her husband is a farmer. She lives with her brother and widowed mother on an island in the Mekong River approximately 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Sokleap is asking for a loan of $1,000 to buy a motorbike for her brother to drive to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her brother to drive to work.

loans.name: Anh

texts.en:
Anh, who was born in 1970, lives in Dong Dau village where she is the married mother of two children who are going to school. Her husband is a driver earning about 10,000,000 Vietnamdong (VND) per month. Anh sells groceries, a job she has had for many years that earns her a monthly income of about 5,000,000 VND.

A participant in SEDA since 2006, Anh repaid her last loan of 7,630,000 VND promptly and is now requesting a new one for 9,810,000 VND to buy more groceries such as paper, sugar, cakes, candy, salt, etc. for her store.

loans.use: to buy more groceries (paper, sugar, cakes, candy, salt, etc.) to resell.

loans.name: Chat

texts.en:
Chat, born in 1960, lives in Dong Dau village where she is the widowed mother of two children, a son and a daughter. Her main job is growing rice, but she is also involved in other activities to earn more money. She has a monthly income of about 3,000,000 Vietnamdong (VND). 

A participant in SEDA since 2006, Chat repaid her last loan of 7,630,000 VND promptly and is now requesting a new one for 9,810,000 VND to buy pigs for breeding.

loans.use: to buy pigs for breeding.

loans.name: Amanaly

texts.ru:
Аманали 62 – летний пенсионер, живущий со своей семьей в селе Кокжар на юге Кыргызстана.  15 лет назад Аманали начал свой бизнес в разведении скота с суммы 10,000 сом (KGS).  Неустанный труд и преданность своему делу позволили ему развить хозяйство с ежемесячной прибылью в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS).  Также семья занялась полеводством и садоводством, доходы от которых стали хорошим подспорьем в оплате образования детям. 
Для  дальнейшего развития бизнеса Аманали обратился в компанию «Бай -Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойных коров. Доходы от продажи молочных продуктов помогут Аманали женить младшего сына Асана. В будущем Аманали планирует создание своего фермерского хозяйства, где главным помощником станет его сын.
texts.en:
Amanaly is a 62-year old retiree who lives with his family in the village of Kokzhar in the south of Kyrgystan. 15 years ago he launched his cattle raising business with a starting capital of 10,000 KGS. Tireless work and dedication   allowed him to grow his business, which now brings him a monthly income of 20,000 KGS. The family also started farming and gardening, and the income proved a good help in paying for their children’s education.

In order to develop his business further, Amanaly turned to “Bai Tushum & Partners” for a loan in the amount of 100,000 KGS in order to buy dairy cows. The revenues from selling dairy products will allow Amanaly to pay for the wedding of his younger son Asan. In the future, Amanaly plans to create his own farm, where his son will be his main assistant.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Dove Group

texts.en:
Josephat, who is in his early 30's, is the married father of three children, one of whom attends school. He has had a sausage-selling business for four years now, delivering his product to hotels and bars. Working from 7 a.m. to 10 p.m. daily, he is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Josephat's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania; his previous one, since repaid, was used to buy more sausages and pay for his land. He will use this loan to buy additional sausages and to start building his house. His dream is to one day be able to finish his house.

Josephat will share this loan with his loan group "Dove", which has a total of 14 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy more sausages to sell and to start building his house.

loans.name: Gold Group

texts.en:
Prosper, who is in his mid 30s, is married with three children, all of whom go to school. He has had a business selling chips for three years now. He works from 7a.m to 11.30pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.
This will be his 4th Motisha loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. A Motisha loan is a product offered by Tujijenge Tanzania, given in the middle of the main loan, which motivates borrowers with good credit ratings who pay back their loans smoothly to receive half the amount of the existing loan before their original loan term has ended. Prosper used his previous loans to buy a sofa set, TV set, to start making bricks, and pay his children's school fees and his household expenses. He has paid back all his loans successfully. He wants a loan to buy one bag of Irish potatoes, one big bucket of cooking oil and one sack of charcoal. His dream is to be able to finish building his house one day.
He will share this with his loan group "Gold," which has a total of six members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy one bag of Irish potatoes, one big bucket of cooking oil and one sack of charcoal.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 55-year-old married man and father of two children. Mohamad has been manufacturing aluminum closets, doors and windows since 2005. He is very skilled in this business, and he is recommended by most of his customers, many of whom are builders. Mohamad is looking to improve and update his machines through a loan requested from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, which he will use to buy a new aluminum compressor. This will help him perform his work in a more professional way.

This is Mohamad's second borrowing cycle with Al Majmoua. His previous loan was very effective, and he hopes this one will have a greater impact on improving his social and financial situation. Mohamad wants to provide a better lifestyle for his family and expand his business more and more in the future.

loans.use: To buy an aluminum compressor necessary to improve his business

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is 47 years old and married. She is thankful because she has been blessed with 4 children. Corazon has a retail store based in her home and she is requesting a loan of PHP 23,000 to invest in merchandise to stock up on items such as biscuits, soft drinks, cooking oil, sugar and other ingredients. She has been running her business for 21 years and she is thankful because her income has been increasing.

Her family is her motivational guide in improving her business. She is working hard because she wants to have a better quality of life by doing something that brings in additional income and allows her to support her children in their studies. She hopes that she can get the amount she requested.

loans.use: to buy groceries such as biscuits, soft drinks, cooking oil, sugar and ingredients for her retail store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more garments for resale

loans.name: Goodwork Group

texts.en:
Amiri, who is in his late 20s, is married with two children, one of whom goes to school. He is a driver and also has had a fruits and vegetables business for three years now. He works from 7am to 9pm daily and is able to generate decent monthly profits.

This will be his third Motisha loan from Kiva's partner, Tujijenge Tanzania. A Motisha loan is a product offered by Tujijenge Tanzania that motivates borrowers with good credit ratings who pay back their loans smoothly to receive half the amount of the existing loan before their original loan term has ended. He used the previous loans to increase his stock and cover household expenses. He has paid back all his loans successfully. Amiri is now requesting a loan to increase his stock of fruits and vegetables. His dream is to one day be able to build his own house.

He will share this loan with his loan group "Goodwork" which has a total of 12 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: To increase his stock of fruits and vegetables for resale

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en: Milagros is 35 years old and single. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Milagros is borrowing PHP 10,000 from Kiva's partner, NWTF, to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. Milagros has been farming rice for 5 years and also earns additional income from raising livestock. She works tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ma.aracelli

texts.en: Ma. Aracelli is 36 years old and married with 2 children who are in school. She is in the agricultural business farming vegetables in the Philippines. Ma. Aracelli requested a loan of PHP 11,000 from Kiva's partner, NWTF, to purchase fertilizers for her vegetable garden. She has been farming vegetables for 5 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. Ma. Aracelli would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for her vegetable garden

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Remia

texts.en: Remia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fruit vending business in the Philippines. Remia requested a loan of PHP 10,000 from Kiva's partner, NWTF, to buy more fruits to sell in her food stall. Remia has been in this business for 2 years now, and also earns additional income by selling rice. Remia would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy more fruits to sell in her food stall

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en: Luzviminda is 55 years old and married with 9 children. She works in the agricultural business farming vegetables in the Philippines. Luzviminda requested a loan of PHP 10,000 from Kiva's partner, NWTF, to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. Luzviminda has been farming vegetables for 6 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. Luzviminda would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen is 54 years old and married with 5 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Helen has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a loan of PHP 19,500 from Kiva's partner, NWTF, to buy fishing gear and repair her fishing boat. Helen has been in this business for 36 years. In the future, Helen would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and repair her fishing boat

loans.name: Belandina

texts.en:
Belandina is a 59-year-old entrepreneur who is married to Oktovianus, 57. Belandina and Oktovianus are blessed with 4 children: Gusti, 25, Andri, 23, Selfi, 18 and Novy, 16 . Their youngest is studying in the second grade of Vocational School.    

Belandina has a smoked beef and pork business. This business has been running for five years. Belandina is assisted by her husband and three of her children. At the moment, Belandina can only produce 3 kg of smoked beef and pork to be sold. 

She dreams of buying beef and pork in a larger quantity; unfortunately she does not have enough capital to improve her business. Therefore, she is requesting a loan of IDR 4,500,000 from Kiva's partner, TLM. She would like to use the loan to purchase more beef, pork, ingredients and “kusambi” wood (a kind of wood used to produce a special taste in beef and pork).

loans.use: To purchase beef, pork, ingredients and “kusambi” wood

loans.name: Kenjekan's Group

texts.en:
Kenjekan is the leader of this group. She is 71 years old, and unfortunately she is a widow.  She has raised two sons and three daughters, all of whom are married. 

In order to earn money for their livelihood, the family cultivates agricultural products. They grow potatoes, wheat and barley. Their monthly profits depend on the quality of the harvest, but usually Kenjekan earns about 10,000 Kyrgyzstani soms per month.  

With the money received from the loan, Kenjekan wants to purchase fuel and hire labor for collecting the harvest.  In the future she would like to provide her grandchildren with a good education.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase fuel and hire labor for collecting the harvest.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 48 years old and married with five children.  With one child in school, Anita works very hard to provide for her children.

Anita runs a variety store in the Philippines and has requested a 29,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, etc.

She has been in this business for twenty years and sells a variety of items such as spices, detergent bars, sardines, oil, etc. 

In the future Anita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in her variety store.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a 36-year-old business lady, and she is married with one child.  She has been raising poultry for the past two years with a monthly income of 10,000 KES, which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her second loan with KADET after repaying the previous loan successfully.  Victoria will use the loan to buy poultry feed and additional chicks. 

With the anticipated profit from her business, she will expand the poultry pen so that the chickens can be comfortable.  She hopes to own a big poultry farm that will help her improve her family's living standard.

loans.use: to buy poultry feed and additional chicks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more goods for the shop like soap, beans, rice and posho (maize flour) to resell.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is a 64-year-old widow with eight children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Fe has a food vending business in the Philippines. Fe requested a loan of 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Fe has been in this business for 24 years. In the future, Fe would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Rosalind

texts.en:
Rosalind is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines.

She is borrowing 29,500 PHP through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Rosalind has been in this business for 6 years. Rosalind earns more income from buying and selling charcoal.

Rosalind has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Elena

texts.en:
Ma. Elena is 30 years old. She is married and has two children.

Ma. Elena works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell.

Ma. Elena has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 7 years, and she also earns income from buying and selling charcoal and from raising pigs.

Ma. Elena aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell.

loans.name: Florenda

texts.en:
Florenda is 71 years old. She is married and has three children.

Florenda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, such as shampoo and groceries, in her sari-sari store.

Florenda has borrowed and paid twenty-four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 12 years and also earns income from selling ready-to-wear clothing.

Florenda aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Adham

texts.en:
Adham is a 25-year-old married man and father of one child. He owns a small restaurant in Metn, where he serves delicious chicken sandwiches.

Adham is a hard worker. Planning to make his own career, he started this business three years ago, after he stopped working at a fish shop. He improved his restaurant over the past three years. Adham loves his business a lot, and he puts effort into expanding it.

Adham requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to buy new machines needed for his business, such as a chicken broasting machine. He would also like to increase his restaurant's merchandise with extra mayonnaise, ketchup, pickles, and other things that can be kept for a long time and saved in big quantities.

Adham hopes to expand his business by opening a new branch in the future.

loans.use: to improve his restaurant by increasing his machines and merchandise.

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Perlita works hard to support her family.

She has a dried fish business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling of seafood.  Perlita is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to purchase fresh fish to process into dried fish for her business.

Perlita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 23 loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream which is to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fresh fish to process into dried fish.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 23 years old and an enterprising business man.  He is single but helps his siblings and his parents.  He has been a cobbler for the past two years with a monthly income of KES 6,600 which he uses for his basic needs.

He is applying for his sixth loan term with KADET after repaying the previous loans successfully.  Patrick will use the loan to buy leather material for making shoes. 

With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his siblings.  His hopes and dreams are to open a wholesale shoe shop which will help him improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: to buy leather material for making shoes.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 41 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family.  Judith buys and sells rice in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 22000 loan through NWTF to buy more sacks of rice to sell.

Judith has previously borrowed and paid 16 loans from NWTF.  She has been running her rice business for 18 years and she also earns an income from raising pigs.

Judith aspires to save money and to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 62 years old and married with six children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Gloria runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her sari-sari store.

Gloria has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as noodles, sugar, soap, canned goods, bread, etc. 

In the future, Gloria would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a tricycle transport business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase tools and equipment for her tricycle transport business.

Josephine has been in this business for two years. Josephine earns more income from selling sand & gravel.

Josephine has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase tools & equipment for her tricycle

loans.name: Donny

texts.en:
Donny is a 35-year-old man who is married to Lea, a 36-year-old lady. They have one daughter named Helen who is seven and is studying at the second grade of Primary School. 

Donny runs a used clothing business. He has been operating the business since 2002. Donny rented a small room in the market to display his products. He is assisted by his wife in running the business. He usually operates the business from 8 am to 5 pm.

Donny dreams of improving his business to enable him to generate more income for his family but he doesn’t have enough capital to do so. This is the reason that leads him to seek a loan from TLM. Donny got information from TLM’s field officer on the Individual Lending Program. He then submitted a loan application to TLM and requested a loan of IDR 5,000,000. He wants to spend the loan on used clothing to be sold. Donny hopes that TLM will approve his loan application.

loans.use: To purchase used clothing to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corrugated iron sheets to roof his house.

loans.name: Ma. Nanie

texts.en:
Ma. Nanie is 39 years old and married with five children. With one child in school, Ma. Nanie works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Nanie runs a sari sari (general)  store in the Philippines and requested a 13,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like shampoo, groceries, etc., in her sari sari store.

Ma. Nanie has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, shampoo, toothpaste and other groceries. 

In the future, Ma. Nanie would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like shampoo and groceries.

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Mary Jean works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from food vending. Mary Jean is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Mary Jean has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Venera's Group

texts.en:
Venera is the treasurer of this group. She is 37 and married to a joiner. Together with her husband, she brings up three daughters, all of whom are at school. Venera works as a flute teacher at the music school. A year ago, with an initial investment of 20,000 soms she started to sell grocery goods at home. Her monthly profit from the trade is 5,000 soms. She applied for the loan because she needs additional financial funds to purchase sugar, oil and macaroni for trade. In the future with the profits gained from the trade, Venera wants to purchase furniture to improve the family’s living conditions.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135
