If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, oil and macaroni to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy printing materials and pay her college fees.

loans.name: Helenita

texts.en:
Helenita is 44 years old and has 2 children. She is married and one of her children is in school.

Helenita is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Helenita requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has been raising pigs for 18 years now, and has borrowed 15 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Helenita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Deo

texts.en: Deo is 36 years old, married with five children aged nine months to 14 years. He is the sole bread winner for his family that lives in Hioma, Uganda. He has a motorcycle business and has been running it for the past two years. His major challenge is the rainy season which disrupts his work. His dream is to have at least three motorcycles in the next five years. Deo needs the loan to buy a motorcycle for his transport business.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for his transport business.

loans.name: Nicanora

texts.en:
Nicanora is 45 years old and married with 5 children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a ready to wear business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell, like pants, towels, blouses, etc..

Nicanora has borrowed and paid back 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the ready to wear business for 20 years and also earns an income from rice retailing. She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell.

loans.name: Bernadet

texts.en:
Bernadet is 36 years old and lives in South Poblacion, Larena, Siquijor, Philippines.  She is married with three children.

To earn a living, Bernadet has a business selling food and snacks.  She earns about 1,500 PHP each month doing this type of work. Bernadet has requested a loan for 15,000 PHP to purchase assorted ingredients for her food vending business.

Bernadet has been a member of the Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for eight months.  In the future, Bernadet would like to have brighter future for her children and be able to pay the tuition fees for school.

loans.use: to purchase assorted ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is married with four children. She is 44 years old and lives in Olo, Siquijor, Philippines.

Nelly sells assorted grocery items in her small store to earn a living and has had this business for six months. Each month, she earns 1,500 PHP net income doing this type of work.  She has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase more stock for her general store.
  
Nelly has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for eight months.  In the future, Nelly hopes to have more savings from the income of her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cattle for resale.

loans.name: Chreb

texts.en: Chreb, 38 years old, buys rubber for resale and earns an income of 10 USD per day. Her husband is a farmer, plants yams to sell and his income is 7 USD per day. This couple has three children; one is studying and the other two are working in the factory each earning 3.5 USD per day. Every month, she has to spend 101 USD on food, 8 USD on electricity, 15 USD on school fees, and 25 USD on transportation. She would like to request a loan of 1,000 USD to buy rubber to resell. This loan will help her family to be able to continue their careers and buy more rubber to sell when her income improves. She wants to send her children to study at the university in Phnom Penh.

loans.use: to buy rubber to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy rice, flour, sugar and salt.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay school fees.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses is 44 years old and married with six children, living in his own house in Masindi, Uganda. He dreams of educating all his children to higher levels of education. Moses operates a butcher shop and he has been in the business for three years. Moses started by working for someone and after accumulating enough savings from his wages, he started his own. Hardships in the business include delays in payment by some debtors and his dream is to set up a meat processing plant. Moses needs the loan to buy cows for his butcher shop.

loans.use: To buy cows for his butcher shop.

loans.name: May

texts.en:
May is a 38-year-old single, hard working woman. She opened a mobile shop in 2003 and she has improved it a lot since that time. 
May insisted on establishing this business to make her own career path and to prove herself as a good businesswoman. She improved her shop a lot during the past years and is working on improving it more, through a loan requested from A. Majmoua. Kiva's partner, in order to increase her mobiles and recharge cards capitA. and take advantage of speciA. offers currently offered by her vendors.

Her shop is in a very important area. Not only neighbors or relatives are her customers, but people passing by have a part in her income.
She has been an A. Majmoua borrower for four consecutive cycles, and she's a borrower with a good standing history. May is a woman with very good customer service, the smile never leaves her face. She's also a shy person as most of her customers describe her. May hopes to open another branch in the future.

loans.use: To purchase mobile and recharge cards for resale

loans.name: Gulzodahon's Group

texts.en:
Gulzodahon is the leader of this group. She is 28 and married to a builder. Her husband works in Russia and each month he transfers to Gulzodahon about 15,000 soms. She takes care of a daughter and a son; both children are preschool age (under seven). Gulzodahon works as a teacher at school. Her monthly salary is 9,000 soms. In order to earn additional money for the family budget, the family cultivates agricultural products. With money received from the loan, she wants to purchase onion seeds and mineral fertilizers. In the future, Gulzodahon plans to rent a piece of land for farming and purchase a vehicle.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase onion seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy alcohol to resell.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 29 years old, married and blessed with two children. He operates a boutique to earn a living for his family. Besides this, he does farming for more income generation. With the income he gets from his business, he is able to pay for his family’s expenses, including educating his two children.

John hopes to expand his business into a wholesale one in the future for more income generation. He needs 100,000 Kenya shillings to buy shoes, shirts and trousers.

loans.use: To buy shoes, shirts and trousers.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en: Alex is a 37-year-old married man with four children. He is living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. The responsibility of looking after the family is vested in him, and his desire is to set up a sustainable income-generating activity for the family. For nine years, he has been dealing in agricultural produce, specifically selling maize and beans, and this has facilitated him in meeting his family's needs. His major challenge is the seasonal nature of the business, and his dream is to set up a food store. Alex needs the loan to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.use: to purchase beans and maize for resale.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en: Miriam is 38 years old and blessed with one child who goes to school. She practices dairy farming to earn a living.  Apart from dairy farming, she supplies sand for more income generation. She has four years of experience in the business. Her desire is to grow her business and employ people. Miriam hopes to find a wider market where she can supply milk and sand. She needs a loan of 70,000 Kenya shillings to build rental houses.

loans.use: To build rental houses

loans.name: Rauf

texts.ru:
Рауф добрый и честный человек. Он занимается транспортными услугами на местном городе. В данном бизнесе он занимается один, супруга домохозяйка. Он имеет 2 детей, и его старший сын уехал в Россию на заработку. Младший сын тоже занимается транспортными услугами, а также иногда помогает отцу. Он уже второй раз запрашивает займ от Имон Интернэшнл, имеет хорошую репутацию и кредитное досье. Тот займ позволил ему  расширить его бизнес и максимизировать свой прибыл. Рауф запрашивает займ на сумму 2000$ США для покупки нового автомобиля с целью расширения бизнеса. Он благодарна всем заранее за помощь и доброты.   

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Rauf is a kind and honest person.  He is involved in transportation services in the local town.  He works in this business alone, as his wife is a homemaker.  He has two children, and his oldest son left to work in Russia.  The youngest son is also involved in transportation services and also sometimes helps his father.  This is the second time Rauf is requesting a loan from Imon International; he has a good reputation and credit history.  Previous loan helped him to expand his business and maximize his profit.  Rauf is requesting a loan in the sum of $2000 for the purchase of a new car with the goal of expanding his business.  He thanks all in advance for the help and kindness.

loans.use: to buy a car

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret needs the loan to buy mulch and fencing materials. She is a 32-year-old single mother of two children living in her own house in Kyenjojo, Uganda. She desires to build a permanent house and educate her children. She grows bananas and raises animals. She has been in business for 10 years. Hardships encountered include diseases and unpredictable seasonal changes and her dream is to become a model farmer.

loans.use: to buy mulch and fencing materials

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy foodstuffs.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is married with three school-aged children. Julieta is 36 years old and lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

To earn a living, she owns and operates a retail store at home and has had this business for one year. Her husband works as a carpenter but by project only and is absolutely not working permanently. The couple is working together to reach their dream of giving a proper education to their children and having spare time for family bonding. For all the hard work exerted by the couple, each month they earn a total of PHP 800. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 from GDMPC to purchase additional store inventory to continue serving the community members and earning in return.

Julieta is a longtime member of GDMPC, since 2007 specifically. She successfully paid in full her previous loan of PHP 5,000. In the future, Julieta hopes to sustain business operations and save a portion of her monthly earnings for future needs. She plans to repair their house to live comfortably.

loans.use: To purchase additional store inventory.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 48 years old and lives in Kinangay Norte, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Gloria has engaged in a motorcycle transport business to make a living. It helps her too to lessen the transportation cost when there is an important matter to undertake. Other income of the family is derived from raising pigs, in which she makes a good return. These businesses have allowed her to earn approximately 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) each month, considering all sources of revenue. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 from GDMPC to repair the existing engine and continue the business operations.

Gloria is a GDMPC member who joined this year. In the future, Gloria hopes to increase the number of pigs she raises and widen their shelter for convenience. She has plans for house improvement as well to have a comfortable place to live.

loans.use: To repair the existing engine.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase onions.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en: Alexander is 26 years old and single.  For three years, he has been using his bicycle to supply wire mesh, sand papers, paint brushes and tape measures.  He joined a group in Faulu Kenya where he is able to save his money, share business ideas and access loans easily because the members of the group guarantee each other's loans.  This has helped him to become more business oriented. Alexander hopes to open a hardware shop in five years.  He has requested 40,000 Kenyan shillings to buy brushes, wire mesh and tape measures.

loans.use: To buy brushes, wire mesh and tape measures.

loans.name: Mariam's Group

texts.en:
Mariam’s group is comprised of four hard-working women. Mariam is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala east region of Uganda.  She is married and has three children. All of her children are currently in school. Mariam has a small retail shop business, which she has had for seven years.         

To help expand her business, Mariam has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase essential commodities like sugar and soap for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Mariam hopes to generate greater profits and buy new clothes for herself.  In the future, Mariam hopes to own a plot of land. Mariam is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase essential commodities like sugar and soap for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase traditional, high-quality cloth (pagnes wax).

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy "wax" cloth.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Faa Yaa Wende Group

texts.fr:
Mme Mariam est la représentante du groupe FAA YAA WENDE. Elle est célibataire et mère de 02 enfants. Le plus âgé a 11ans et le moins âgé a 05ans. Les 02 vont à l’école. Elle a 05 personnes en charge.

Elle fait la coiffure depuis 15ans et s’est fait représenter sur la photo par la trésorière qui vend des draps. L’argent va servir pour la coiffure. Elle s’approvisionnement dans les différents marchés. Ses clients sont les femmes et les filles.

Elle veut s’acheter des mèches, des produits de beauté, des casques et des lave-tête.

Mme économise pour de la famille. Elle ambitionne de bonne choses pour son affaire et pour la famille.
texts.en:
Mariam is the representative of the FAA YAA WENDE group. She is the single mother of 2 children aged 11 and 5, both of whom go to school, and she is responsible for the upkeep of 5 dependents in total. Mariam has been a hairdresser for 15 years. She is represented in the picture by the group's treasurer, who sells sheets.
The loan will be used to fund her hairdressing business, which caters to girls and women. She gets her supplies from various markets and needs to restock on hair extensions, beauty products, hairdryers and shampoo basins. Mariam is saving up for her household and has big ambitions for her business and family.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions, beauty products, hairdryers and shampoo basins.

loans.name: Naume

texts.en:
Naume, a 21-year-old woman who lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala east region of Uganda, has had a business selling soft drinksfor the past three years. To help expand her business, Naume has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda to purchase more sodas for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, she hopes to generate greater profits and buy food for her family.  

Naume is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to save money. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase sodas for resale.

loans.name: Everlyn

texts.en:
Evelyn, a 33-year-old single woman, has been selling shoes and bags for six years. Because of the business management training conducted by Faulu Kenya, she has learned how to effectively manage and improve her business. Evelyn's hard work and determination have also been important factors in her success.

Now requesting a loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings to buy more shoes, Evelyn hopes to expand her business and become a successful business lady.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Hurihan's Group

texts.en:
Hurihan, the 55-year-old wife of an ecology inspector, is the leader of this group. She and her husband have raised a daughter and a son, the later working for an NGO, providing free consultations to the population on human rights, while their daughter, formerly a school teacher, went to work in Russia this year.

In order to earn additional money to meet their daily needs, Hurihan breeds livestock and cultivates agricultural products, earning about 2500 soms per month. With money received from the loan, she wants to purchase more livestock for breeding, and future profits will be used to improve the family’s living conditions.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase more livestock.

loans.name: Doan

texts.en: Doan, who was born in 1983, is married to a driver and the mother of a small child. Since 2006 she has participated in SEDA for agricultural loans, her last one for 6,758,000 Vietnamdong (vnd), and always meets her repayment schedule punctually. Doan now wants to raise pigs to earn more money and so is requesting a loan of 8,502,000 VND to buy pigs and food for them.

loans.use: to buy pigs and pig feed.

loans.name: Philomena

texts.en: Philomena, a 68-year-old widowed mother with a 25-year-old son, has been a farmer for the past 20 years, earning a monthly income of KES 8,000 which she uses to support her family. Having repaid her previous loan, Philomena is requesting her second loan with KADET LTD to buy fertilizer and seedlings. Her hopes and dreams are to buy land for farming and educate her son up to university level.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is 27 years old, married with two children, and lives in a rented house in Masindi, Uganda. The responsibility of looking after the family rests on him and his future plan is to buy land and build his own house and also start a business for his wife.

Alexandar sells local brew ("waragi") both retail and wholesale and has been in this business for five years. He started by buying one jerrycan and it would take three days to get finished but now he buys thirty jerrycans and sells it all within three days. The hardship encountered in the business is impassable roads while transporting the jerrycans from the villages and his dream is to buy a motorcycle to ease his transport.

The purpose of the loan facility is to buy jerrycans of local brew for sale.

loans.use: To buy alcohol to sell.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en: Married to a fireman and coach, Juliana sells "minerals" (soft drinks) at Akotokyir near Abura. Juliana has received senior high education. She has been in this business for five years and has five children. She assists her husband to provide the basic needs of the home such as food and clothing. Her loan will be used to buy more soft drinks to retail. She anticipates reinvesting the increase back into the business.

loans.use: to buy more soft drinks to retail.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en: Amina retails saucepans, aluminium pans, plastic containers, and others at Abura. She is a single parent taking care of four children. Having to feed, clothe and educate her children has not been easy, so she wants to increase her sales by buying more saucepans and aluminium pans to retail to get more income. She hopes to invest her increased capital into her children's education.

loans.use: to buy more saucepans and aluminium pans to retail.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline has been selling second-hand clothes for the last six years in Kiambu town. She is 41 years old and married to Waithaka. They have three children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by a KADET client. This will be her first loan. She intends to use the loan to add to her stock of trousers, shirts and sweaters.

In future Caroline hopes to buy piglets for rearing and also a dairy cow.

loans.use: to add to her stock of used trousers, shirts and sweaters.

loans.name: Araba

texts.en: Araba is a peddler of different types of clothes at Akotokyir. She is divorced and has four children. Her business is four years old. She sees to the well-being of her home. Her loan will be used to buy clothes to expand her business. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards building a shop.

loans.use: to buy clothes to expand her business.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is 49 years old and a single mother of a 26 year old. 

She runs a retail shop to earn a living. She has operated the business for 11 years. She also sells second-hand clothes to earn extra income. Previously, she owned a grocery.

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has grown her business. Her desire is to grow her business into wholesale.  

She needs a loan of 40,000 KES to buy rice, sugar and maize flour.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar and maize flour.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is 36 years old and married. He has five children and lives in his own house in Masindi, Uganda.

His family goal is to build commercial houses in town.

Alex operates a bakery and has been in business for ten years. He started with limited capital, buying products in small quantities, but now he is able to buy in cartons. 

Hardships in the business include daily price changes and the high cost of production. In spite of this, he wishes to expand his bakery to be able to supply the whole of the country.

The purpose of the loan is to buy baking flour, cooking oil, sugar and baking powder.

loans.use: To buy baking flour, cooking oil, sugar and baking powder.

loans.name: Nargizahon's Group

texts.en:
Nargizahon is the leader of this group. She is 38 and married to a constructor. He earns about 5,000 KGS per month. Her husband is a retiree, and he also gets a monthly pension 1,800 KGS. Nargizahon has two daughters and a son, all of whom study at school. 

In order to earn additional money Nargizahon breeds livestock and then resells it at a higher price after being fattened. In this way she contributes an additional 5,000 KGS per month. This profit made it possible to repair the house. 

With money received from the loan, she wants to purchase sheep for breeding, fattening and further reselling. In the future, Nargizahon plans to celebrate her daughter’s wedding.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line: people (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase sheep.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick operates a provisions shop at Akotokyir. Patrick attended a commercial school. A commercial school is a place where individuals are equipped with formal training on how to go into small business. Her husband sells electrical parts. 

Her loan will be used to buy provisions to expand her business. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to provide a meaningful education for her children.

loans.use: to buy provisions to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy salt, sugar, soap and soda for resale.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: In the photo, Efua is shown with some white sacks containing maize which she purchases in bulk and retails in both bulk and small quantities. A mother of two children, Efua is requesting a loan to add to her existing capital to acquire more bags of maize to sell to her customers. She eventuallty hopes to build a storeroom for the maize.

loans.use: to acquire more bags of maize to sell.

loans.name: Maame

texts.en: Maame is married and has 2 children. She has been through junior high school. She sells clothes and panties at Akotokyir, a village in Abura. This is a business that she has had for 11 years. Her husband is a driver. The income she makes from her sales is added to that of her spouse to take care of the children. The loan money, when received, will be used to purchase other kinds of clothes to bring variety into the business.

loans.use: to purchase other kinds of clothes to bring variety into the business.

loans.name: Mahmud

texts.ru:
Махмуд образованный, трудолюбивый и добросовестный человек. Он женат и любящий отец 2 детей. Более 5 лет он занимается купля продажей продукты питания. Он имеет арендованный магазин на своем селе. У него много постоянных клиентов, которые часто заходят за покупками продуктов. Он приобретает товар у других рынка районов по дешевле, чем у местных рынках. Его отец помогает ему по данному бизнесу. Он получает дополнительный доход от переработки абрикосов, получает зарплату и пенсия родителей. Махмуд хотел бы получит займ в размере 2500$ США для покупки широкого ассортимента продукта. Заранее Махмуд благодарен всем за поддержку и милосердие. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Mahmud is an educated, hard-working and conscientious person.  He is married and is a loving father of two children.  He has been involved in buying and selling food products for over five years.  He has a leased store in his village.  He has many loyal customers, who often stop in to buy food products.  Mahmud buys his products from other district markets cheaper than at the local markets.  His father helps him in this business.  Mahmud receives an additional income from processing apricots, receives a salary and his parents' pension.  He wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $2500 for the purchase of a wide assortment of products.  Mahmud thanks everyone in advance for the support and mercy.

loans.use: to buy food products

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en: Yaa is showing a bar of soap. She sells a lot of things in her provisions shop. She is married and has 4 children. Her business is about 15 years old. Her husband works with the prisons office in Cape Coast. Yaa supports her husband to take care of the general needs of the home. She will use the loan to purchase provisions to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Yaa plans to save, to build another shop.

loans.use: to purchase provisions to sell.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 32 years old, married and has two children. She runs a retail shop to earn a living for her family. She has been in the business for three years.  With the income for her business, she is able to pay her family's expenses, including educating her children.  

Emma hopes to expand her business into wholesale in the future so as to employ people. She needs a loan of 40,000 KES to add stock of cooking fat, sugar, soap and maize flour.

loans.use: to add stock of cooking fat, sugar, soap and maize flour.

loans.name: Zilolahon's Group

texts.en:
Zilolahon is the leader of this group. She is 23 and divorced. She is raising her three year old daughter. The daughter goes to a kindergarten. 

Zilolahon works as a teacher at school, in order to earn her livelihood she cultivates cotton. She applies for the loan because she needs money to purchase mineral fertilizers for cultivating cotton. In the future, Zilolahon wishes to provide her daughter with a good education.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua sells plastic containers and bowls at Akotokyir. She is married and has 2 children. Her husband works with the transport office at University of Cape Coast. Ekua has been selling plastic containers for 7 years. She assists her husband in taking care of the home. Her loan will be used to buy plastic bowls to sell. She anticipates to reinvest her increased income back into the business.

loans.use: to buy plastic bowls to sell.

loans.name: Maame

texts.en:
Maame sells panties, ladies underwear, jewelries and others items. She sells by moving from one place to another at Akotokyir, near Abura. Maame has an educational background up to the junior high level. She is married and has 2 children. 

Maame has been selling panties and jewelry for 7 years. Her income is added to that of her husband’s to take care of the home. Her loan will be used to buy jewelry to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a shop.

loans.use: to buy jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa is married and has 6 children. She sells panties and kenkey at Akotokyir, which she has done for 10 years. Her husband is involved in farming. Adjoa uses her income to assist her husband in paying school fees and utility bills. Adjoa will use the loan to buy maize in bulk, to make kenkey to sell. Shown in the photo are corn dough and the maize she uses for the kenkey.

loans.use: to buy in bulk, maize to make kenkey (maize dumplings) to sell.

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en:
Akosua is married and has 1 child. She has received junior high education. She cooks plain rice and serves it with tomatoes sauce at Akotokyir, which she has done for 10 years. 

Akosua wishes to expand her business and needs a loan to acquire more bags of rice and other ingredients to be able to cook in larger quantities. Her business plan for one or two years is to be able to build a better eating place.

loans.use: to acquire more bags of rice and other ingredients to be able to cook in larger quantities.

loans.name: Maigul's Group

texts.en:
Maigul is the leader of this group. She is 33 years old and married. Together with her husband she is raising three sons. The older son goes to school and the other two sons are in kindergarten. 

Three years ago with an initial investment of 20000 soms, Maigul opened a grocery store. She is applying for a loan because she needs additional money to increase the commodity turnover of her business. She wants to purchase beverages, macaroni, oil, sugar, etc. In the future, with the profits gained from the trade, Maigul plans to open one more store in their village.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase beverages, macaroni, oil, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Bayarmaa

texts.en:
Bayarmaa is 53 years old and lives with her son and husband in a two-room apartment in Han-Uul district of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. Her husband is currently in South Korea, visiting their eldest son. She started her business, a tailor and fashion salon, about 4 years ago. Beforehand she used to work at the Mongolian Fashion Palace as a designer. She has many years of experience. 

Bayarmaa is a diligent and hard working woman who says "Although I had good work as a designer at Fashion Palace, it was my dream to have my own business and start it. But now, I have many regular clients who come here often to receive my service. I am glad I did it." She receives uniform orders from Nachin Zaan, non-bank financial institution. She is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more sewing materials and cloth for the uniforms.

loans.use: To purchase more sewing materials and cloth.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a 29 year old business lady. She is married to Josphat who is a P.V.S driver. They are blessed with one child, aged 12 years. 

Lucy has been running green grocer business in an open air market for the past ten years with the monthly income of KES 10,000, which she uses to support her family. She has applied for her second loan term from KADET LTD., after repaying the previous loan successfully. Lucy will use the loan to buy vegetables and fruits to add to her stock.  

With the anticipated profit from the business, Lucy will expand the business by renting a house. Her hopes are to open a retail shop, to educate her child up to university level and to improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fruits to add to her stock.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 23 years old and single. To earn a living, he repairs phones to earn a living. He has been operating the business for four years. He started his business immediately after finishing school.  

Through Faulu Kenya, he has grown his business. Nowadays, he has a busy day with customers. Peter hopes to fully establish his business in five years.  He has requested 40,000 KES to buy mobile phone spare parts.

loans.use: to buy phone spare parts.

loans.name: Munkh-Erdene

texts.en:
Mr.Munkh-Erdene, 37 is a taxi driver and he lives with his wife and sons in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been running his taxi business since 2009. His family make Mongolian national boots, by hand, and they sell them to the customers. 

Munkh-Erdene deeloped a wool allergy 3 years ago, so he started a his taxi business. Now it is a main income source of income for this family. Recently he needs to change the some parts and make repairs to his taxi car, because it has become bad and dangerous to use. Munkh-Erdene is taking a loan to purchase some spare-parts for his car to continue his business.

loans.use: to purchase some spare-parts for his car, to continue his taxi business.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a thirty eight year old married man. He has three children and he owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He is charged with the responsibility of looking after the family. He has been in the agricultural sector for ten years. 

John started his business by harvesting two bags of maize in season and now he harvests sixty bags. His hardship is low production in dry season and his vision is harvesting one hundred bags per season. He also has a goal of educating his children. John needs the loan facility to buy maize, beans and soya beans for planting.

loans.use: to buy maize, beans and soya beans for planting.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua sells gari and maize, all in bags, at Krofofordo near Abura. She is divorced and has 2 children. Ekua has been selling bags of gari and maize for 10 years. She responsibly sees to the well-being of her home. Her loan will be used to buy more bags of maize and gari to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more bags of maize and gari (ginger) to sell.

loans.name: Dagvadulam

texts.en:
Dagvadulam, 47, has been working as a doctor for 19 years, and during this time, she could save not enough for her family. She lives with her husband and three children in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia, and owns a small piece of land in the slum district. Her husband is a driver in a private transportation company.
 
Dagvadulam and her husband want to start another business that can increase their family income, and they decided to build a rental garage on her land. It will be a very beneficial business in Mongolia, because Mongolian winter is freezing cold and every car needs a garage with heating. She plans to build a garage to hold four or five cars, and she will gain benefits from this in November. 

Now she needs some money to build her garage. Therefore, she is requesting a loan to buy the building materials to start her garage-renting business.

loans.use: To buy building materials to start her garage-renting business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to obtain additional bags of charcoal to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy drugs for resale.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi is divorced and has one child. She has been through junior high school. 

Esi prepares Fanti kenkey and retails it to her customers. According to her, her kenkey business is about 15 years old. Both ordinary and Fanti kenkey are dumpling-like staples made from corn. The difference between ordinary and Fanti kenkey is that with Fanti kenkey, the dough is wrapped in dried plantain leaves. 

Esi will use the loan to buy more bags of maize. Her profits will be reinvested back into the business.

loans.use: to buy more bags of maize.

loans.name: Amira

texts.en:
Amira is a 55-year-old married woman who has sold socks as wholesale and retail since 1990.

Amira helps her husband in making their living, she works hard on improving their situation as much as she can.

She requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to increase her capital with new socks collection with good prices, highly requested by parents for the school season, She has been an Al Majmoua borrower for nine cycles, with a perfect paying back history. All of her previous loans helped a lot in improving her business and her social and financial situations.

Amira hopes to expand her business more and more in the future.

loans.use: To purchase a new socks collection to sell for the back-to-school season

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi sells Fanti kenkey at Krofofordo. (Fanti kenkey is a dumpling-like staple made of maize with a plantain leaf wrapper.) 

She is divorced and has three children. As a single parent, she feeds, clothes and educates her children with the income she makes from her sales. 

Her loan will be used to buy bags of maize to make kenkey. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save enough to provide a meaningful education for her children. In the photo, the dried leaves close to her are used to wrap the corn dough before boiling.

loans.use: to buy bags of maize to make kenkey.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en: Anita is married and stays with her husband and five children. Her husband is a farmer. She attended senior high school. Anita sells rice water (rice porridge) and meat pie at Krofofordo, which she has done for some time now. Anita supports her husband to feed their children. Anita will use the loan to purchase rice, sugar, flour, and other items to promote the sale of the food. With the new earnings, Anita plans to reinvest back into the business.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, flour, and other items for food sales

loans.name: Dolzodmaa

texts.en:
Dolzodmaa is 38 years old and lives with her two children, husband and mother in a ger, Mongolian yurt, in Han-Uul district of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. Her husband works at the construction company and decorates houses and apartments. 

Dolzodmaa started her business about 2 years ago by making cloth bags. She earned her BA in fashion design and sewing technology in Kirkiz in 1992. She worked as a tailor at the Temuujin-Minj LLC after her graduation. Her family used to live and work in South Korea, but they returned back to Mongolia after suffering from some illness. Since then, Dolzodmaa is continuously making cloth bags. She is planning to make bed sheets and baby blankets in the future. She is requesting 600,000 MNT loan to purchase materials and a new sewing machine for her business.

loans.use: To purchase materials and a new sewing machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase baskets of salted fish to distribute to her customers

loans.name: Araba

texts.en:
Araba is a widow and has four children. She sells food items such as maize, salted fish, garden eggs, plantain and others. The items she sells are displayed in this photo, on Araba's right-hand side. She has been in this business for seven years.
 Araba is responsible for the well-being of her home. Her loan will be used to buy a variety of food items to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards building a house.

loans.use: to buy a variety of food items to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bags of maize to prepare kenkey.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, oil and other ingredients to bake and fry for sale.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther operates a provisions shop where she sells soaps, pampers, drinks, milk, toothpaste, and other items as seen in the shop at Krofofordo. She is married, and as part of her responsibilities towards the home she feeds the household. Her loan will be used to buy provisions for retail sales. She hopes to use the new revenue from her business to save towards the education of her unborn children.

loans.use: to buy provisions for retail sales.

loans.name: Kutuma

texts.en: Kutuma is into multiple businesses such as the sale of secondhand clothes, provisions, and soft drinks at Krofofordo near Abura. Kutuma has received a junior high level education.  She is married and has two children. Her loan when acquired, will be invested into the sale of secondhand clothes by obtaining more secondhand clothes to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: to obtain more secondhand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy yams and provisions to sell.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi sells Fante kenkey at Krofofordo. She is a widow and has four children. As a single parent, she feeds, clothes, and educates her children with the income she makes from her sales. Her loan will be used to buy bags of maize to make kenkey. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to provide a meaningful education for her children.

loans.use: to buy bags of maize to make kenkey.

loans.name: Javzmaa

texts.en: Javzmaa is 49 years old and lives with her two children in a ger, Mongolian yurt in Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. Her two children are both college students. She started her business in 1990 by selling flour and rice at the local market. Now she owns two sales containers in which she sales the products. She is planning to expand her business in the near future. She is a diligent and hard-working woman who says, "I really want to expand my business and increase my profits." She is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to increase her turnover capital and purchase more flour.

loans.use: To purchase more flour

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more oil, rice, pepper, and soda for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fresh fish to smoke for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy salted fish and palm fruits to sell.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort is married and has two children. She has been through senior high school.
Comfort operates a provisions shop and sells soft drinks as well. She uses her income to support her husband in educating, feeding and clothing her children. She will use her loan to purchase more soft drinks to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Comfort plans to reinvest back into her business for further growth.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy soft drinks.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 32 years, married and blessed with two children. He has been operating a cafeteria for one year. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to grow financially. He also does farming to earn extra income for his family.  
His desire is to grow his business and meet his customer’s demands. He needs a loan of 15,000 Kenya shillings to buy solar cooker for personal use.

loans.use: To buy a solar cooker

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 20 year old single man who opened a grocery store in May 2006. Mohamad finished his Intermediate education and started his small business with the help of his father who gave him his initial capital. He didn't enjoy school life as much as he enjoys business.
Mohamad is an Al Majmoua borrower. This is his second cycle. His previous loan was requested for improving his business just like this one. Through this loan, Mohamad is going to buy extra cereal, detergent and preserved food.
Most of his customers are friends and neighbors, they support him a lot through being his loyal customers, at the same time he provides them with the best customer service.
He intends to expand his business more and more in the future, through adding new products to attract more customers.

loans.use: to buy cereal, detergent and preserved food for sale

loans.name: Mayanja Rural C Group

texts.en:
Michael is the facilitator for Mayanja Rural C Group.  He and his co-group members joined One Acre Fund in 2010.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important farming inputs to distribute to Michael and his group during Kenya's next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund's integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

Michael joined One Acre Fund in order to ensure food security for his family, and to be able to pay school fees.  In the recent 2011 harvest, John harvested 10 bags of maize on 1/2 acre of land.  Before joining One Acre Fund, John had only been able to harvest 5 bags of maize from 1/2 acre of land.  

With the profits from his harvest, Michael will invest in his children's education, and livestock.

In 2012, the group members will plant a total of 4 acres of land with One Acre Fund, each farmer planting 1/2 acre.

Michael can be identified in the photo above wearing his facilitator lanyard (blue).  On the far left of this photo is Michael's Field officer, Tom.

loans.use: to ensure distribution of farm inputs, such as fertilizer and seeds, at low prices during the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Josphat

texts.en:
Josphat is 34 years old, married and has two children in school. He runs a curio shop so as to earn a living for his family. He has operated the business for two years and has employed two people. He has retained his business through the financial support from Faulu Kenya.  
His desire is to fully stock his shop so as to meet his customer’s demands.  He needs 15, 000 Kenya shillings to buy a solar lamp for lighting his house.

loans.use: To buy a solar lamp

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more sacks of water, juices, sugar and flour for her business

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 49 years old and blessed with two children who go to school. She has been running a grocer shop for only one year. She also does livestock farming to generate more income so as to meet her family’s needs. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has grown financially. 
Elena hopes to grow her business and open other business outlets in the future. She has requested for 9,000 Kenya shillings to buy a solar lamp for lighting her business and her house.

loans.use: To buy a solar lamp

loans.name: Rahimchon

texts.ru:
Рахимчон целеустремлённый и добросовестный человек. Он женат и отец 3 детей. Он старается, чтоб его дети выросли образованными и хорошими людьми, и чтоб работали в хороших кампаниях и открыли свой собственный бизнес. Рахимчон занимается ремонтам и продажей автомобилей. Он покупает автомобилей из первых рук, а затем продает на выгодную цену. Он отремонтирует и красит сам, который позволить ему уменьшать расходы для ремонта автомобиля. Ему помогает его братья. Он начинал свой бизнес год назад с мелкого ремонта машин и в настоящее время владеет частном мастерском на местном городе. Рахимчон хотел бы получит займ в размере 3000$ США для покупки автомобиля.  Он заранее благодарит всех, кто поддерживает его. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Rahimchon is a goal-oriented and conscientious person.  He is married and is a father of three children.  He tries to ensure that his children grow up to become educated and good people, and that they could work in good companies and opened their own businesses.  Rahimchon is involved in repairing and selling cars.  He buys cars first-hand and then sells them at a more profitable price.  He repairs and paints cars himself, and this allows him to reduce car repair expenses.  His brothers help him.  He started his business one year ago with small car repairs and now owns a private repair shop in the local town.  Rahimchon wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $3000 for the purchase of a car.  He thanks everyone who supports him in advance.

loans.use: to purchase a car

loans.name: Saidchon

texts.ru:
Саидчон женат и любящий отец 3 детей. Он добрый и целеустремленный человек. Более 11 лет он предоставляет услуги ремонта автомашин. В данном бизнесе помогает ему его отец, и они вместе работает дома. Он имеет специальное рабочее место на своем доме. Он имеет много клиентов, а также хорошую репутацию среди людей. Саидчон хочет расширить свой бизнес и максимизировать свое прибыль. Саидчон запрашивает займ для покупки автозапчастей для ремонта автомашин. Он заранее благодарит всех вас за вашу помощь и поощрение.

To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Saidchon is married and is a loving father of three children.  He is a kind and goal-oriented person.  He has been providing an auto repair service for over 11 years.  His father helps him in this business, and they work together at home.  Saidchon has a special work area at his house.  He has many customers and also has a good reputation among people.  Saidchon wants to expand his business and maximize his profits.  He is requesting a loan for the purchase of auto parts for auto repairs.  He thanks all of you in advance for your help and support.

loans.use: to purchase auto parts

loans.name: Inoyatkhon

texts.ru:
Иноятхон умная, добросовестная и трудолюбивая женщина. Она замужем и любящая мать 3 детей. Её муж уехал в Россию, чтобы зарабатывать деньги, а она сама кормить и обеспечивает своих детей. Она свою торговую точку на местном рынке, там где много народов. Он продает женские ткани, а также шторы. Она хотела бы получить займ в размере 1475$ США для покупки нового ассортимента тканей и шторы. Она хочет заранее благодарит Киву и Кива кредиторы за их поддержку и доброты.

texts.en: Inoyatkhon is a smart, conscientious and hard-working woman.  She is married and is a loving mother of three children.  Her husband left to go to Russia in order to earn money, and she supports and provides for her children on her own.  She owns a retail outlet in a well-traveled area of the local market.  Inoyatkhon sells women's fabrics and also drapes.  She wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $1475 for the purchase of a new assortment of fabrics and drapes.  She wants to thank Kiva and Kiva creditors in advance for their support and kindness.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and drapes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a solar lamp

loans.name: Haidarboi

texts.ru:
Хайдарбой целеустремленный и честный человек. Более 6 лет он занимается купля продажей скот. Он начал свой бизнес с куплей продажей крупного рогатого скота и получил хороший прибыль. Приобретая грузовую автомашину, он начал заниматься транспортной услугой, а его отец помогает ему откармливать скот дома, когда он на работе. За полученные прибыли он недавно построил однокомнатный дом. На рынке ему все доверяет, и ценят его. Даже из Республики Киргизии к нему приезжает за покупками скот.  Хайдарбой хотел бы получить кредит в размере 1500$ США для покупки овец с целью расширения бизнеса. Он заранее хочет благодарит вас за вашу помощь и доброты.

texts.en: Haidarboi is a goal-oriented and honest person.  He has been involved in buying and selling livestock for over six years.  He started his business with buying and selling cattle and made a good profit.  Having bought a truck, he started to provide transportation services.  His father helps him feed livestock at home, when Haidarboi is at work.  Haidarboi used his profits to recently build a one-bedroom house.  Everyone trusts and values him at the market.  Even people from the Kyrgyz Republic come and buy livestock from him.  Haidarboi wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $1500 for the purchase of sheep in order to expand his business.  He wants to thanks you in advance for your help and kindness.

loans.use: to purchase sheep

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en: Mohammed is 31 years old and lives in Barnersville. He is married and has a 1 year old child at home. He is a high school graduate. For the past two  years, he has been selling soap, milk, batteries, toothpaste, and tissues in his community. He make a lot of profit, especially during the raining season. He is requesting a loan to purchase more soap, milk, batteries, toothpaste, and tissues for his business. He plans to build a house in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more soap, milk, batteries, toothpaste, and tissues for his retail business

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 54 years old, married and with two children who go to school.  To earn a living, he runs butchery.  He has been in the business for two years and has employed two people.  He also does dairy farming for more income generation.  He has improved his business with his previous loans from Faulu Kenya.
John hopes to improve his business and meet his customers’ demands comfortably.  He has requested for a loan of 9, 000 Kenya shillings to buy a solar lamp for lighting his house.

loans.use: To buy a solar lamp

loans.name: Amos

texts.en:
Amos is 22 years old and single. He runs a shop selling electronic goods to earn a living. He has been in the business for two years and has employed one person.  Previously, he used to operate a hardware shop. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has grown his business and has learned how to save his money.

His desire is to grow his business into wholesale in the future.  He has requested for 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy mobile phone accessories for resale.

loans.use: To buy mobile phone accessories for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more drinks (soda, beer and energy drinks) for her business

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is 24 years old and single. He has been employed as a driver for two years. With the income he gets, he is able to provide for his needs. He joined Faulu Kenya after he was introduced by a friend. Through Faulu Kenya, he has been trained on business management and he has been able to manage his finances by saving.
Geoffrey is now inspired to start a taxi business. Hence he has requested for 20,000 Kenya shillings.

loans.use: To start a taxi business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy maize & beans for sale

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en: Fredrick is 41 years old married with 5 children aged 12-2 living in his own house in Hioma, Uganda. He has been operating a medical clinic for a period of 4 years and the business is progressing steadily. He faces a challenge of debtors who do not want to pay in time which affects the business returns. He hopes to set up a pharmancy in future. Fredrick needs the loan facility to buy drugs for sale.

loans.use: to buy medicine for sale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy bags of peppers and onions to add to her business

loans.name: Abdallah

texts.en: Abdallah is a 38 year-old married man with four children living in a semi permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. His dream is to build a permanent house for his family. He has been operating a food store for ten years and he has been able to pay school fees for his children with his proceeds. His major constraint has been seasonal variations that lead to inadequate supplies to meet the demands of customers. Abdallah needs the loan to buy maize, cassava and millet flour for resale

loans.use: To buy maize, cassava and millet flour for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy bags of ground nuts and gallons of palm oil to add to her business

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 35 years old and lives in the town of Kibuli in the Kampala South region of Uganda. He is married and has 3 children. For the past 5 years, Francis has been working hard to manage his small shop, which sells sugar and soap. 

To help expand his business, Francis has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase supplies like sugar soap for resale, and will help Francis to generate greater profits and expand his business. Francis hopes that in the future he will be able to open another business. 

Francis is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Francis who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase supplies like sugar and soap for resale

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 50 years old and lives in the town of Kibuli in the Kampala South region of Uganda. He is married and has 3 children with 1 of them currently in school. For the past 5 years, Charles has been working hard to manage his small shop, which sells hardware. 

To help expand his business, Charles has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase hardware supplies, and will help Charles to generate greater profits and expand his business. Charles hopes that in the future he will be able to open another business. 

Charles is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Charles who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase hardware supplies

loans.name: Go Before Group

texts.en:
Meet with members of the “Go Before” group from Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva to apply for a loan of 500,000 SLL for each. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. 

Hawa is the leader of this group. A native of Manso village, the 35-year-old is a widow with 4 children. Hawa has been a businesswoman for 5 years now, she sells shoes. Hawa has requested loan in order to buy shoes in large quantity for sale.

loans.use: to buy shoes in large quantity for sale

loans.name: Lovinsa

texts.en:
Lovinsa is 48 years old and lives in the town of Kibuli in the Kampala South region of Uganda. She is single and has 5 children, with 2 of them currently in school. For the past 10 years, Lovinsa has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells fish at the local market. 

To help expand her business, Lovinsa has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchases fish for resale and will help Lovinsa to generate greater profits and hiring more workers. Lovinsa hopes that in the future she will be able to start another business. 

Lovinsa is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Lovinsa who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase fish for resale

loans.name: Berna

texts.en:
Berna is 39 years old and lives in the town of Makindye in the Kampala South region of Uganda. For the past 10 years, Berna has been working hard to manage her clinic, which offers health services. 

To help expand her business, Berna has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more medicine for resale and will help Berna generate greater profits and sustain her family. Berna hopes that, in the future, she will be able to build her own hospital.

Berna is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Berna who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more medicine for resale

loans.name: Naome

texts.en:
Naome is 28 years old and lives in the town of Ggaba in the Kampala South region of Uganda. She is married and has three children who are all currently in school. For the past two years, Naome has been working hard to manage her retail shop, where she sells sugar, soap, and cooking oil. 

To help expand her business, Naome has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan shillings from Kiva field partner BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase sugar, soap, and cooking oil for resale, which she hopes will allow her to generate greater profits and improve the quality of life for her family. Naome hopes that in the future she will be able to transform her shop from a retail business to a wholesale operation. 

Naome is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Naome who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, soap, and cooking oil for resale

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is 32 years old and lives in the town of Ggaba in the Kampala South region of Uganda. She is married and has three children with two of them currently in school. For the past three years, Jackline has been working hard to manage her wholesale shop, which sells assorted goods. 

To help expand her business, Jackline has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more goods like soap for sale, and will help Jackline to generate greater profits and improve the standard of living for her family. Jackline hopes that in the future she will be able to expand the business to a point where she can open another branch. 

Jackline is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Jackline who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more goods like soap to sell

loans.name: Ndèye Dior

texts.fr:
Commercante elle vend des habits au marché et envisage d'ouvrir une cantine avec les bénéfices cumulés pendant ses activitées.
Actuellement elle a une place au marché grand thiés et elle s'approvisionne a dakar au marché HLM avec ces 30 ans d'expérience elle compte ouvrir une cantine
texts.en: Ndèye Dior is a merchant, who sells clothes at the market. She's considering opening a small shop with the profits accumulated from her business. Currently, she has a spot at the Grand Thiès market and gets her supplies in Dakar, at the HLM market. She has 30 years of experience in her business.

loans.use: to buy clothes in order to bolster her stock

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Lucia es una comerciante de Ropa y helados, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos, su negocio es la venta de helados (charamuscas, choco bananos, paletas) en su casa y la escuela cercana además vende ropa de forma ambulante.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de paletas, bananos, chocolate, y ropa, con el préstamo considera mejorar la condición de su negocio.
Lucia quiere mantenerse en el negocio, con el apoyo de préstamos para mejorar la condición económica de la familia.
texts.en:
Lucia sells clothes and frozen treats.  She lives with her husband and two children.  Her business is selling frozen treats ('charamuscas' - frozen juice treats, 'choco bananos' - frozen bananas dipped in chocolate, and 'paletas' - ice pops made from fresh fruit).  She sells her products from home and in a nearby school.  She also sells as an itinerant street vendor.

Lucia is requesting a loan to buy ice pops, bananas, chocolate and clothes.  She would like to use her loan to improve her business.  Lucia would like to remain in business and use the support of these loans to improve her family's financial situation.

loans.use: to buy ice pops, bananas, chocolate and clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy Nacacol (a black dye), clay and firewood

loans.name: Manuel Abel

texts.es:
Manuel de 26 años, vive con su familia en su casa propia, no cuenta con servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Túcume que pertenece al departamento de Lambayeque.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la agricultura, ganadería y turismo (cuenta con sitios arqueológicos).

Manuel cuenta con su propia moto carguera, en la que se dedica al transporte de sacos de menestras, las mismas que lleva al mercado para comercializar desde hace unos 3 años, al observar que su negocio está creciendo a creído conveniente solicitar un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para la compra de más menestra para seguir comercializando y brindar mantenimiento a su moto carguera para seguir brindando un buen servicio de transporte y con los ingresos que obtenga podrá brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.


Manuel es una persona con muchas ambiciones en la vida, con el único objetivo de sacar adelante a su familia y darles otras oportunidades de estudios a sus hijos, para que puedan lograr sus metas en un futuro.
texts.en:
Manuel is 26 years old, lives with his family in his own house, with no running water or electricity, located in a rural zone of the district of Túcume which belongs to the department of Lambayeque. This zone is known for agricultural and farming activities, and tourism. (There are archaeological sites.) 

Manuel has his own motorcycle cargo carrier, and works transporting sacks of beans, and for 3 years he has carried his beans to market to sell. Since his business is growing he decided that this is a good time to ask for a loan of 1000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa in order to buy more beans to sell and to maintain his motorcycle cargo carrier in order to have a good transport service and with the money he borrows he can provide a better quality of life for his family. 

Manuel is a person with many ambitions in life, with the only objective being to obtain a better future for his family and give his children opportunities to study so that they can achieve their goals in the future.

loans.use: to buy more beans to sell and to provide maintenance to his motorcycle cargo carrier

loans.name: Elizaphanie

texts.en:
Elizaphanie is a father of a three-year-old child. He is 41 years old and he sells animals such as cows and goats and also foods such as beans and rice.
He has been doing this business for the past seven years and his business is going on well. This business has improved his standards of living. He needs a loan to buy more animals and food stuffs in order to make more food stuffs.

loans.use: to buy animals and food stuff for sale.

loans.name: Digna Mercedes

texts.es:
Digna, administra una tienda, está casada vive con su esposo y dos hijos D. 22 y 10 años D. edad, ella trabaja en su vivienda, atendiendo el negocio.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra D. estantes y vitrina para el negocio, esta inversión le dará una mejor vistosidad al negocio, ya que podrá lucir sus productos para los clientes.
Esta inversión le ayudara para superarse, a través del esfuerzo y el préstamo podrá conseguir una mejor condición.
texts.en:
Digna manages a store, is married and lives with her husband and 2 children who are 22 and 10 years old. She works in her home, attending to the business.

She is asking for a loan in order to buy shelves and cabinets for the business. This investment will improve the physical appearance of the business, and she will be able to show off her products to the customers.

This loan is going to help her move ahead, and through her strength, and with the loan she will be in a better economical position.

loans.use: to buy shelves and cabinets for the business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cassettes and DVDs

loans.name: Maria Jose

texts.es: Maria José se dedica a la venta de refrescos y frijoles cosidos. Tiene más de 3 años con su negocio, por lo que disfruta de tener un ingreso diario. Su negocio lo inicio con el objetivo de ayudar a los ingresos del hogar. Es una persona muy tranquila y disfruta de tener este medio de vida para poder sobrevivir. El crédito que solicita es para la compra de frijoles, bolsas, frutas, azúcar, hielo entre otros productos necesarios. Sueña con mejorar sus ingresos cada día de una manera muy humilde y luchadora.
texts.en:
Maria José sells soft drinks and cooked beans. She has been in this business for more than 3 years, and she enjoys having a daily income. She started her business with the aim of helping with household expenses. She is a very calm person and enjoys having this way of life in order to survive.

She is asking for this loan in order to buy beans, bags, fruit, sugar, and ice among other things she needs. In the way of a humble warrior she dreams of increasing her daily income.

loans.use: to buy beans, bags, fruit, sugar, and ice among other things

loans.name: Iliana Guadalupe

texts.es: La Sra. Iliana es  una persona  responsable  y  muy  trabajadora la  cual se preocupa   por  sacar   adelante a   su  familia  y  brindarles  un  patrimonio , su  mayor  sueño  es  terminar   la construcción de  la  barda  de  su  casa   ya  que   comenta  que actualmente  tiene  una  barda  muy   bajita,  ve   en  el crédito  la posibilidad  de concluir  con su proyecto brindando a  su  familia una  mayor  seguridad.
texts.en:
Iliana is a responsible and hardworking person whose only concern is to provide a good future for her family and give them financial security.

Her greatest dream is to finish the construction of her fence at her home and she tells us that now she has a very low fence. This loan will allow her to finish the project offering her family better security.

loans.use: to finish constructing a fence

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is a hard-working business woman aged 48. She is married and blessed with four children. She has been managing a greengrocery to bring up her family.
