Her business is located in a strategic place. People on their way to the hospital pass by and many buy her goodies. She sells Mondays to Sundays in the mornings and afternoons. 

Edis will use the loan she is asking for to expand her business. She needs to buy a table and chairs and make a small kiosk to be able to sell all day and into the night.

loans.use: to buy a table, chairs, zinc sheeting, wood, nails and screws.

loans.name: Jocotal Group

texts.es:
El grupo El Jocotal lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es la señora María Lucrecia de 49 años propietaria de una pulpería donde comercializa arroz, frijoles, azúcar, pollo, jabón…etc. desde hace 14 años con su propio esfuerzo y luego empezó a prestar para aumentarlo.
Las otras integrantes son Nelly Susana de 35 años quien vende cosméticos, cremas, champú y desodorante y Lila de 25 años compra y vende pan desde hace 3 años.
texts.en:
The communal bank "El Jocotal" is comprised of three hard-working women entrepreneurs, one of whom is Mrs. María Lucrecia, 49, who runs a grocery store.  She sells rice, beans, sugar, chicken, soap, etc. and has been in business for 14 years.  She started out with her own capital but has taken out loans to expand her activity.

The other members are Nelly Susana, 35, who sells cosmetics, creams, shampoo and deodorant, and Lila, 25, who buys and sells bread for a living.  She has been in business for three years.

loans.use: To buy basic grains and other products to increase business.

loans.name: Selvin Mauricio

texts.es:
El señor Selvin Mauricio se dedica desde hace 04 años al negocio de transporte (taxi) y en su casa tiene una pulpería en donde vende todo lo relacionado a la canasta familiar, su pulpería es atendida por un familiar mientras el todo los días sale desde muy temprano a la calle a buscar clientes que llevar en su taxi.
Selvin utilizara el credito para compra de computadora de su carro, tiene problemas con la misma y el carro esta fallando, en estos momentos lo tiene parado y no puede estar sin percibir esas ganancias ya que son las que utiliza para cubrir los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Selvin Mauricio been in the taxi transportation business for four years. He has a grocery store in his house where he sells all sorts of household goods. His family runs the store while he goes out early every day looking for passengers to taxi. 

Selvin plans to use his loan to buy a computer for his car because his has problems and the car is breaking down. At this point the car is not working and Selvin can't be without the income because he needs it to cover household expenses.

loans.use: to buy a car computer.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana, tiene la edad de 43 años, es viuda, y vive con su hija que tiene 9 años, y  estudia, ella es su mayor prioridad. Ella tiene una pequeña  granja de gallinas ponedoras por lo que tiene mucha experiencia en el manejo de estas aves. Quiere  comprar más pollas y alimento para las mismas y así poder aumentar su producción y mejorar sus ventas y obtener más ganancias ya que cuenta con muchos clientes fijos. . Ella es el primer  préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. También, ella no ha realizados otros préstamos en bancos estatales o instituciones financieras. FUDECOSUR le brindó el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de interés es mucho más baja. Ella también tiene el deseo de brindarle a su hija la educación necesaria  para que sea en el futuro una persona preparada  y pueda enfrentar de manera más fácil la vida teniendo una carrera profesional.
texts.en:
Ana is 43 years of age.  She is widowed, and lives with her 9-year-old daughter who is in school.  She is her main priority.

She has a small farm of laying hens, as she has a lot of experience with these birds.  She wants to buy more hens and food for them, and so be able to increase her production, improve her sales, and generate more earnings, as she has many unswerving customers.

This is the first loan that she has received from FUDECOSUR.  She has also not taken other loans from the state banks or financial institutions.  FUDECOSUR is providing her the loan with better terms and much lower interest rates.  She also wants to provide her daughter the necessary education so that in the future, she can be well prepared and be able to easily face life with a professional career.

loans.use: to buy laying hens and food for them

loans.name: Eder

texts.es:
Eder de 27 años, vive con su familia en su casa propia, cuenta con sólo servicio de luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de La Arena que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Zona de actividad agrícola y ganadera.

Eder cuenta con su negocio propio de preparación y venta de refrescos y sanguches, la cual lo tiene en el interior del mercado de la zona donde vive, actividad que realiza desde  hace algunos años, cuenta con su propia clientela, es conocido en la zona donde vive por la limpieza y la buena atención que tiene con sus clientes, con los ingresos que adquiera podrá solventar sus gastos  familiares.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para comprar insumos y utensilios para continuar preparando sus refrescos y sanguches, para  seguir brindando un buen servicio a sus clientes y con sus ganancias cubrir su crédito otorgado y mejorar su calidad de vida.  Eder con su trabajo y sus ganas de salir adelante se ha ganado la confianza de sus clientes, con la finalidad de que más adelante tenga un negocio más grande con una variedad en los productos que ofrece para seguir ayudando económicamente a su familia.
texts.en:
Eder is 27 years old and lives with his family in their own home. The house has electricity and is located in the rural district of La Arena in the department of Piura. This is an agricultural and livestock area.

For some years now, Eder has had his own business making and selling soft drinks and sandwiches in his local market. He has established a clientele and  is known locally for his cleanliness and the good service he provides his customers. The income he generates allows him to pay for household expenses.

He has requested a loan for 2,000 nuevos soles from Kiva Field Partner, Edpyme Alternativa, to buy supplies and utensils to continue preparing his drinks and sandwiches and to keep providing good service to his customers. He will use  the profits to repay the loan and improve his quality of life. His work and his desire to succeed have earned Eder the trust of his customers. His aim for the future is to have a bigger business offering a variety of products, so that he can continue helping his family financially.

loans.use: to buy supplies and utensils to continue preparing his drinks and sandwiches.

loans.name: Lluvia De Amor Group

texts.es:
El grupo Lluvia de Amor lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es la señora Ninoska Carolina  de 26 años quien es comerciante ambulante de plata y artesanías desde hace 4 años. Ella con el comprar mercadería de plata y artesanía con el fin de salir adelante.
Las otras integrantes son Xiomara  de 42 años quien desde hace 20 años vede especies y plantas, y Luisa Emilia  vende plantas desde hace 10 años.
texts.en:
The "Lluvia de Amor" ('Rain of Love") group is made up of three hard-working and enterprising women.  

One of them is Señora Ninoska Carolina, she is 26 years old and has been working as a street vendor selling silver and handicrafts for the last four years.  With the loan, she will buy silver and handicrafts merchandise, with the end goal of getting ahead in life.

The other members are Xiomara, aged 42, who has been selling herbs and plants for the last 20 years, and Luisa Emilia, who has been selling plants for the last 10 years.

loans.use: to buy silver and handicraft items.

loans.name: Los Amigos De La Flor Group

texts.es:
El grupo los amigos esta integrado por dos hombres y una mujer que se conocen muy bien desde hace mucho tiempo y están trabajando juntos para salir adelante, este grupo se califica por ser bien unido, todos ellos viven en la misma comunidad, el señor Mario Reynell se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tiene una pequeña pulperia en su casa de habitacion, sus clientes son sus vecinos y otras personas aledañas a dicha comunidad, el credito lo utilizara para la compra de abarroteria y asi surtir su negocio. Asi mismo la sra. Valentina y el señor Santos Agustin se dedican a la venta de ladrillos y leña.
este grupo solicita el credito para surtir su negocio y comprar los materiales para la fabricacion de los ladrillos, de esta manera tener mejores ganancias y darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus familas.
texts.en:
"Los Amigos de la Flor" group consists of 2 men and a woman who have known each other very well for a very long time. They work together to be successful. This group describes itself as very united. The members all live in the same community. Señor Mario Reynell sells popular consumer products. He has a small grocery store room in his house. His customers are his neighbours and others who belong to the community. He will use the loan to buy groceries to stock his business. In a similar fashion, Señora Valentina and Señor Santos Agustin sell bricks and firewood.

This group is asking for the loan to stock their business and buy the materials to manufacture bricks to improve  their earnings and give their families a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy groceries and materials to manufacture bricks.

loans.name: Cintia Marilin

texts.es:
Cintia de 26 años de edad, vive en su casa propia con su esposo e hijo, la cual cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.   Esta zona se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería y artesanía.

Cintia desde hace algunos años se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral (cerdos, ovejas y aves), sus corrales se encuentra en la parte posterior de su casa, los cuales son apropiados y amplios, los alimenta con comida balanceada, pastos y granos naturales para que sus animales lleguen a tener un crecimiento óptimo para poderlos ofrecer en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así obtenga buenas ganancias para solventar sus gastos de su hogar.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles  para la compra de alimento balanceado para sus animales, con las ganancias que obtenga con la venta de sus animales podrá cubrir su crédito como tener una mejor calidad de vida.  Cintia es una mujer que con esfuerzo y mucho empeño a sabido salir adelante junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Cintia is 26 years old. She lives in her own home with her husband and child, where they have only electricity (no running water).  Their home is located in the rural area of the Tambogrande district which is part of the Piura department.  This area focuses on agriculture, livestock and handicrafts.

For the last several years, Cintia has been working raising and selling farmyard animals (pigs, sheep and poultry).  Her farmyard is located in the rear of her home, and is of a suitable size and condition.  She feeds the animals with balanced animal feed, grass and natural grains so that her animals will reach an optimum size for selling in the different markets in the area, and so she can generate good earnings to cover her household costs.

She has requested a loan of 1,000 New Soles from Edpyme Alternativa for the purchase of balanced feed for her animals.  With the earnings that she will generate with her animal sales, she will be able to cover the loan as well as have a better quality of life.

Cintia is a woman who has been able to move herself and her family ahead in life through effort and much determination.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed for her animals.

loans.name: Las Nicaragüenses Group

texts.es:
El grupo las nicaragüenses lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras, originarias de Masaya. La coordinadora del grupo es la señora Nemesia quien se dedica al destace de cerdo y la producción de sus derivados frito, chicharrón, moronga, nacatamal…etc. 

Con el crédito ella comprará cerdo para su negocio y materia prima maíz, chiltoma, cebolla, leña…etc.

Las otras integrantes son Ana Rosa tiene una pulpería en su casa y Ana del Socorro tiene una pequeña pulpería.
texts.en:
The "Las Nicaragüenses" group is made up of three hard-working and entrepreneurial women, who are originally from Masaya.

The group coordinator is Señora Nemesia, who works in pork butchering and making pork products: scratchings, blood sausage, nacatamal (corn, meat and rice in a banana leaf), etc.

With the loan, she will buy pigs for her business and raw ingredients such as corn, sweet peppers, onions, firewood, etc.

The other members are Ana Rosa, who has a small general store in her home, and Ana del Socorro, who has a small general store.

loans.use: to buy pigs for butchering.

loans.name: Elmer Eudoro

texts.es:
Eudoro de 55 años de edad, vive con su familia en su casa propia, la cual no cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.   Esta zona se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería y artesanía.

Eudoro desde hace 8 años se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral (ovejas y cabras), sus corrales se encuentra en la parte posterior de su casa, los cuales son apropiados y amplios, los alimenta con comida balanceada y pastos naturales para que sus animales lleguen a tener un crecimiento óptimo para poderlos ofrecer en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así obtenga buenas ganancias para solventar sus gastos de su casa.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles  para la compra de alimento balanceado para si
us animales, con las ganancias que obtenga con la venta de sus animales podrá cubrir su crédito como tener una mejor calidad de vida.  Eudoro es una persona que con esfuerzo y mucho empeño ha sabido sacar adelante a su familia, brindándoles otras comodidades.
texts.en:
Eudoro is 55 years old. He lives with his family in his own house, which has only electricity. The house is located in the rural district of Tambogrande which belongs to the department of Piura. This area is known for its agriculture, livestock and crafts.

Eudoro has worked in the rearing and sale of livestock (sheep and goats) for 8 years. His corals, which are suitable and large, are located at the back of his house. He feeds the animals with nutritionally balanced food and fodder so that his animals reach their optimum size. Then he can put them up for sale at the different markets in the area and thus obtain a good profit to cover his household expenses..

He has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1000 nuevos soles (PEN) to buy nutritionally balanced food for his animals. With the profits he will obtain from the sale of his animals, he will be able to cover his loan as well as have a better quality of life. Eudoro is a person who with a lot of hard work and effort has managed to raise his family, providing them with other comforts.

loans.use: to buy nutritionally balanced food for his animals.

loans.name: Carlos Luis

texts.es: Carlos Luis, tiene la edad de 62 años, es casado, y vive  con su esposa que es de la misma edad, ella es su mayor prioridad. El tiene una pequeña  fábrica  de  abono orgánico el cual utiliza para producir hortalizas de manera orgánica y así proteger el ambiente. Quiere  comprar materia prima, mangueras y una bomba para tener mejor calidad de agua.  Su idea es producir más hortalizas ya que tiene mucha demanda y poderle vender abono orgánico a otros productores.  Él es el primer  préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. Hace varios años tubo préstamo en banco estatal. Pero en la actualidad FUDECOSUR le brindó el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de interés es mucho más baja. El también tiene el deseo de brindarle a su esposa mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Carlos Luis, 62 years old, is married and lives with his wife of the same age. She is his biggest priority. He has a small business producing organic fertilizer and growing organic produce, which helps protect the environment. He'd like to buy raw materials, hoses, and a pump so he can have higher-quality water. He plans to grow more produce to meet increased demand and to sell fertilizer to other growers. This is the first loan he's received from FUDECOSUR. A few years ago he did receive a loan from a government bank, but FUDECOSUR has now offered him a loan with a much lower interest rate. He would also like to offer his wife a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to produce organic fertilizer.

loans.name: La Perla Group

texts.es:
El grupo la Perla lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras, el coordinador es el señor Denis de Jesús quien vende granos básicos y es agricultor. El invertirá el crédito en el cultivo  de verduras como quequisque, chiltoma, pepino, pipian y ayote.
Las otras integrantes son Lucrecia de 63 años quien se dedica a la agricultura  de ayote, pipian, maíz y yuca y la crianza de cerdo; y Gloria Feliciana vende ropa desde hace 4 años.
texts.en:
The La Perla group is made up of the three entrepreneurial workers. The group's coordinator is Mr. Denis de Jesús, who sells grains and is a farmer. This loan will be invested in the cultivation of vegetables such as taro, pepper, cucumber, and squash.

The other members are Lucrecia and Gloria Feliciana. 63-year-old Lucrecia cultivates vegetables such as squash, pipian, cassava and corn, and she also breeds hogs. Gloria has been selling clothes for the past 4 years.

loans.use: to cultivate vegetables such as taro, pepper, squash and cucumber.

loans.name: Anita

texts.es:
Anita D. 43 años D. edad, vive con su familia en su casa propia, la cual no cuenta con servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito D. Mochumí que pertenece al departamento D. Lambayeque.   Esta zona se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería y artesanía.

Anita desD. hace 3 años se dedica a la crianza y venta D. animales D. corral (ovejas y cerdos), sus corrales se encuentra en la parte posterior D. su casa, los cuales son apropiados y amplios, los alimenta con comida balanceada y pastos naturales para que sus animales lleguen a tener un crecimiento óptimo para poderlos ofrecer en los diferentes mercados D. la zona y así obtenga buenas ganancias para solventar sus gastos familiares.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa D. 2000 nuevos soles  para la compra D. alimento balanceado y realizar algunos arreglos D. su corral para sus animales, con las ganancias que obtenga con la venta D. sus animales podrá cubrir su crédito como tener una mejor calidad D. vida.  Anita es una persona que con esfuerzo, empeño y trabajo ha sabido sacar adelante a su familia, brindándoles otras oportunidades en la vida.
texts.en:
Anita is 43 years old.  She lives with her family in her own home, which does not have electricity or running water.  It is located in the rural area of the Mochumí district, which is part of the Lambayeque department.  This area focuses on agriculture, livestock, and handicrafts.

For the last three years, Anita has been working raising and selling farmyard animals (sheep and pigs).  Her farmyard is located right behind her house, and is a suitable size and condition.  She feeds them with a balanced diet and natural grass, so that her animals will reach an optimum size for sale in the different area markets, and she will get good earnings to cover her family's expenses.

She has requested a loan of 2,000 New Soles from Edpyme Alternativa for the purchase of balanced animal feed, and to make several repairs to her animals' farmyard.  With the earnings she will get from the sale of her animals, she will be able to cover her loan, as well as have a better quality of life.

Anita is a person who has known how to mover her family ahead with effort, determination, and hard work, providing them with further opportunities in life.

loans.use: to buy balanced animal feed and make some repairs to her animals' farmyard.

loans.name: Gladys María

texts.es: Gladys María, tiene la edad de 51 años, es casado, y vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos que tienen 12-15-18, años, y todos estudian, ellos son su mayor prioridad. Ella tiene una pequeña tienda desde hace  8 años, por lo que tiene mucha experiencia en ventas. Quiere  comprar algunos artículos de tienda y bazar para aumentar sus ventas y obtener más ganancias ya que cuenta con muchos clientes fijos. Ella es el primer  préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. También, ella no ha realizado otros préstamos en bancos estatales o instituciones financieras. FUDECOSUR le brindó el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de interés es mucho más baja. Ella también tiene el deseo de brindarle a sus hijos la educación necesaria  para que sean en el futuro personas preparadas y pueda enfrentar de manera más fácil la vida teniendo una carrera profesional.
texts.en:
Gladys María is 51 years old, she is married and she lives with her husband her three children aged 12, 15 and 18. They are students and her main priority. She has had a small shop for 8 years and therefore she has a lot of sales experience. She would like to buy some goods and housewares for the shop to increase her sales and yield better profits as she relies on many regular customers.

This is the first loan she has received from FUDECOSUR and she has never had any previous loans from state banks or financial institutions. FUDECOSUR gave her the loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate. 

She would also like to provide her children with the necessary education for them to become qualified for professional careers, making life easier for them.

loans.use: to buy clothes, sandals, perfumes and housewares

loans.name: Marco Tulio

texts.es:
Marco tulio es un microempresario orgulloso de su labor, pues después de haber pasado necesidades económicas y dificultades con su esposa, hoy en día tiene un negocio de comidas muy agradable en la zona del estadio de fútbol ubicado en la ciudad de Medellín en el departamento de Antioquia, su tenacidad es lo que lo ha fortalecido y le ha permitido convertirse en un hombre luchador que a pesar de las dificultades ha querido superarse y salir adelante. 
 
Hoy a sus 61 años sueña con ver crecer aún mas su negocio, haciendo algunas adecuaciones locativas y comprando mas surtido, como gaseosas, comida, fritos, e insumos para vender perros calientes, pero actualmente no cuenta con este capital para invertirle a su negocio, es por este motivo que solicita un préstamo que le permita progresar y sacar su negocio adelante, así mismo mejorar las ventas y proporcionalmente su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Marco Tulio is a small businessman who is proud of his work since, after going through financial difficulties with his wife, today he has a very pleasant food store near the football stadium located in the city of Medellin, in the department of Antioquia. His tenaciousness strengthened him and allowed him to become a man willing to fight who, despite the difficulties encountered, wanted to excel and get ahead.

Today, at age 61, he dreams of seeing his business expand even more by making some location adjustments and buying more supplies such as soft drinks, food, fritos and ingredients for selling hot dogs. However he currently lacks the capital to invest in his business. Consequently, he is requesting a loan that will allow him to progress and move his business forward, thereby improving sales and his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a variety of food supplies and to make location adjustments.

loans.name: La Fe 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Juana is a member of the group called La Fe 3 & 4, "Faith". This group is located in the city of Samana, in a rural community surrounded by mountains and the Atlantic Ocean. These 10 entrepreneurs are running their businesses in their community or in others nearby. 

Juana makes her home here in a simple house with her long-term partner and their two children. This Esperanza associate began with us because she needed to start up a business and with her first loan she started clothing sales. After six loans she has expanded her business into a grocery store. She has had her business for almost three years.

Juana is excited to be taking out her 6th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and expanded her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying rice, beans, sugar, cooking oil, canned food, etc. She will use the profits to reinvest in her business and to proviD. her family with their needs.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, cooking oil, canned food, etc.

loans.name: Olga Zulema

texts.es:
La señora Olga Zulema se dedica a la comercialización de calzado desde hace 5 años, sus ventas son de lunes a domingo, tambien tiene a un familiar que le ayuda a vender sus zapatos ambulantemente en la zona de Caridad Valle. 
Sus clientes son los amigos y personas conocidas que visitan su negocio.
el credito lo utilizara para invertirlo en la compra de calzado escolar ya que por acercarse las fiestas patrias necesita invertir para vender más y aprovechar la oportunidad de lograr más utilidades y reponerse de los días malos en que casi no ha vendido.

Su sueño es que su familia siempre este unida y que su negocio crezca y así lograr mejores condiciones de vida para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Señora Olga Zulema has been working selling shoes for the last five years.  She makes her sales from Monday through Sunday, and also has a relative who helps her by selling her shoes as a street vendor int Caridad Valle area.

Her customers are friends and people she knows who visit the Nacaome market.

She will invest the loan in the purchase of school footwear as the patriotic holidays are approaching.  She needs to invest so as to sell more, and take advantage of the opportunity to achieve more earnings and make up for bad days when she hasn't sold as much.

Her dream is that her family remains united always, and that her business grows so she can achieve better living conditions for herself and for her family.

loans.use: to buy school footwear.

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es:
La señora Maria Guadalupe se dedica a la elaboración de baleadas, pastelitos, pan, enchiladas, tacos y refresco natural, sus ventas son en una esquina de la cuadra donde vive, ahí tiene ubicado su negocio que todos los días desde muy temprano empieza a vender junto con su sobrina,  las baleadas que son su especialidad son consumidas por sus vecinos y personas qué transitan por dicho lugar.

el credito lo utilizara para comprar alimentos para preparar sus deliciosas golosinas.
Su sueño es  que su hija la menor se le gradué de la universidad..
texts.en:
María Guadalupe earns a living preparing baleadas (a Honduran snack in which beans, cheese, eggs, and other ingredients are stuffed in a wheat tortilla), savory pastries, bread, enchiladas, tacos, and fresh-squeezed juices. Her business is on the corner of the block where she lives. Every day, she and her niece open the shop very early and get to work. Her neighbors and passersby enjoy eating her baleadas, which are her specialty.
She will use the loan to buy ingredients for preparing her delicious treats.
Her dream is one day to see her youngest daughter graduate from university.

loans.use: to buy tortillas, beans, flour, pork, beef, chicken, vegetables, lard, oil, condiments, eggs, cheese, and fruit.

loans.name: Daisy Xiomara

texts.es:
La señora Daisy Xiomara se ha dedicado desde hace vario tiempo a la venta de abarrotaría, en su negocio atiende a sus clientes de lunes a domingo desde las 7 AM a las 5 PM, vende todo lo relacionado a la canasta basica familiar al por mayor y al detalle.

Sus clientes son los amigos y personas que visitan a diario el mercado, Daisy tiene una buena forma de atender o tratar a sus clientes, es por esta razón que la prefieren y sus productos se le venden rapido.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de abarroteria, desea tener mas surtido su negocio para obtener mayores ganancias.

Su sueño es que su hijo que esta en los estados unidos este muy bien.
texts.en:
Señora Daisy Xiomara has worked for quite a while selling groceries.  She tends to her customers from Monday through Sunday, from 7 a.m. to 5 p.m.  She sells everything related to basic family needs at wholesale and retail.

Her customers are her friends and people who visit the market daily.  Daisy has a good way of tending to and treating her customers, and for this reason they prefer her, and her products turn over quickly.

The loan will be used for the purchase of groceries.  She wants to have her business better stocked to generate greater earnings.

Her dream is that her son, who is in the United States, does well.

loans.use: to buy beans, rice, sugar, butter, oil, margarine, powdered milk, cereal, oats, honey, cookies, coffee, bread, sodas, fritters, spices, salt, soap, disinfectants, batteries, candles, gas, matches, and eggs.

loans.name: Melida

texts.es:
La señora Melida se ha dedicado casi toda su vida a la venta de abarrotería en su pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación, ahí atendiende a sus clientes con los productos que nesecitan para el consumo diario,  ahí  vende arroz, frescos, jabón, jugos, leche, granos básicos, y mucho mas, 
Sus clientes son los vecinos de su barrio y amigos que le visitan.

el credito lo utilizara para la compra de abarroteria para surtir su negocio, ya que las exigencias de sus clientes son mayores y no cuenta con el capital suficiente para surtirlo.

Su meta es que sus clientes estén satisfechos con su atención.
texts.en:
Señora Melida has dedicated almost all of her life to selling groceries in her small home store.  She provides her customers with what they need for daily use.  She sells rice, fresh foods, soap, juices, milk, basic grains, and much more.  Her customers are her neighbors and friends that visit her.  

She will use the loan to buy groceries to stock her store as her customer's demands are great and she doesn't have sufficient capital to stock it.  

Her goal is to make sure her customers are satisfied with her service.

loans.use: purchase flour, toilet paper, toothpaste, soaps, bleach, floor cleaner, lotions, light bulbs, churros, rice, sugar, butter, oil, margarine, bread, cookies, coffee, and sodas.

loans.name: Elias Samuel Group

texts.es:
El grupo Elias Samuel lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras, el coordinador del grupo es el señor Mauricio Jerónimo  se dedica a la venta de productos básicos desde hace 5 años con unos pequeños ahorro y luego siguió con los préstamos.  El con el crédito invertirá en la compra de granos básicos con el firme propósito de seguir aumentando su negocio.
Los otros integrantes son Gilma Antonia de 25 años desde hace 7 años y María del Carmen de 31 años tiene una pulpería.
texts.en:
The "Elias Samuel" group is made up of three hard-working people.  

The group's coordinator is Señor Mauricio Jerónimo.  He has been working selling basic products for the last five years, which she started with some small savings and later continued through loans.  With this loan, he will invest in the purchase of bulk grains with the end goal of continuing to grow his business.

The other members are Gilma Antonia, aged 25, who has been working for the last seven years, and María del Carmen, aged 31, who has a general store.

loans.use: to buy bulk grains.

loans.name: Manuel Eliezer

texts.es: Manuel usará el crédito para pagar un Postgrado en Contabilidad, ya tiene su carrera universitaria pero desea seguir especializándose, para alcanzar mayor grado profesional. Su madre le inspira a seguir estudiando porque ha trabajado mucho para poder darle una educación, y ahora que ya tiene trabajo le apoya con los gastos del hogar. Las dificultades que tiene son la falta de dinero para poder pagar sus estudios de una vez. Espera poder lograr las metas que se ha fijado en su vida, y está seguro lo logrará a través del estudio.
texts.en:
Manuel will use the loan to pay for a post-graduate degree in Accounting, as he has his undergraduate degree but wants to continue specializing and achieve a higher professional level.

His mother has inspired him to continue studying, as she has worked a lot to be able to give him an education, and currently she has work that helps her cover the household expenses.

The difficulties he faces are his lack of money to be able to pay for his studies.  He hopes to be able to achieve the goals that he has set for his life, and is confident that he will be able to accomplish this through his studies.

loans.use: to pay for a post-graduate degree in Accounting.

loans.name: Mujeres Solidarias Group

texts.es:
Para la formación del presente comité tuvo inicio la señora María, del km 14 Acaray de la ciudad de Minga Guazú.
Ella contactó con sus vecinas y amigas para formar el comité en la zona.
El comité se denomina Mujeres SolidA., están en el Sexto Ciclo con 16  integrantes. Es un grupo muy unido, solidario y responsable, las integrantes poseen un gran espíritu emprendedor, ya que están al día con las actividades de grupo, realizan eventos para la recaudación de fondos para caja chica, como también de motivación, y pretenden terminar esta etapa con muy buen cumplimiento de responsabilidad con la institución. Al adquirir el crédito se le abren muchas puertas para el progreso.
La sra. María se dedica a la venta de comidas y frutas, cuando hace mucho calor hasta prepara ensalada de frutas para postre luego de un rico plato de comida casera que hace, muchos de sus clientes son personas con muy pocas posibilidades de acudir a sus casas para la hora del almuerzo, es por eso que se dedica con mucho esfuerzo y esmero.
Ella desea el préstamo para poder ampliar sus variedades de frutas y a la vez producir más comidas caseras con mayor cantidad de comestibles.
texts.en:
María, who lives at Km 14 Acaray in Minga Guazú municipality, is responsible for forming this group. She contacted her neighbors and friends to form the group in this area.  The group is called "Mujeres SolidA.." They are on their 6th loan, and have 16 members. 

It is a very united, caring and responsible group. The members have a great enterprising spirit. They stay updated on the group's businesses, and do fundraising events for the petty cash fund and to motivate one another. They intend to complete this stage by fully meeting their responsibility to the institution.  Acquiring the loan opens many doors to progress. 

María sells meals and fruit.  When it's very hot, she even prepares fruit salad for dessert, after a delicious plate of the home-cooked food that she prepares. Many of her customers are people with little opportunity to return home at lunchtime, and that's why she devotes a lot of care and effort to her work. She wants the loan in order to expand her variety of fruit, and at the same time, have a greater quantity of foodstuffs to prepare more home-cooked meals.

loans.use: To expand the variety of fruits she sells and buy foodstuffs for making home-cooked meals.

loans.name: Villa De Oro (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Villa De Oro que se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi  conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

Este es un grupo de personas que decidieron unirse y formar este Grupo De Crédito que les va a servir  de mucho ya que con los créditos ellos van a mejorar sus pequeños negocios que tienen. Ellos se dedican a diversas actividades tales como agricultura, comercio en general, servicios, entre otras actividades.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora María, tiene 39 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 22 y 14 años de edad, los dos estudian en universidad y colegio.

Ella en su casa junto a su esposo tienen un negocio en el cual venden carne, legumbres y frutas, nos cuenta que ellos son de Santa Ana pero hace 5 años vinieron a esta linda y gran ciudad en la cual decidieron seguir con el negocio que tenían en su ciudad natal. Su esposo se desplaza al campo a comprar chanchos y vacas, luego los faena en su casa y ahí mismo vende la carne y otros productos que salen de estos animalitos, además de frutas y legumbres que también compra en el campo. Llevan más de 20 años dedicados a esta actividad y les va muy bien ya que venden un producto fresco y eso les gusta a sus clientes.

Este crédito es para comprar chanchos, frutas y legumbres.
 
Su sueño  tener una casa  de cemento y bien construida ya que la que tiene es de caña.
texts.en:
The Villa de Oro communal bank meets twice a month in the canton of Montecristi, which is known for its rich precolonial culture and for its artisan work, which is recognized nationally and internationally. It is the birthplace of the famous Panama hat. 

This is a group of people who decided to unite and form this communal bank that will help them a great deal, since they are going to improve their small businesses with the loans. They dedicate themselves to a variety of activities such as agriculture, general business, and services, among others. 

In this place we meet María, 39 years old. She is married, and she and her husband have two children, 14 and 22 years old. Both are students in high school and college. 

She and her husband have a business in their home selling meat, vegetables, and fruit. She tells us that they are from Santa Ana, but five years ago they came to this beautiful, great city, in which they decided to continue with the business they had in their native city. Her husband travels to the country to buy pigs and cows, which he slaughters at home. From their home he sells the meat and other products from these animals, as well as fruits and vegetables that he also buys in the country. They have been doing this work for more than 20 years, and it is going very well for them, since their products are fresh, and their customers like that. 

This loan is to buy pigs, fruits, and vegetables. 

Her dream is to have a well-constructed cement house, since the one she has is made of cane.

loans.use: to purchase fruits, vegetables, and pigs

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es: Hilda tiene 44 años, es una mujer alegre y muy trabajadora, es madre de tres hijos ya mayores de 26, 22, y 20 años quienes son independientes, aunque viven en su casa que compró junto a su esposo, quien falleció hace algunos meses. El trabajo de Hilda consiste en la compra y venta de ropa, se va a la ciudad de Lima en busca de los últimos modelos. De esa manera cumple con el pedido de sus clientes y al cabo de 15 días realiza la cobranza, entre sus compradores están los amigos, vecinos, familiares. Lleva ya cuatro años en este trabajo, y sola ha logrado cubrir las necesidades de su hogar y para ella misma. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que dispone de mucho tiempo para poder realizar diferentes actividades, le va bien, ya que tiene muchos clientes que le son muy fieles por que les da un buen producto y a un precio muy cómodo. Espera poder mantener ese ritmo de ventas y mas adelante crecer. Este será el tercer crédito con MFP, le gusta mucho su grupo porque se siente que son responsables. Con el monto solicitado, viajará a la ciudad de Lima para comprar ropa exclusiva y de temporada para abastecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Hilda is 44 years old and is a friendly, hard-working woman.  She is a mother of three children who are 26, 22, and 20 and are now independent adults.  She lives in the house she bought with her husband who died several months ago.  Hilda buys and sells clothing for a living and goes to Lima in search of the latest fashions.  This is how she fills her customer's orders and charges them, her friends, neighbors, and family, bimonthly.  She has been doing this for four years and alone she has been able to cover her household and personal expenses.  What she likes about his job is that she has time to undertake different activities.  Things are going well for her as she has a lot of customers that are very loyal because she gives them a good product at an affordable price.  She hopes to be able to maintain this sales rate and in the future, to grow.  

This will be her third loan with MFP.  She likes her group a lot because she feels that they are responsible.  With the amount requested, she will travel to Lima to buy exclusive and seasonal clothing to stock her business.

loans.use: purchase more clothing.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Marielisa Genoveva

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Productivo se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Marielisa, tiene 32 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 9 y 6 años los mismos que estudian en escuela. El marido trabaja en una fábrica en Manta. Ella está desde que se inicio el Banco Comunal y le gusta por los beneficios y créditos adicionales que brinda la institución.

Ella es  una gran ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de ropa por catalogo y productos Avon y Lebel (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja todos días de la semana ya que tiene varios clientes que llegan hasta su casa a comprar sus productos, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada fin de  semana. Tiene cinco años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien, nos cuenta que lo que más vende son los cosméticos y las prendas interiores.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa interior.
 
Su sueño es tener una boutique.
texts.en:
The "Productivo" Communal Bank meets every two weeks in the Montecristi canton, which is well known for its rich pre-colonial culture and its handicrafts which are renowned on a national and international level.  It is where the famous sombreros made from toquilla straw come from.

Señora Marielisa lives here.  She is 32 years old, and lives in a common-law marriage from which she has two children aged 9 and 6, who attend school.  Her husband works in a factory in Manta.  She has been part of the Communal Bank since the beginning, and likes it for the benefits and additional loans provided by the institution.

She looks after the home, and to earn her own spending money, she works selling clothes from a catalog and Avon and Lebel products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and women's accessories).  She works every day of the week, as she has several customers who come to her house to buy her products.  She offers her products on credit, and collects every weekend.

She has been doing this work for five years, and it is going very well for her.  She tells us that what sells most are cosmetics and underwear.

This loan is to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, and underwear.  Her dream is to have a boutique.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, and underwear.

loans.name: San Isidro Group

texts.es:
El comité San Isidro se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de  San Estanislao. Las integrantes formaron un grupo muy unido y capaz de realizar conjuntamente actividades que fortalecen su compañerismo.
La sra. Fidelina es una mujer que gusta mucho del trabajo con animales, por eso se dedica a la cría y posterior venta de estos. Su único deseo es poder brindar a sus hijos una calidad de vida mejor, donde puedan estudiar y trabajar dignamente, sin tener que sufrir tanto las penas que trae la pobreza.
Todas las integrantes son sacrificadas que luchan por un futuro más merecedor de su arduo trabajo.
Por eso solicitan el crédito a los inversionistas de Kiva, para que puedan ir creciendo economicamente, la sra. Fidelina desea poder comprar más animales para el engorde y su posterior venta, la cual sería mejor si se realizara a mayor escala, y eso solo ocurriría si es que se proveen animales como productos a mayor cantidad.
texts.en:
The San Isidro committee was formed by the coming together of various neighbors from the city of San Estanislao.  The members who make up the group are very united and capable of together achieving things that will strengthen their fellowship.

Señora Fidelina is a woman who really likes working with animals, so she works raising and selling them.  Her sole desire is to be able to provide her children with a better quality of life, where they can study and work in a dignified way without having to suffer all the hardships that poverty brings.

All the members are self-sacrificing woman, who are striving for a more worthy future through their hard work.  For this reason, they are requesting the loan from Kiva investors, so that they will be able grow economically.  

Señora Fidelina wants to be able to buy more animals to fatten for subsequent sale.  This will go better if she can do do it on a larger scale, which will only occur if she can procure the animals in greater quantity.

loans.use: to buy animal for fattening for subsequent sale.

loans.name: José Alberto

texts.es:
El señora José Alberto es un hombre trabajador, casado tiene dos hijos una ya Licenciada de 23 años y su hija menor  de 14 años cursa la secundaria. Él se dedica a la venta de perecederos en especial la piña desde hace 20 años en mercado local.  
El invertirá el crédito en la compra de piñas para seguir aumentando su negocio.
texts.en: Sr. José Alberto is a hardworking man who is married and has two daughters: one daughter is 23 and  already a college graduate and the other is 14 and in secondary school. He has been selling perishables, specifically pineapples, in the local market. He will use the loan to buy pineapples in order to continue expanding his business.

loans.use: to buy pineapples.

loans.name: Carmen Jacqueline

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Productivo se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Carmen, tiene 41 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 18, 16 y 12 años, el mayor estudia en universidad y los menores en colegio. Su esposo es chofer.

Nuestra amiga se dedica al comercio pues tiene una tienda de comestibles en su casa, allí también vende artículos de bazar y productos Avon, Lebel y Saysons (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja todos los días desde las 07h00 hasta las 21h00, nos cuenta que allí mismo vende sus otros productos, sus hijos le ayudan en su labor cuando están desocupados. Los productos  para su tienda los recibe en su casa. Tiene cuatro  años que tiene este negocio y a pesar de que tiene poco tiempo la tiene bien surtida para que sus clientes encuentren de todo en su local.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes y cosméticos. Está en el Banco Comunal desde sus inicios  y le gusta porque ha hecho más amigas en el grupo.
 
Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y que su tienda crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
The "Productivo" Communal Bank meets every two weeks in the Montecristi Canton, which is well-known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its handicrafts with are renowned on a national and international level.  This is where the famous sombreros made from toquilla straw come from.

This is where Señora Carmen lives.  She is 41 years old, and is married with three children aged 18,16, and 12.  The eldest attends university, and the younger two are in school.  Her husband is a driver.

Our friend works in retail, as she has a food store in her home.  She also sells stationery items and products from Avon, Lebel and Saysons (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and women's accessories).  She works every day from 7 a.m. through to 9 p.m.  She tells us that she is also selling her other products at the same time.  Her children help her with her work, when they are free.  She keeps the products for her store at home.  She has been working in this business for four years, and in spite of her limited time, she keeps it well-stocked so that her customers can find everything they want in one place.

She will use this loan to stock up her store.  She will buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents and cosmetics.  She has been in the Communal Bank since its beginning, and likes it because she has made more friends in the group.

Her goals are to continue progressing with her business, and that her store grows on a daily basis.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents and cosmetics.

loans.name: Genny Mariana

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Productivo se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Genny, tiene 43 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cinco hijos de 22, 20, 18, 16 y 11 años de edad, los dos mayores ya están casados y los tres menores  estudian en colegio. El marido es albañil.
 
Nuestra amiga además de cumplir un gran papel en el hogar también se  dedica a la venta productos Avon, y Yanbal (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y tiene muchos clientes que les da facilidades de pago, trabaja tres a cuatro  días de la semana más que todo por las tardes ya que a estas horas todos sus hijos están en sus colegios, ella deja a crédito y cobra semanalmente, dice que le encanta vender. Lleva 8 años dedicada a esta actividad y le va muy bien. Lo que más vende son cosméticos y perfumes.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar perfumes, bisutería, cosméticos y cremas pero sobre todo los que están en oferta. Lleva 5 ciclos en el banco comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan los créditos.
 
Sus metas son ver que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
The communal bank Productivo meets bimonthly in the Montecristi canton.  This place is known for its rich, precolonial culture and for its nationally and internationally renown crafts such as their famous straw hats.  

Here lives Señora Genny.  She is 43 years old and with her common-law husband she has five children ages 22,20,18,16, and 11.  The older two are married and the three younger ones are still in school.  Her husband is a mason. 

In addition to playing a major role at home, Señora Genny also sells Avon and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and women's accessories).  She sells door to door and has many customers that she gives easy payment plans to.  She works three to four days a week, mostly in the afternoons as this is when her children are in school.    She gives credit and charges weekly.  She says that she loves to sell.  She has been doing this for eight years and things are going well for her.  She sells mostly cosmetics and perfumes. 

With this loan she is going to buy perfumes, costume jewelry, cosmetics, and creams, above all, those that are on sale.  She has participated in 5 loan cycles with her communal bank and likes the support the loans provide. 

Her goals are to see her children become professionals.

loans.use: purchase perfumes, costume jewelry, cosmetics, and creams.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase corn, three pigs, and seeds for plants.

loans.name: Belgica Margot

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Productivo se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

La señora es Bélgica es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta por los créditos adicionales que les da la institución a las socias que son muy buenas pagadoras. Tiene 33 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos de 12, 10 y 8 años, el mayor estudia en colegio y los menores en escuela. Su esposo es guardia de seguridad.

Ella junto  su esposo han formado una empresa de seguridad, mientras él ofrece el servicio junto  a otras siete personas que ellos han contratado y a quienes les pagan un sueldo mensual por sus servicios, ella se encarga de la parte legal y administrativa de su empresa, mientras que su esposo se encarga de la supervisión y vigilancia. Nos cuenta que llevan ya 8 meses que comenzaron a ofrecer este servicio, que los contratos han aumentado y que su empresa está creciendo con el pasar de los días.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar chalecos y uniformes.
 
Sus metas son que su empresa crezca y seguir ofreciendo sus servicios no solo en su cantón sino también en otras ciudades.
texts.en:
The "Productivo" Communal Bank meets every two weeks in the Montecristi canton, which is well-known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its handicrafts which are renowned on a national and international level.  This is where the famous sombreros made from toquilla straw come from.

Señora Bélgica is a founding member of the Communal Bank, which she likes for the additional loans that the institution gives to members who are good payers.  She is 33 years old and married; she has three children from this relationship aged 12, 10 and 8.  The eldest attends secondary school, and the younger two are in primary school.  Her husband is a security guard.

She and her husband have formed a security business.  They provide service together with seven other people whom they have hired and whom they pay a monthly salary for their services.  She is in charge of the legal and administration side of the business, while her husband is in charge of security supervision and surveillance.  She tells us that they started this business 8 months ago; with their hired staff they have expanded and the business is growing by the day.

She will use this loan to buy vests and uniforms.

Her goals are for her business to grow, and to continue by offering her services not only in her own canton, but also in other cities.

loans.use: to buy vests and uniforms.

loans.name: Fe Y Esperanza 3 Group

texts.en:
Maria is the coordinator of her group Fe y Esperanza (Faith and Hope) 3. This group is located in the city of Samana, a tourist city surround by the Atlantic ocean. Each borrower is running his/her business in the communities near the city. They are selling clothes, shoes, grocery store and other items.

Maria makes her home here in a simple house with her long-term partner. She is living with one of her children. Maria is running a miscellaneous store, where she sells shoes, clothes, cosmetics, beauty products, accessories and other goods. She will use this loan to increase her inventory. She is excited to be taking out her 6th loan with Esperanza, after having successfully repaid her previous loan and expanded her business. 

This Esperanza associate began with us because she needed capital to invest in her business. After some loans, Maria's business has been improving with every investment. She will use the profits to reinvest in her business and to save. She thanks you all for your support!

loans.use: to buy miscellaneous products (cosmetic, clothes, underwear).

loans.name: Juana Araceli

texts.es:
La señora Juana tiene 33 años y es madre soltera de un niño de 4 años de edad. Hace dos meses la señora Juana vio la oportunidad de empezar su propio negocio vendiendo queso y crema en su comunidad ya que en su comunidad no hay tiendas que vendan productos de la canasta básica. La señora Juana se levanta a las cuatro de la mañana para ir a comprar el queso que vende. Para llegar a la avenida por donde pasa el bus en el que se transporta, ella tiene que bajar una colina rocosa, cruzar un rio, y subir otra colina. No hay puente para cruzar el rio, y el recorrido toma unos 20 minutos. Ella llega donde su proveedor a las 5 de la mañana, y compra 30 libras de queso que transporta de regreso a su casa en bus. Una vez en su casa, la señora Juana divide el queso en porciones de 1 libra y los empaca en bolsas individuales. Para vender el queso y la crema, la señora Juana sale de su casa a las 8 de la mañana y camina todo el día de comunidad en comunidad vendiendo sus productos a pie. Le toma 3 días vender las 30 libras de queso que compra. Desde que comenzó con su negocio ha vendido todo su producto satisfactoriamente, y con un margen de ganancia saludable.

La señora Juana ha pedido un préstamo a Fundación Campo para poder comprar mayor cantidad de queso e introducir otros productos como frijol, arroz y aceite para la venta. Para ella lo más importante es ser inteligente y tener la costumbre de ahorrar. La señora Juana sueña con abrir una tiendita en un futuro en su casa donde sus clientes puedan venir a comprar sus productos.
texts.en:
Juana, 33, is a single mother of a 4-year-old son.  Two months ago Juana had the opportunity to start a business of her own selling cheese and cream in her community since the community has no stores selling basic foodstuffs.  Juana rises at 4am to go buy the cheese she sells.  To get to the road where she catches the bus she has to hike down a rocky hill, cross a river and climb another hill.  There is no bridge spanning the river and the trek takes her about 20 minutes.  She reaches her supplier at 5am and buys 30 pounds of cheese that she transports back home by bus.  Once at home, Juana divides up the cheese into one-pound portions and packs them in individual bags.  To sell the cheese and cream, Juana leaves home at 8am and spends the entire day going from community to community on foot to sell her products.  It takes her three days to sell the 30 pounds of cheese that she buys.  Since she started the business she’s sold all her product satisfactorily and with a healthy profit margin.

Juana has asked Fundación Campo for a loan to be able to buy a larger amount of cheese and to introduce other products like beans, rice and oil to sell.  For her, what’s most important is to be intelligent and have good saving habits.  Juana dreams with opening a little store at home in the future where her customers can come to buy her products.

loans.use: to buy cheese and other basic foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan tiene 43 años, es un hombre honesto, trabajador y sobre todo muy responsable, esta casado y vive junto a su esposa en una iglesia en la cual el es pastor, junto a ellos viven sus tres hijos de 19, 12 y 08 años a quienes crían juntos y desean brindar una buena educación y una mejor calidad de vida. El trabajo de Juan consiste en salir a las calles en busca de pasajeros que tienen la necesidad de ir de un lugar a otro, el siempre esta atento a su teléfono pues al mismo tiempo que brinda el servicio de mototaxi esta en espera de la llamada de alguno de sus buenos clientes que necesitan de sus servicios como electricista, ya que muy bueno en ese trabajo. Lleva ya unos 12 años como electricista y 8 meses como Mototaxista y hace todo el esfuerzo por brindar una buena educación a sus hijos. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que ama lo que hace, además de tener tiempo disponible para dedicar a sus hermanos en el templo donde brinda orientación espiritual. Espera mas adelante poder aumentar el número de moto y tener una flota de vehículos para dar oportunidad de trabajo a otras personas. Este será el segundo préstamo que tiene y por tanto espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes. Con el monto solicitado, pagará la letra de su mototaxi y comprará algunos materiales y equipos que le hacen falta para su trabajo de electricista.
texts.en:
Juan is 43 and is an honest, hardworking and, above all, a very responsible man. He is married and lives with his wife in a church where he is the pastor. Together they are raising three children, ages 19, 12 and 8 and want to give them a good education and a better quality of life.

Juan’s work consists of going into the street in search of passengers who need to go from one place to another. He is also always ready at his telephone, because at the same time as he provides motorcycle taxi service he awaits calls from one of his good clients who may need his services as an electrician, since he is very good at that work as well. He has been an electrician for 12 years and a motorcycle taxi driver for 8 months. He is making every effort to provide a good education for his children. 

What Juan likes about his work is that he loves what he does as well as having time available to dedicate to his brethren in the temple, where he gives spiritual orientations. He hopes in the future to be able to increase his number of motorcycles and to have a fleet of vehicles so that he can provide work for other people. 

This will be Juan’s second loan and he hopes to gain the support of each one of you. With the sum requested, he will make a payment on his motorcycle taxi and buy some materials and equipment that he needs for his work as an electrician.

loans.use: to make a  payment on his motorcycle and to buy electrician's tools.

loans.name: Jaime Antonio

texts.es:
Don Jaime es un hombre luchador de 50 años de edad, casado con 2 hijos.

El señor Jaime desde muy pequeño inicio a trabajar en el campo siendo un agricultor. Sus padres le enseñaron este trabajo y ya tiene 40 años de dedicarse a esta actividad.

Para que sus cultivos produzcan buenos frutos el señor Jaime tiene que adquirir insumos como fertilizantes, herbecidas estos los compra  en una cuidad del oriente del país.

El señor Jaime utilizara el préstamo para la compra de insumos agrícolas como fertilizantes, herbecidas ya que el desea obtener una mejor producción. De esta manera don Jaime podrá tener una seguridad económica y le brindara un mejor futuro a su familia.

Los planes del señor Jaime son principalmente la educación académica de sus hijos y mejorar su vivienda ya que solo tiene dos cuartos y desea construir otro mas.
texts.en:
Jaime is a tenacious, 50-year-old man who’s married and has two children.  Jaime has been working as a farmer since a very young age.  His parents taught him this occupation and he has been dedicated to this activity for 40 years.

So that his crops will be more productive Jaime must acquire supplies like fertilizer and herbicides.  He buys these things in a city in the east of the country.

Jaime will use the loan to buy farming supplies like fertilizers and herbicides because he wants to obtain better crops.  In this way Jaime will be able to have economic security and provide a better future for his family.

Jaime’s plans are primarily his children’s education and to do some home improvements because it only has two rooms and he’d like to add another one.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Bladimir Yvan

texts.es: El Sr. Bladimir  trabaja en el transporte público, como taxi libre, pertenece al sindicato mixto de Transportistas de la línea de taxi trufis en la ciudad de Cochabamba, tiene una experiencia superior a 5 años en el rubro y es conocido en la línea por el buen servicio que brinda a sus clientes. Vive en casa propia, tiene dos hijos pequeños,  el es separado pero visita a sus hijitos cada fin de semana. El crédito es para mantenimiento de su vehículo, el deseo del Sr. Bladimir es el poder pasar mas tiempo con sus hijitos ya que son lo mas importante para el por eso el trabaja para darles bienestar y mejorar la calidad de vida de toda su familia.
texts.en:
Señor Bladimir works in public transport as an independent taxi-driver.  He belongs to the Transportation union for the Trufis taxi route in the city of Cochabamba.  He has more than five years of experience in this field, and is well-known on the route for his good service that he provides his customers.

He lives in his own home, and has two small children.  He is separated, but visits his kids every weekend.

The loan is for maintenance of his vehicle.  Señor Bladimir's desire is to be able to spend more time with his kids, as they are the most important thing in his life, and this is why he works to for their well-being and to improve the quality of life for his whole family.

loans.use: to maintain his vehicle.

loans.name: 23 De Agosto Group

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal 23 De Agosto se reúne cada quince días en la hermosa ciudad de Calceta (Provincia de Manabí), ciudad conocida con el nombre de “Calceta la sin par”. Por la belleza de sus mujeres y porque para sus habitantes no hay ciudad más hermosa en el mundo.
Este es un grupo de personas que decidieron unirse hace cuatro meses atrás y formar este Banco Comunal que les ha servido de mucho para mejorar sus pequeños negocios. Se dedican a diversas actividades tales como comercio, servicios, venta de comidas entre otras actividades.

En este lugar vive la señora Clemencia, tiene 42 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos de 21, 20, 18 y 15 años, el mayor vive en el extranjero y los tres menores estudian  en colegio. El marido trabaja en el Consejo Provincial.

Nuestra amiga tiene una tienda de comestibles en su casa en la cual vende todo tipo de productos, como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, además también allí mismo tiene una heladería ella aprovecha que muy cerca de su casa hay una escuela y que los estudiantes en su mayoría niños gustan mucho de los helados, trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 22h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, sus hijos le ayudan en su trabajo cuando están desocupados. Tiene seis años con su negocio y siempre le ha ido muy bien ya que está bien ubicada y también este bien surtida para que sus clientes encuentren de todo en su local.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos,, helados y otros productos de primera necesidad.
 
Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y en el Banco Comunal.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank "23 De Agosto" meets every two weeks in the beautiful city of Calceta (in Manabí province).  The city is well-known for its nickname "The Incomparable Calceta", so named for the beauty of its women and because as far as its people are concerned, there is no more beautiful city in the world.

This is a group of people who four months ago decided to join together to form this Communal Bank, which has served them well in improving their small businesses.  They work in a variety of fields, such as retail, services, and food sales among other things.

Señora Clemencia lives here.  She is 42 years old, and is in a common-law marriage from which she has four children aged 21, 20, 18 and 15.  The eldest lives overseas, and the younger three attend high school.  Her husband works for the Provincial Council. 

Our friend has a food store in her home, where she sells all types of products such as rice, sugar, oil, and detergent.  She also has an ice-cream business.  She takes advantage of the fact that there's a primary school near her home, and that the students, who are mainly children, very much enjoy her ice-cream.  She works every day from 6 a.m. through to 10 p.m., and sometimes till even later.  Her children help her with her work when they are free.

She has had six years working with this business and it's always gone very well for her as her location is good, and also her store is well-stocked so that her customers can find everything they want at her place.

She will use this loan to stock her store up further; she will buy rice, sugar, oil, detergent, sausages, ice-cream and other everyday products.

Her goals are to continue progressing with her business and the Communal Bank.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergent, sausages, ice-creams and other everyday products.

loans.name: Banco Comunal Las Marias Group

texts.es: El banco comunal Las Marías se formó con la unión de varias personas. Actualmente está integrado por 11 personas trabajadoras, luchadoras y por sobre todo muy honestas y responsables. Se unieron con el objetivo de crecer no solo económicamente sino también a nivel personal. La señora Petrona se dedica a la venta de ornados y rosquetes. Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de bolsas, maduros, entre otros. Desde ya agradece la oportunidad que esta le brinda, pues de obtener el crédito le será de mucha ayuda para todas las personas que conforman este banco comunal.
texts.en: The communal bank Las Marías was formed through the union of many people. Today there are 11 hardworking, determined, and over all very honest and responsible members. They came together with the goal of growing, not only economically, but also on a personal level. Señora Petrona sells accessories and pastries. She requests the loan in order to purchase purses and plantains, among other items. She thanks you in advance for the opportunities you are offering, since receiving this loan will be of great help to all the people who make up this communal bank.

loans.use: to purchase purses, plantains, and other items

loans.name: Marisela Esther

texts.es: La Señora Marisela de 33 años es una persona soltera muy emprendedora con ganas de salir adelante, tiene un pequeño negocio donde se dedica a la venta de abarrotes (leche, huevo, arroz, azúcar, fideos), además de la venta de golosinas (galletas, chicles, chocolates), entre otros, el crédito solicitado es para invertirlo en la compra de estos productos de abarrotes y así poder incrementar mejor su negocio con una tienda más surtida y con más variedad, eligió este negocio con la finalidad de tener mayores ingresos y por la demanda de tiendas por la zona donde vivía. Su gran sueño de la señora Marisela es culminar sus estudios superiores, la señora está muy agradecida por el crédito brindado ya que podrá incrementar sus ventas y su negocio.
texts.en:
Señora Marisela, aged 33, is a single woman who is very enterprising with the desire to move ahead in life.  She has a small store where she sells groceries (milk, eggs, rice, sugar, noodles).  She also sells sweets (cookies, gum, chocolates), among other things.

The requested loan is to invest in the purchase of these grocery products so that she can grow her business better by having a better stocked store with a greater variety of products.

She chose this line of business with the intent of having better income, and because of the demand for stores in the area where she lives.

Señora Marisela's big dream is to complete her further education.  The Señora is very grateful for the loan that's being provided, and with which she will be able to grow her sales and her business.

loans.use: to purchase groceries (milk, sugar, rice, noodles), and sweets (cookies, chocolates), among other products.

loans.name: María Roxana

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal 30 de Agosto se reúne en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora María, tiene 32 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tienen tres hijos de 10, 7 y 1 año, los mayores estudian en escuela. Su esposo se dedica a la venta de lotería.

Nuestra amiga es un ama de casa que para ayudar a su marido en los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma  de venta es puerta en puerta y también entrega en su casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes más conocidos. Trabaja tres días a la semana unas cuatro horas ya que después tiene que atender su hogar y  a sus hijos en sus tareas de la escuela. Ella deja a crédito a sus clientes y cobra cada semana, su mercadería la va a comprar a Guayaquil cada vez que necesita, lleva más de seis años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va bastante bien.

Este crédito lo va a invertir en su negocio y en el negocio de su marido, va a comprar  pantalones, camisas, blusas, ropa de niños y billetes de lotería.  Es su tercer  ciclo en el Banco Comunal   y le gusta por los beneficios que brinda la institución.

Su sueño es terminar su casa que aun la tiene en construcción.
texts.en:
The communal bank August 30th meets in Picoaza parish in the city of Portoviejo, known for its commerce, its traditional celebrations for San Pedro and San Pablo, and for the happiness of its people. 

Señora María, 32, lives here with her common-law husband, and their three children, 1, 7, and 10 years old. The older children are in school. Her husband sells lottery tickets. 

María is a housewife who, in order to help her husband with the household expenses, sells all kinds of clothing. She sells door-to-door, and her best customers also come to her house. She works three days a week for about four hours so that afterwards she can tend the house and help her children with their schoolwork. 

Her customers buy on credit, and she collects every week. She goes to Guayaquil to buy her merchandise whenever she needs to. She has done this work for more than six years, and it's going pretty well. 

She is going to invest the money from this loan in her business and that of her husband, purchasing pants, shirts, blouses, children's clothing, and lottery tickets. This is her third loan cycle in the communal bank, and she likes the benefits the organization offers. Her dream is to finish her house, which is still under construction.

loans.use: to purchase pants, shirts, blouses, children's clothing, and lottery tickets.

loans.name: Katy

texts.es: Katy tiene 41 años, es una mujer alegre y muy emprendedora, esta casada, fruto de su matrimonio nacieron tres hijos, quienes ahora tienen 16, 14, y 07 años. Juntos viven en casa de su suegra. El trabajo de Katy consiste en la costura de disfraces, debido a que es socia de dos amigas, cuyo negocio es la venta de piñatas, disfraces y animaciones. Ella realiza este trabajo en un local que es alquilado, dentro de un concurrido mercado de la ciudad. Lleva recién tres meses en este trabajo y le esta yendo bien, y junto a sus amigas están haciendo crecer este negocio. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene tiempo para estar a lado de sus amigas y puede ver su inversión de manera directa junto a las demás. Ella tiene muy buenas ganancias ya que siempre tiene clientes, pues el acabado de sus trabajo es implecable por ello tiene mayor demanda. Espera continuar con su trabajo ya que espera ampliarlo. Este será el primer préstamo que tendrá, por tanto espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes. Tiene muchas ganas de ser una socia puntual, además sabe que el grupo que conforma son muy responsables e intentará seguirles los pasos para no quedar mal ante ellas. Con el monto solicitado, lo utilizará para comprar materiales como tela de diversos colores, así como hilos, ya que al comprar al por mayor reduce costos y se genera más ganancias.
texts.en:
Katy is 41 years old.  She is a happy woman who is very entrepreneurial.  She is married, and the fruits of this marriage are her three children who are now aged 16, 14 and 7.  They live together in her mother-in-law's home.

Katy's work consists of sewing costumes, as she is in partnership with two friends.  Their business is selling piñatas, costumes, and various diversions.  She does this work in some rented premises inside a busy market in the city.  What she likes about her work is that she gets to spend time at her friends' side, and can see her investment working alongside theirs.  She has very good earnings and always has customers; the quality of her work is impeccable so it is in great demand.  She hopes to continue with her work and hopes to expand.  

This will be her first loan, and so she hopes for the support of each and every one of you.  She has much desire to be a member who is punctual in her repayments, as she knows that the women in her group are very responsible.  She intends to follow in their footsteps so that they don't think badly of her.

She will use the requested amount to buy materials such as different-colored fabrics and thread.  She will buy at wholesale to keep her costs down and generate more profits.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Dolores Cecilia

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal 30 de Agosto se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Dolores, tiene 36 años de edad mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 16, 12 y 9 años, dos de ellos están en colegio y el menor en escuela. El marido es comerciante.

Nuestra amiga se dedica junto a su marido a la venta de billetes de lotería. Él  vende recorriendo las calles de la ciudad de Portoviejo mientras que ella vende en su tienda. Ella tiene una tienda de comestibles en la cual trabaja todos los días desde las 7h00 hasta las 20h00, nos cuenta que a pesar de que su tienda es pequeña le gusta tener de todo para que  sus clientes y lleguen con más frecuencia a su local, lleva un año con su tienda y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va a utilizar en comprar productos de primera necesidad para surtir su tienda y billetes de lotería para vender alii y  para su esposo. Esta desde el inicio en el banco comunal y le gusta ya que gracias a uno de los créditos empezó su negocio.
 
Su sueño  tener una tienda mucho más grande y bien surtida.
texts.en:
The “30 de Agosto” (August 30th) communal bank meets every two weeks in Picoaza Parish in the city of Portoviejo a place known for being a very commercial zone, for its traditional Saints Peter and Paul traditional festival and for the joyfulness of its people.

We met Dolores, 36, here.  She’s in a common law relationship and has three children who are 16, 12 and 9 years old.  Two of them are in secondary school and the youngest goes to elementary school.  Her husband’s a merchant.

Our friend and her husband sell lottery tickets.  He wanders through Portoviejo’s streets selling them while she sells them in her store.  She has a grocery store that she works at daily from 7am until 8pm.  She tells us that despite her store being small she likes to keep it well stocked so that her customers will come to it more frequently.  She’s had the store for a year and she does very well.

She will use this loan to buy basic need items to stock the store and lottery tickets to sell there and for her husband.  She’s been in the communal bank since its beginning and she likes it because she was able to start her business thanks to one of the loans.  Her dream is to have a much larger, well stocked store.

loans.use: to buy basic need items and lottery tickets.

loans.name: Loyda

texts.es: Loyda tiene 36 años, es una mujer muy alegre y entusiasta, esta casada y vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos de 11, 06 y 04 años, por ello trabaja muy duro para poder darles una buena educación. El trabajo de Loyda se inicia desde muy temprano, sale a su taller, lugar que alquila en un local cerca del centro de la ciudad.
