Ella es una socia de un negocio en el que se dedican al alquiler y vender disfraces, y en este mismo lugar tiene su pequeño taller de costura, en donde a parte de hacer los disfraces y otras cosas, brinda el servicio de costura a sus clientes. Realiza un muy buen trabajo y es por eso que es muy buscada, tiene meses en este lugar, pues anteriormene lo ejercia en su casa. Lo que le gusta de este trabajo es que puede compartir con personas con quienes se lleva muy bien, a parte de tener un buen ingreso para su hogar. Espera poder crecer en este trabajo ya que tiene muchas expectativas a futuro. Este será el segundo préstamo que tiene por ello desea el apoyo de ustedes. Con el monto solicitado, comprará materiales de costura para así tener en cantidad, asimismo desea comprar productos para instalar una pequeña bodega.
texts.en:
Loyda, 36, is a very cheerful, enthusiastic woman.  She’s married and lives in her own house with her husband and three children who are 11, 6 and 4 years old.  Because of that she works very hard to be able to provide them with a good education.  

Loyda’s work starts very early.  She goes out to her workshop, a place she rents downtown.  She’s a partner in a business dedicated to costume rentals and sales.  She also has a small sewing workshop here where besides making costumes and other items, she also provides sewing services to her customers.  She does very good work so she is quite sought after.  She’s been in this place for a few months because she used to work from home.  What she likes about her work is being able to spend time with people that she gets along with very well besides earning good household income.  

This will be her second loan and she hopes to have your support.  She will use the amount requested to buy sewing supplies in order to have them in quantity.  She also wants to buy merchandise to set up a small store.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es: Norma tiene 57 años, es una mujer alegre y muy trabajadora, esta separada D. su esposo y vive en casa D. su hija junto a sus dos nietos. El trabajo D. Norma consiste en la venta D. sabanas, cubrecamas, fundas para almohadas, edredones. Ella realiza sus actividades en su casa por las mañanas, por las tardes sale a buscar a sus clientes, entre ellos están sus amigos, vecinos y algunos familiares. Lleva trabajando en esta actividad ya por casi un año, y le gusta lo que hace, pues le genera las ganancias suficientes para ella y para darles algo a sus niestos. Por otro lado, la desventaja D. este trabajo es que hay ocasiones en que los clientes no terminan D. pagar el producto elegido. Este será el tercer préstamo que tiene, y por tanto esta a la espera D. su apoyo. Con el monto solicitado, comprará más artículos para abastecer su negocio, entre ellos sabanas, cubrecamas, edredones, fundas para almohadas.
texts.en: Norma is 57. She is a very happy and hard-working woman. She is separated from her husband and lives in her daughter's house with her two grandchildren. Norma sells sheets, bedspreads, pillow cases, and comforters. She makes her sales in her home in the mornings. In the afternoons she goes out to look for customers, among whom are her friends, neighbours and some family members. She has done this work for almost one year, and she likes what she does. It generates her sufficient income and she is able to give a little to her grandchildren. On the other hand, the disadvantage of this work is that there are times when her customers do not fulfill all of their payments. This will be her third loan, and she hopes for your support. With the requested funds, she will purchase more articles to stock her business, including: sheets, bedspreads, comforters, and pillowcases.

loans.use: to purchase sheets.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Carmen Rosario

texts.es: La Señora Carmen de 38 años es casada, tiene un pequeño hijo de 1 año, es una mujer muy emprendedora con todas las ganas de salir adelante con su familia, hace 6 años tiene un negocio en donde se dedica principalmente a la venta de abarrotes (arroz, leche, azúcar, fideo, huevos, pollo), productos de primera necesidad, además de la venta de medicinas, golosinas y algunos cosméticos para la mujer (colonia, lápiz labial, desodorantes) entre otros, el crédito solicitado es para invertirlo en la compra de más mercadería (abarrotes, medicinas, golosinas) y así poder incrementar sus ganancias y tener mayores ingresos. Su gran sueño es tener un local propio, más amplio para acondicionar e implementar mejor su negocio, está muy agradecida por el crédito otorgado que le servirá de mucho para cumplir con sus metas trazadas.
texts.en: Carmen is 38 years old, married, and has a young child who is 1 year old.  She is a very entrepreneurial woman who has a desire to get ahead in life together with her family.  She has owned a business for six years where she mainly sells groceries (rice, milk, sugar, noodles, eggs and chicken) and basic household products.  She also sells medicines, candies and some women's cosmetics (cologne, lipsticks and deodorants).  She will invest her loan in buying more merchandise (groceries, medicines and candies) so that she can increase her profits and make more income.  Her great dream is to own her own larger premises so that she can better stock her business.  She is very grateful for the loan she is being given as it will help her a lot in achieving her goals.

loans.use: to buy groceries (rice, sugar, noodles, milk), medicines, cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Walter Santos

texts.es:
Walter de 42 años de edad, vive con su familia en su casa propia, cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Pìtipo que pertenece al departamento de Lambayeque.  Esta zona es agrícola y ganadera.

Walter se dedica a la agricultura, tiene sus propias tierras de cultivo donde siembra yuca y frijol, actividad que realiza desde hace varios años, además de ser un producto muy consumido por las personas, una vez que realiza su cosecha lo comercializa en los diferentes mercados de la zona y fuera de ella,  con los ingresos que adquiera puede brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.  

A observar que su negocio va creciendo, ha creído necesario solicitar un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2300 nuevos soles para la compra de fertilizante para mejorar sus tierras como su producto, con las ganancias que obtenga podrá pagar su crédito y solventar las necesidades diarias de su familia.  Walter con trabajo y dedicación le brinda lo mejor a su familia, ofreciendoles otras oportunidades en la vida.
texts.en:
41-year-old Walter lives with his family in his own home.  The only basic service his house receives is electricity.  It is located in the rural part of Pitipo district, in Lambayeque department.  The people in this area farm and raise livestock.

Walter is a farmer.  He owns his own farmland where he grows cassava and beans.  He has been in this business for several years.  The crops he grows are very popular.  Once he harvests his crops, he sells them in markets in his local area and in other areas.  He uses the income that he makes to provide his family with a better quality of life.

Noting that his business was growing, Walter decided that he needed to request a loan for 2,300 soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy fertilizers with which to improve his land and his crops.  He will use the profits that he makes to repay his loan and cover his family's daily needs.  Through his hard work and commitment, Walter provides his family with the best, offering them other opportunities in life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to improve his land and his crops

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es: Patricia tiene 30 años, es una mujer muy alegre y emprendedora, esta felizmente casada y tiene una casa propia en donde vive junto a su esposo y sus tres pequeños hijos a quienes quiere dar una mejor calidad de vida. El trabajo de Patricia consiste en la animación de fiesta infantiles, y de otros eventos. Asimismo posee un negocio en donde vende artículos para fiestas, desde piñatas y disfraces para toda ocasión, así como el servioc de la preparación de buffets. Lleva casi un año en la venta de estos artículos pero en cuanto al trabajo e aniamción de fiestas lleva toda su vida. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que puede disponer de su tiempo, además que es sociia de dos amigas y entre ellas se ayudan, por ello desea que este negocio crezca más. Ahora su prioridad es ampliar su local de venta, para abarrotarlo de más artículos y disfraces. Este será el tercer préstamo y por tanto espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes. Con el monto solicitado, comprará telas, accesorios, materiales para hacer disfraces y arreglar sus calzados que utiliza para sus presentaciones.
texts.en: Patricia is 30. She is a very happy and enterprising woman. She is happily married and has her own home where she lives with her husband and their three young children. She wants to give her children a better quality of life. Patricia's job consists of providing entertainment for children's parties and other events. She has her own business where she sells various items for parties, from piñatas to costumes, and provides services preparing buffets. She has been selling these items for almost a year, but she has worked in party entertainment all her life. What she likes about her work is being able to control her schedule, and the fact that she has partnered with two friends and they help each other. She wants her business to grow more. Now her priority is to expand her location, in order to stock it with more items and materials for making costumes. She wants to fix the shoes that she uses for parties.

loans.use: to buy items and fabrics for costumes, and to fix her outfits for children's parties.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Las Triunfadoras Ii -Chilca Group

texts.es: Ana  de 21 años de edad, soltera, mujer luchadora, empeñosa  es una de la socias que conforman la nueva Alcancía comunal Las Triunfadoras II Chilca, por el momento Ana  estudia  una carrera profesional y a la vez trabaja  ofreciendo los productos a sus amistades ,y también gracias  a sus padres que diariamente le apoyen en sus estudios para  que así  salgue adelante por sí misma .Solicita este préstamo para poder comprar  más  productos que se encuentren en oferta ,para así poder venderlos a un precio cómodo y a la vez poder incrementar su  capital .La socia desea para el futuro lograr terminar  su carrera profesional y ser una  mayorista en cuanto a sus productos .En la foto Ana viste una chompa color celeste y pantalón jeans, se encuentra ubicada a lado derecho de la socia que viste  una chompa color verde. Ana  al igual que  todos los socios de esta alcancía comunal están muy agradecidos por  el préstamo brindado.
texts.en:
Ana, 21, is a single, tenacious, dedicated woman.  She’s one of the members of the “Las Triunfadoras II Chilca” (Chilca Victorious Ones II) communal bank.  At present, Ana is studying a professional career but at the same time works selling products to her acquaintances and, thanks to support from her parents, who daily provide for her studies, is working towards becoming independent.  

She is asking for this loan to be able to buy more products that are on special promotion or on sale to sell them at an affordable price and increase her capital.  She hopes in future to complete her professional training and become a wholesaler of her products.

In the photo, Ana is wearing a sky blue sweater and jeans; she’s located to the right of the member wearing a green sweater.  Ana, like all the other members of this communal bank, is very grateful for the loan granted.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es: Verónica tiene 31 años, es una mujer alegre, y emprendedora. Está casada, y junto a su esposo construyeron una casita en una parte del terreno que sus suegros le cedieron. Ahi vive en compañia de sus tres menores hijos de 10, 08 y 02 años de edad, por ellos es que trabaja día a día para poder darles buena educación y mejor calidad de vida. El trabajo de Verónica consiste en salir a caminar por las calles de la ciudad ofreciendo sus productos, pues vende fajas térmicas corporales, que ayudan a sus clientes a perder peso de manera mas rápida. Sus clientes mas importantes son sus propios amigos y familiares. Lo que mas le gusta de su trabajo es que puede admminsitrar su tiempo para realizar otras actividades dentro de su hogar, cuidar y ayudar a sus hijos con las tareas que le dejan en el colegio. Le va bien en este trabajo ya que tiene buenos clientes, por ello desea mas adelante poder tener mayor variedad de productos en su casa y no tener que estar caminando por largo tiempo. Este será el tercer préstamo que tiene, ante ello espera que continuen apoyandolo. Con el monto solicitado, comprará más fajas y algunos artículos para el cuidado del cuerpo, ya que siempre le gusta traer novedades para que sus clientes puedan tener variedad para escoger.
texts.en:
Verónica, 31, is a cheerful, enterprising woman.  She’s married and together with her husband built a small house on part of a lot her in-laws gave them.  They live there together with their three minor children who are 10, 8 and 2 years of age.  She works hard for them daily to be able to provide them with a good education and better quality of life.

Verónica’s work consists in heading out to the city streets offering her products for sale.  She sells thermal girdles that help her customers to lose weight more quickly.  Her most important customers are her own friends and family members.  What she most enjoys about her work is being able to manage her own time to be able to do other household chores and to care for and help her children with their school homework assignments.

She does well in this work because she has good customers and this is why she wants to have a greater variety of products on hand at home and not have to go out on such long walks for so long.  

This will be her third loan and she hopes that you will continue to support her.  She will use the requested amount to buy more girdles and some other body care items because she always likes to bring novel items for her customers so that they can have an assortment to choose from.

loans.use: to buy girdles and body care items.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: La Alborada (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
En  el sector conocido como Los Ángeles en la parroquia Colon  de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen  cada quince días las socias  del Banco Comunal La Alborada. Los mismos que se dedican a diversas actividades tales como la agricultura, al comercio en general, prestar servicios como cabinas telefónicas o salones de belleza. Unieron sus esfuerzos para poder acceder a los beneficios que presta la Fundación Espoir, este es su primer crédito y esperan seguir por mucho tiempo en el Banco Comunal.

Aquí conocimos a la señora Vicenta tiene 44 años  de edad, es madre soltera de una  hija de nueve años de edad que estudian en escuela. Ella vive sola con su hija en su casa que aunque humilde es de su propiedad.

Es una muy buena ama de casa que además se dedica a la venta de  ropa de todo tipo. Su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes cuando lleva mercadería, ella también trabaja bajo  pedidos que le realizan  sus clientes. Trabaja todos los días aunque solo recorre los sábados y domingos días que también cobra ya que deja a crédito. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil ya que allá le sale más barato. Tiene un año que se dedica a esta actividad y la fuente de su sustento pues ella es sola y gracias a esto ha podido sacar adelante a su hija.
 
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Este es su primer ciclo y está muy contenta porque este crédito le va a servir de mucho en su negocio. 

Sus sueños es seguir adelante y  darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
In the Ecuadorian city of Portoviejo, every fifteen days the members of the La Alborada Community Bank meet in the the Los Angeles neighborhood of the Colon district. The bank's members work in different sectors, such as agriculture, general business, and service industries such as public telephone booths and beauty salons. They have joined their efforts to be able to gain access to the services of Fundación ESPOIR; this is their first loan, and they hope to continue working with the Community Bank for a long time.

The member of the Community Bank we introduce today is Vicenta, a 44-year-old single mother. Her daughter, at nine years old, studies in primary school; the two live by themselves in their humble home.

Vicenta is a very good head of household; in addition, she works selling all different types of clothing. She sells from door to door, and also in her home, where clients come when she has merchandise available. She also works filling orders for her clients. Vicenta works every day, although on Saturdays and Sundays she only goes to pick up merchandise; because she allows her customers to buy on credit, she is also paid for these days. She buys her merchandise in Guayaquil because it is cheaper there. She has worked selling clothing for one year; it has been the principal way in which she makes a living, since she is single. Thanks to this work, Vicente has been able to help her daughter succeed.

She will use this loan to buy more merchandise, such as pants, blouses, shirts, and children's clothing. This is her first loan cycle, and she is very happy because the credit will help her a lot with her business.
 
Vicenta's dream is to keep moving forward and give her daughter the best possible life.

loans.use: to purchase pants, blouses, shirts and children's clothing.

loans.name: Ma. Lovita

texts.en:
Ma. Lovita has been in business for the past 20 years providing manicure and pedicure services to the people in her village. She offers the services in a beauty salon owned by her friend. The salon also offers other beauty and hair styling services for occasions such as weddings and debuts. 

Ma. Lovita is 47 years old and a single parent who sacrifices a lot to raise her three children. As of now, all of her children have stopped their studies due to the financial burden of educating them. Her children have found temporary employment to help earn enough money to afford for them to continue their studies. As a responsible mother, Ma. Lovita works all day and doubles her efforts to generate income. She usually earns 300 PHP a day, which is used for daily meals. Other income is saved for her children's education.  

She is now asking for a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy additional nail polish, cottons, and hand towels used to provide manicure and pedicure services. She believes through the help of this loan, she will improve the services to her customers, which will increase her earnings.

In the future, Ma. Lovita would like to see all of her children have their own degrees.

loans.use: to buy additional nail polish, cottons, and hand towels

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena is 46 years old and married to Jomer. They have been blessed with five children. Two are still attending school, and the rest already have their own families. Magdalena and her husband raise crops to generate income. They plant and harvest rice. They usually harvest the rice twice a year, with each harvest earning them a minimum of 30,000 PHP.

As of now, Magdalena has insufficient funds to support all of her family's needs, especially the daily needs of her children. She is now asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides used in faming.

In the future, Magdalena would like to generate more income to support her family and somehow improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.en:
Feliciana is 56 years old and is married with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Feliciana has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Feliciana requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell at her food stall.

Feliciana has been in this business for two years. In the future, Feliciana would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell at her food stall.

loans.name: Lucisia

texts.en: Lucisia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a furniture-making business in the Philippines. Lucisia requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of wood for her furniture-making business. She has been in this business for 13 years. Lucisia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of wood for her furniture-making business.

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en:
Cristita is 30 years old. She is married and has three children who are in school.

Cristita is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Cristita requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Cristita has been farming vegetables for six years now and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, Cristita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica is 56 years old and married with 3 children. She is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. She has been farming vegetables for 14 years now, and has borrowed 13 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. She requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. In the future, Veronica would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a sewing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 20 years. Evelyn earns more income from a variety store. She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase various tools for her sewing business.

Evelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase various sewing tools.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Nora has been in this business for 10 years now, and also earns additional income from food vending.

Nora requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to customers. Nora would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to customers.

loans.name: Donna

texts.en:
Donna is 48 years old and married with 3 children. She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Donna has been farming vegetables for 15 years and earns additional income from a general store.

She is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia is 48 years old and married with four children. She has been running her sari-sari (variety) store for 10 years and also earns an income from food vending. She works hard to provide for her family. 

She requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell. Amalia has borrowed and paid back 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Arlette Nikko

texts.en:
Arlette is 20 years old and single. She is living with her parents, brothers, and sisters. Arlette is currently taking a criminology course. Her ambition is to finish her studies and become a police officer someday.

Arlette's parents are farmers in the Philippines. Her mother is a housekeeper and manages their business raising hogs. Her father is a foreman in a rice mill in Cagayan province. Arlette wants to help her parents even in just a simple way. She is asking for a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy feed for hogs. She wishes to earn more income from their hog-raising business to further support her education.

loans.use: to buy feed for hogs

loans.name: Evelina

texts.en: Evelina works hard to support six children. She is married and has a business growing and selling vegetables in the Philippines. Evelina requested a loan of 3,100 PHP through NWTF to buy a solar lamp. She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to save money by minimizing her kerosene expenses. Evelina is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: To purchase a solar lamp

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma works hard to support one child. She is married and has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 3,500 loan through NWTF to buy a SOLAR LAMP.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have a backup light in case of emergency.

Gemma is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: To purchase a solar lamp.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Loida

texts.en:
Loida is 29 years old and married. She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. She has been farming vegetables for seven years and also earns additional income from a general store.

Loida is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other supplies for farming. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other supplies for farming.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ronita

texts.en:
Ronita is 47 years old and married with two children. She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. She has been farming vegetables for 15 years and earns additional income from growing rice.

Ronita is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Nelita

texts.en:
Nelita is married with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 42 years old and has three children who are in school. She has a hardware business in the Philippines and has been in this business for 15 years.

Nelita requested a PHP 22,500 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stock of hardware to sell. In the future, Nelita would like to save enough money so she could to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock of hardware to sell.

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia is 48 years old and married with 2 children. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

She has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap and other groceries. Nelia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
Adelina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a clothing and dressmaking business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years. She earns more income from a general store business. She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase fabric for her dressmaking business. 

Adelina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She wants to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fabric for her dressmaking business.

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
Glenda works hard to support her family. She is 35 years old and married, having three children. She has a business that sells aqua feed supplies. She has been managing her business for three years and she earns about P20,000 a month. 

Glenda is requesting a loan amounting to P50,000 to be use in buying additional sacks of aqua feed because her feed supplies are sold out at present. She hopes that she can improve her business by increasing the sacks of aqua feed she sells. She hopes that she can get the loan amount she is requesting to be able to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of aqua feed for her aqua-shop business.

loans.name: Earng

texts.en:
Earng, 56 years old, is a farmer with her husband and earns $7 per day. This couple has five children; two are studying, two more are farming, and one more is working in a factory, each earning $4 per day. Every month, she has to spend $30 on food, $7 on electricity, $25 on school fees, $15 on transportation, and $10 on other expenses. 

She would like to request a loan of $1000 to buy fertilizer and hire workers to clear the grass in her field. She wants to divide her field into two parts for planting yams and farming.  She hopes that her new career will make her income improve.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and hire workers.

loans.name: Tha

texts.en:
Tha, 43 years old, sells vegetables, pork and beef at home and earns $3 per day. Her husband, a motor taxi driver, earns $2 per day. This couple has two children; one is working in a factory and earns $2 per day. Every month, she has to spend $66 on food, $5 on electricity, and $10 on other expenses. 

She would like to request a loan of $1000 to buy a motorbike for her son’s motor taxi service. This family used to do farming but could not make a good income so they changed their career last year. In the future, she wants to open a grocery shop in front of her house.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her son's motor taxi service.

loans.name: Lay

texts.en:
Lay, 47 years old, is a farmer. Her husband is a soldier. Their income is $3 per day. They have three children; one is studying and two more are working in a factory, each earning $3 per day. Every month, she has to spend $28 on food, $5 on electricity, $7 on rent, $6 on school fees, $10 on transportation, and $10 on other expenses. 

She would like to request a loan of $1000 to buy a motorbike for her husband to use to travel to work. In the future, she wants to have a small grocery store at home so that she can make another income for her family. She wants to support her son to finish high school and send him to vocational training to learn how to repair motorbikes.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband to use to travel to work.

loans.name: Tim

texts.en:
Tim, 55 years old, is a farmer who earns $1.5 per day. She is a single mother with three children, all of them working in the casino on the border of Vietnam and Cambodia. Each can earn $5 per day. Every month Tim spends $30 on food, $5 on electricity, $15 on transportation, and $15 on other expenses.

Tim would like to request a loan of $1200 to buy a motorbike for her son-in-law for traveling to work. She doesn’t want to change her career because she is getting older and enjoys her agricultural activities.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her son-in-law for traveling to work.

loans.name: Thai

texts.en: Thai is 54 years old and earns $6 a day by selling knives. She is a single mother with two children, one of whom works in a factory earning $3 a day while the other works as a knife maker and earns $7 a day. Every month, she has to spend $45 on food, $5 on electricity, $25 on transportation and $5 on other expenses. She is applying for a loan for $500 to buy a motorbike to transport her knives to the markets where she sells them. In the future, she wants to have a shop where she can sell her knives so that she does not have to constantly move from village to village.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to transport the knives she sells to make a living.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing and accessories to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Encarnacion

texts.en: Encarnacion earns a living by going house-to-house selling beauty products. She has done this for the past five years, and earns most of her money by selling shampoo, toothpaste and perfumes from a catalog to customers in her village. She usually earns PHP 1,000 a week, while her husband works as a technician and also raises hogs on the side for additional income. She is 53 years old and has five children. By working hard, she and her husband have been able to support the education of all of their children. Encarnacion is applying for a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy more items to sell to her customers. Her goal is to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy beauty products to sell to people in her village.

loans.name: Pey

texts.en: Pey is 42 years old and earns about $4 a day by selling duck eggs. Her husband is a farmer who earns about $2.50 a day. The couple has five children, one of whom is in school while the other four work and earn about $8 a day. Every month, Pey has to spend $30 on food, $3 on electricity, $5 on school fees and $10 on other expenses. She is applying for a loan for $1,000 to buy more ducks to raise and care for. She used to work as a farmer but her income was not high enough to support her family, so she changed her career to earn a larger income. She plans to continue buying more ducks as a way to increase her income and improve her family's life.

loans.use: to buy more ducks to raise.

loans.name: Hay

texts.en: Hay is 41 years old and earns a living by selling groceries with her husband. Together, they earn about $5 per day. She has three children, one of whom is in school while the other two work and earn about $3 a day. Every month, she has to spend $60 on food, $5 on electricity, $10 on school fees and $10 on transportation. She is applying for a loan for $500 to buy more groceries to sell in her store. This loan will help her get more customers because she can have a wider variety of goods to sell. She wants to send her youngest child to study in the university after he finishes high school.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Saven

texts.en: Saven, 53 years old, is a housewife. Her husband is a soldier, and he earns an income of 3 USD per day. This couple has four children: one is in school and the other three are working in a factory. Each earns 3 USD per day. Every month, she has to spend 70 USD on food, 10 USD on school fees, and 20 USD on transportation. She would like to request a loan of 600 USD to buy materials for repairing her house. She wants to send her daughter to study to be a tailor and open a tailoring shop for her at home so that she can make more income.

loans.use: To buy materials for repairing her house

loans.name: Bayasgalan

texts.en:
Borrower Bayasgalan is a 33-year-old married woman who lives with her family in a district without basic infrastructure near Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. 

Bayasgalan supports her family, by operating a clothing retail stall business at largest outdoor market in Mongolia. She has been doing this for 7 years. She sells clothes which she imports from Ereen, a border city between Mongolia and China. She also sells clothing which she makes herself. 

She is an ambitious lady who wants to expand her business as well, so she is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT (Mongolian Tugriks) loan to purchase more clothing for autumn.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell for this fall/autumn

loans.name: Rom

texts.en:
Rom, age 54, is a homemaker. Her husband is a construction worker and he earns $3 per day. This couple has four children: all are working and earning $14 per day. Every month, Rom has to spend $70 on food, $20 on rent, and $10 on other expenses. 

She would like to request a loan in the amount of $800 to buy wood, bricks, and other materials required for repairing her house. She plans to offer groceries for sale in front of her house so that she can help her husband in earning money to support the family.

loans.use: to buy wood, bricks, and other materials required for repairing her house

loans.name: Sarath

texts.en:
Sarath, age 25, works in a factory along with his wife. Each earns $3 per day. This couple has a three-month-old baby. Every month,Sarath has to spend $44 on food, $5 on electricity, $14 on transportation, and $18 on other family expenses. 

He would like to request a loan of $1,000 to buy a generator so he can offer battery-charging services to his customers. He also plans to open a tailoring shop with his wife, since they now have relevant experience after working in a garment factory for the past two years.

loans.use: to buy a generator so he can offer battery-charging services to his customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy flour, milk, sugar, spices and ingredients needed to cook and sell food products

loans.name: Janette

texts.en:
Janette is 31 years old and blessed with two children, both of whom attend school. Her spouse works as a welder. Janette has a business selling LPG (Liquefied Petroleum Gas) in the village where she lives. She sells the LPG in front of her house. Janette earns P2,000 in her business.

She is requesting for a loan of P15,000 to buy additional LPG to sell in the village. She needs to purchase additional LPG to earn higher profits to support the education of her children. 

Janette would like to educate all her children to have their own degree, which leads them to better employment and brighter future someday.

loans.use: to buy additional LPG to sell in the village

loans.name: Premangelito

texts.en:
Premangelito has been running his business, cooking daily meals to sell in his food stall, for a year. He earns about P3,000 (Philippine Pesos) a month in this field of work. He operates a business in front of his house near the school. This encourages him to cook more meals and sell more food items to attract more customers in his store and generate more income. 

Premangelito is 38 years old and and has two children to educate. He is now requesting a loan of P25,000 to buy ingredients and vegetables for the daily meals he cooks, as well as soft drinks, biscuits and breads to sell in his food stall.

In the future, he wants to enhance his business to ensure that he can meet all his customers demands for delicious meals and in that way, increase his earnings too. He also aspires for a better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and vegetables for daily meals he cooks, as well as soft drinks, biscuits and bread to sell in his food stall.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta, age 52, owns and operates a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, breads, and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan int eh amount of PHP 11,000 to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to offer for sale.

She and her husband have one child. 

Violeta has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Violeta hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to offer for sale

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella, age 44, owns and operates a shop that sells canned goods, breads, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 9,000 so as to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to offer for sale.

She and her husband have four children.

Estrella has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Estrella hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to offer for sale

loans.name: Charielyn

texts.en:
Charielyn, age 34, is the hard-working and responsible mother of three children, all of whom are enrolled in school. Her husband Roderick has worked as a farmer for 13 years. The family lives peacefully and happily in the village of San Pedro Maddela. 

She has been running her sari-sari (variety) store for four years. From this business, she is able to earn about P1,500 a month. She is grateful that her income allows her to help sustain the financial needs of her children and their daily needs. 

She would like to increase her income because the profit she generates from her store is not enough, especially when there are immediate costs associated with the family's corn farming business. For this reason, she is requesting a loan amount of P14,000 in order to allow her to stock groceries for her retail business, such as soft drinks, assorted biscuits, canned goods, milk, and sugar. 

She is hoping to send her children to higher levels of education and to improve the family's standard of living through her business.

loans.use: to stock groceries for her retail business, such as soft drinks, assorted biscuits, canned goods, milk, and sugar

loans.name: Julito

texts.en:
Julito is 59 years old and married, with four grown-up children. He has been running a transportation business for 17 years, while dedicating 27 years to his hog raising business. Nowadays, through his patience and sacrifices in transporting his passengers from their villages to and from the market, he has two motorcycles for public transport.

Julito would like to ask for additional capital amounting to P20,000 to purchase one set of sprockets, one wheel and two piglets for his transportation and hog raising businesses. He is hoping that his profit will increase so that he could buy a stock of feeds for his raised pigs, and save some amount for security purposes when he gets weak.

loans.use: to purchase one set of sprockets, one wheel and two piglets for his transportation and hog raising businesses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to open another boutique in Arthi River.

loans.name: Shomet

texts.en:
Shomet is 33  years old and married with two children. He has been a mixed farmer in Narok for the last ten years, with a monthly income of KES 5,000 (Kenyan shillings).

He was introduced to KADET by a registered client in his abode. He has been a good client and this is his third loan. With the loan he has planned to purchase farm inputs i.e. fertilizers, seeds and chemicals. He intends to use the return from the loan to plough back into farming and in part to repay the loan.

His dreams are to become a famous farmer in the area and to educate his children to a higher level of education. He is an industrious man who struggles to achieve if funded.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is divorced and has two adult children who live separately. She sells clothing at the central market in Zaporozhye city. Maria has been in this business for 13 years. During this time she has established two business locations, many repeat clients and has a large sales experience. 

Maria enjoys her business and wants to develop it further. Maria would like to borrow 15,000 Gryvnas. The loan will help her to purchase winter goods and coats at good price. Since this business is the only source of income for Maria, she wants to minimize the expenses and maximize her net income.

loans.use: to purchase winter coats at good price

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en:
Damaris, age 29, operates a taxi in the Kitengela area. She has been in this business for the last three years and earns an income of KES 25,000 per month. She and her husband Martin are blessed with two children.

Damaris is applying for her first loan of KES 30,000 from KADET Ltd., and she intends to use the full amount to pay for necessary repairs to her taxi.  She will save the anticipated profits toward the purchase of another vehicle.

She hopes eventually to own a chain of taxis. She is disciplined and hardworking.

loans.use: to pay for necessary repairs to her taxi

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more goats for rearing

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is 57 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 
Aida has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.
Aida has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Aida hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.en:
Esperanza is a widowed business woman. She is 58 years old and thankful because at her age, she still enjoys her business buying and selling banana and charcoal. According to her, she sells the banana and charcoal four times a week because she has a contact person from another village who comes to get it. This way, she minimizes her fare in going to and from the market, because the fare is expensive as they are far from the market.

Esperanza plans to buy stock of charcoal and banana to increase her profit but she doesn't have enough money. In this regard, she is requesting for additional capital amount of P15,000 (Philippine Pesos) to invest in her buying and selling business. Through this loan amount she is requesting, she could attain her goals in her business and family.

loans.use: to buy additional banana and charcoal stocks for her retail business

loans.name: Emilio

texts.en:
Emilio lives in the Philippines. He is happy living with his wife and his one child. Emilio has been managing his hog raising business for 15 years. Emilio describes himself as patient and industrious.

His business serves as a source of income for the family that helps him provide his child allowances in school. Now, Emilio is happy because his child has finished his education. He says that his success is just a product of his good character.

Emilio is looking for a loan of P15,000 (Philippine Pesos) to buy feed for raising his piglets. He wants to develop his business, earn a higher income and save some of it for any future emergencies in his family.

loans.use: to buy feed to raise his piglets

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul has been practicing dairy farming for the last 13 years in Kiambu town. He is 34 years old and married to Alice. They have two children.

He was introduced to KADET by a KADET client. This will be his first loan. He intends to use the loan amount to buy a motorbike for transport services.

In future, Paul hopes to open a photo studio.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for transport services.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is 34 years old, married, with two children. His monthly income is KES.5,000. He has been a farmer for the past ten years. Farming is doing well in his area due to favorable conditions.


He learned about KADET through one of their advertisement. This is his first loan with KADET which he plans to use to buy farm supplies.

He plans to use the proceeds from the loan to plough back into the farm. He has never taken another loan from any MFI. He is an honest man who strives to achieve, if supported financially.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more animals for sale

loans.name: Vitaliy

texts.ru:
Виталий женат, у него есть один 7-ми летний сын. Виталий владеет малым бизнесом – продает различные электротовары: лампочки, светильники, кабель, розетки и многое другое. Свой бизнес он начал 5 лет назад. За это время Виталий наработал большую базу постоянных покупателей, в том числе магазинов, которые заказывают у него партии товара.

Виталий – целеустремленный, предприимчивый и трудолюбивый. У него сочетаются такие черты характера как доброта, отзывчивость с одной стороны и расчетливость с другой. Возможно, именно такое сочетание помогает Виталию устанавливать хорошие связи с покупателями и делает его бизнес успешным. 

Виталий намерен развивать свой бизнес дальше и просит предоставить ему кредит в размере 17,000 гривен на покупку большого объема электрокабеля по оптовой цене.  Полученный доход Виталий планирует направить на улучшение своих жилищных условий.
texts.en:
Vitaliy is married, has a seven-year-old son and is a small business owner. He deals in various electrical supplies, such as: light bulbs, lamps, cables, sockets, etc. Over the five years since starting his business, he has accumulated a number of constant buyers, including stores which order supplies from him in bulk. 

Vitaliy is motivated, driven and diligent. His personality allows him to establish good customer relations; his traits include kindness and charity which border with prudence.

Vitaliy is dedicated to developing his business further and is asking for a loan in order to purchase a large amount of electric cable in bulk. He plans to use the profits to improve his housing conditions.

loans.use: to purchase large amount of electric cable in bulk

loans.name: Rex

texts.en:
Rex is 27 years of age and is single. He lives with his parents, brothers, and sisters. Rex has been managing his hog-raising business for 10 years. After taking care of the hogs for four months, he sells them earning P2,000 per head. Rex wants to help his parents uplift their standard of living.
Sometimes, Rex has had difficulties in providing feed for his pigs. This was the reason he decided to request a loan of P25,000 to buy feed for his pigs. He will look to the success of his business to extend his help to his parents in times of financial shortage.

loans.use: to buy feed for his pigs.

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en:
Hog-raising is fun, according to Lanie. Though it is challenging to clean out the pen on a regular basis, she may need to exert extra effort and patience in this field of work to generate income. She usually earns about 3,000 Philippines pesos (P) with each hog disposal. 

Lanie is now 36 years old and had three children to educate. But due to insufficient funds, she was not able to send them all to school. 

She is now asking for loan of P13,000 to buy hog feed, medicines and vitamins to ensure good nutrition for the hogs. With good nutrition for the hogs, she can offer them at a higher cost.

Someday, Lanie still hopes to save enough profits for the future education of her children. She would like to strengthen her hog-raising business to assure a brighter future for her family.

loans.use: to buy hog feed, medicines and vitamins to ensure good nutrition for the hogs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a very conscientious woman who practices land farming. She has been in this business for over three years. She is 22 years old, single, and still in college.

She is applying for her first loan which she plans to use to purchase farm supplies. She plans to use the entire loan amount to buy farm inputs. 

She intends to use the additional income from the proceeds of this loan to buy cattle for fattening and She hopes to develop her business and to be financially stable in the future.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy animals for sale.

loans.name: Encarnacion

texts.en:
Encarnacion is a 58-year-old married woman living in an area known for the farming of bananas and corn. She is thankful because through her business she is able to sustain the financial needs of her family. Though she has not been blessed with children, still she's grateful because she has an adopted child.

For 32 years, Encarnacion has been raising and selling pigs. She feeds them nutritionally balanced feeds mixed with corn until they reach optimum growth. She is able to earn about 1,200 Philippines pesos (P) per head, and she uses her obtained income to cover household expenses.

She asked for the loan amount of P20,000 to buy feeds. Once the pigs are fattened up, she sells them to local markets with the goal in mind of obtaining a better price in order to have increased income. Through this goal, she could save and maintain her hog-raising business.

loans.use: to buy feed stock for her hog-raising business.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is married with 7 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Juanita is 41 years old and has 3 children who are in school.

Juanita has an abaca making business in the Philippines. (Abaca is a strong fiber obtained from the leafstalk of a banana (Musa textilis) native to the Philippines - also called Manila hemp.) She has been in this business for 10 years.

She requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials for her abaca making.  In the future, Juanita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for her abaca making.

loans.name: Maryana

texts.ru:
Марьяна живет в городе Виноградове. Она имеет свой бизнес, которым занимается на протяжении 5 лет.

Марьяна имеет торговую точку в центре универмага.  Продает она детскую и подростковую одежду.  Стабильность - это слово характеризует работу Марьяны. Она трудолюбивая и целеустремленная. Марьяна всегда готова помочь клиенту сделать правильный выбор.  Бизнес цель Марьяны: открыть вторую торговую точку.

Марьяна просит предоставить ей кредит в сумме  15,000 гривен на приобретение 20 подростковых костюмов (штаны и майки). Увеличивши ассортимент, Марьяна сможет увеличить доход.
texts.en:
Maryana lives in Vinogradov. She's devoted herself to her business for the past five years. Maryana owns a sales point in the center of a mall where she deals in children's and teen clothing. 

Her work very stable. Maryana is dedicated, diligent and always ready to assist a client. Her business goal is to open a second sales point. Maryana is asking for a loan of 15,000 grivna in order to purchase twenty teen suits (pants and shirt). By diversifying her goods, she can increase profits.

loans.use: to purchase twenty suits for teens.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en: Nilda is married with 2 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Nilda is 40 years old and one of her children is in school. She has a business buying and selling clothes in the Philippines. Nilda requested a loan of PHP 12,000 through Kiva's partner, NWTF, to buy more blouses, pants etc. to sell. She has been in this business for 5 years and would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy blouses, pants and other clothing for resale

loans.name: Merily

texts.en: Merily works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business selling ready-to-wear clothing in the Philippines. Merily requested a loan of PHP 12,000 from Kiva's partner, NWTF, to purchase more ready-to-wear clothing to sell. Merily has been in this business for 3 years now, and also earns additional income from farming vegetables. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more ready-to-wear clothing to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Naisiae

texts.en:
Naisiae, age 32, is married and has one child. She has been farming on her own piece of land for the last two years with a monthly profit margin of KES 5000. 

She learned about KADET from the KADET staff. She paid her previous loan well and is now applying for her third loan with KADET, which she will spend to purchase agricultural inputs.

She hopes to use the profit generated from the loan to expand her farming. She dreams of educating her children to a higher level. She is a hardworking woman who puts more efforts into her work.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural inputs.

loans.name: Tita

texts.en: Tita is 65 years old and married with 3 children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of PHP 29,500 from Kiva's partner, NWTF, to increase the stock of items to be sold in her sari-sari store. Tita has borrowed and repaid 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 21 years and also earns an income from farming rice and sugarcane. Tita aspires to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: To increase the stock of items to be sold in her sari-sari store

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Marlita

texts.en: Marlita is married with 7 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marlita is 63 years old and 2 of her children are in school. She has a fishing business in the Philippines and requested a loan of PHP 10,000 from Kiva's partner, NWTF, to purchase fishing gear and other equipment. Marlita has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fishing gear and other equipment

loans.name: Genalyn

texts.en: Genalyn is 44 years old and married with 3 children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of PHP 10,000 from Kiva's partner, NWTF, to purchase more items like soft drinks, soap, bread and other groceries to sell. Genalyn has borrowed and repaid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 1 year and also earns an income from selling rice. Genalyn aspires to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy items like soft drinks, soap, bread and other groceries to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en: Lanie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She is requesting a loan of PHP 30,000 from Kiva's partner, NWTF, to buy fishing gear and other equipment for her business. Lanie has been in this business for 8 years. She earns additional income from raising pigs and selling soft drinks. Lanie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Rosela

texts.en: Rosela is 57 years old and married with 4 children. She works very hard to provide for them. Rosela runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a loan of PHP 12,000 from Kiva's partner, NWTF, to purchase more items to sell in her store. Rosela has been in this business for 4 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, noodles and other groceries. In the future Rosela would like to save enough money to rent a space at the public market.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her store

loans.name: Maria Lyn

texts.en: Maria Lyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business selling purified drinking water in the Philippines. Maria Lyn requested a loan of PHP 11,000 from Kiva's partner, NWTF, to buy more purified drinking water for resale. Maria Lyn has been in this business for 2 years now and earns additional income from selling cosmetics. In the future, Maria Lyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to increase her stock of purified drinking water for resale

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David has been a farmer for the last 11 years. He is 31 years old, married and blessed with two children.

He learned about KADET from the marketing done by the KADET staff in his area of abode. 

Being this is his third loan, he plans to spend it to purchase farm supplies. He intends to use the returns from the loan to re-invest in farming and buy a bigger farm.

His dreams are to be the best and most well known farmer in the area. He is an industrious man who can do well if funded.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Natalya

texts.en:
Natalya is married and has a 12-year-old daughter. Natalya sells children's clothing in the central market in Novomoskovsk. She launched her start-up six years ago and presently has over 65,000 Grivnyas invested in the business. Today Natalya owns several vending kiosks in the same marketplace offering a variety of clothing.
 
Natalya is an experienced vendor. She knows what a customer wants and tries to meet the demand. Natalya is requesting a loan of 20,000 Grivnyas to purchase additional merchandise for this fall season. She is hoping to generate additional income and purchase new furniture for her apartment.

loans.use: to purchase additional clothing to sell

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine is a businesswoman who has a home-based store. At the same time, she manages a school canteen in their village. Her husband is retired army and they have been blessed with three school-aged children.

She has operated her home-based store for 10 years and she is able to earn about PHP 6,000 a month. With the income she obtains from her business, she is able to cover all the household expenses. She would like to buy more groceries such as chocolate candies, assorted biscuits, soft drinks, junk foods, baked breads and ingredients for her variety store business to minimize the cost of going to and from the market. For these reasons, she is asking for a loan of PHP 24,000. This amount would really help her increase her income so that she can give her children a better education.

loans.use: to buy groceries such as chocolate candies, assorted biscuits, soft drinks, junk food, baked breads and ingredients to sell

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en: Vicenta is 49 years old and married with 4 children, of whom 3 are in school. Vicenta works very hard to provide for them. She runs a variety store in the Philippines and requested a loan of PHP 20,000 from Kiva's partner, NWTF, to purchase more items to sell. Vicenta has been in this business for 12 years and sells a variety of products such as sugar, snack foods and other miscellaneous items. In the future Vicenta would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to increase her stock of items to sell

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet is 29 years old and married with 2 children, 1 of whom is in school. She works very hard to provide for her family. Janet runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of PHP 12,000 from Kiva's partner, NWTF, to purchase more items to sell. Janet has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, sugar, soap and other groceries. Janet would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy items like bread, noodles, snack foods and other groceries for resale

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is 38 years old and married with five children. Four of her children are in school. Analiza is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past three years, she has run a food vending business in the Philippines. 

Analiza is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients to make food to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to make food to sell

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is 56 years old and is married with five children. Two of her children are in school. For the past ten years, Elisa has been raising pigs in the Philippines. She has borrowed nine previous NWTF loans to sustain  her business. 

Elisa is requesting a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy pig feed and vitamins. In the future, Elisa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and vitamins

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna manages her sari-sari (variety store) for almost four years. Daily income from the business goes for daily meals and allowances for her children. She has eight children. Two of her children have already finished their college and are employed. She is now 57 years old and her spouse works as a local farmer.

Due to insufficient capital to diversify her business, Myrna is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy soft drinks, breads and canned goods to sell in her store. She would like to stock more groceries in her store to attract more customers and thus increase her earnings to sustain all the needs of her children for a better education.

In the future, Myrna would like to strengthen her business to earn more profits to make her family more economically stable and be able to save for future expenses.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, breads and canned goods to sell in her store.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 40 years old and married with four children, two of whom attend school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past four years, Jocelyn has been buying and selling salt in the Philippines. 

Jocelyn is requesting a 16,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase a sack of salt to sell. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase salt to sell

loans.name: Real

texts.en:
Real is a farmer working in Kompong Speu Province of Cambodia. She has been growing rice for many years. She is married to Sokhom, who works as junk goods collector and earns about 3 USD each day. Real and her husband have six children. Two of her children are married and live separately, two of her children work in a sewing factory in Phnom Penh where they earn fix salary per month, and the other two children are attending school. 

Real and her husband are requesting a loan from HKL and Kiva to purchase more goods to sell, as they lack the money to do this. This is Real's first loan with HKL. She is expecting that this loan will let her family find happiness and prosperity and have a bigger house. Real says that everything she does is for her family’s well-being because she’d like to give them a different lifestyle.

loans.use: to purchase junk goods to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more sheep and farm inputs

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 49 years old and lives in Ibabao, Siquijor.  She is widowed with two children.  

Judith sells Ready to Wear products and earns approximately PHP 2,500 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase more clothes for her business.

Judith has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for five months.  In the future, Judith hopes to expand the business.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Bienvenida

texts.en:
Bienvenida is 51 years old and married with four children. Two of her children are married and two are in college. She is engaged in a hog-raising business while her husband is a farmer. 

Her family is peacefully living in the village of San Pedro Maddela. According to her, she is spending her profit for her two college students, especially for their tuition fees and daily allowances. Bienvenida has had her hog-raising business for almost 31 years. She has also been a banana canvasser for 10 years. She enjoys the businesses she manages, because it is their main source of income. She would like to buy feed because the fare is expensive and their market is far away. For this reason, she requested a loan of PHP 25,000. This would really help her to maintain the businesses she has. She is hoping that she can send her children to a higher level of education.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more fruits, vegetables, wheat flour, sugar, baking flour and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 43 years old and married with three children who are schooling. His wife operates a shop with a monthly income of KES 5000. 

He was introduced to KADET LTD by a registered client. He has been a good client who has paid his all previous loans well and without any complications. He is a carpenter and he has been doing this for the last six years. 

He applied for his second loan, which he plans to use to expand his carpentry business. He hopes to make a profit and reinvest the same in his business expansion by buying more timber, and velvet materials for making chair cushions. His dream is to be the best carpenter in the vicinity.

loans.use: to buy timber  and velvet materials for making chair cushions

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Myagmarsuren

texts.en: Myagmarsuren is 26 years old and lives with his two daughters and wife in Han-Uul district of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. His wife works as a relationship and communications manager. Currently, she is taking care of their children at home. Myagmarsuren operates a press center. He makes brochures, logos, and web sites. He started his business about three years ago and now is enrolled in the computer programming training. Although he did his BA in Accounting, he is more interested in having his own private business. He is a diligent and open-minded person who is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase a server for the business and rent a commercial space.

loans.use: To purchase a server and rent commercial space

loans.name: Lisa

texts.en:
As a married mother with two children, Lisa works hard to support her family. She runs a tricycle transport business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from selling salt. Lisa has been sustaining her business activities with her past six loans from NWTF.

Lisa is requesting a 16,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase equipment and pay for tricycle repairs. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase equipment and pay for tricycle repairs

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is aged 35 and married, and they have one child. He has been a wheat farmer for the past seven years. He knew about KADET through a registered client. He applied for his first loan, which he plans to purchase wheat seeds and fertilizers with. 

He hopes to make a profit and use it to purchase sheep for fattening. He dreams that at his age of thirty five he will be stable and his children will live better lives. 

He is a good hardworking client who tries hard to achieve, if funded.

loans.use: to purchase wheat seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 42 years old, and a married woman. She has been engaged in a hog raising business for 14 years. According to her, the income she obtains from this business was used in buying a side car, and some went to her motorcycle transport monthly payments.

Agnes gets up early every morning to feed the pigs, and she feeds them three times a day. She has been doing this to get good earnings. She sells her pigs alive because it saves her from heavier work that she wouldn't be able to do because she looks after her little child.

Her goal in her business is to increase her income. She is asking for additional capital amount of P18,000 to be use in buying two piglets and feed for her raised pigs. She hopes that she will be able to sell her piglets at a higher price so that she could support her school aged children and give them a quality life.

loans.use: to buy two piglets and feed supplies for her hog raising business

loans.name: Juanito

texts.en:
At his age of 51, Juanito still works hard all day long in his farming business. He has been in this business for almost 20 years. He plants and harvests rice in his one-hectare plot of land. He earned P30,000 last cropping season of May. He utilized it in paying for school fees, daily meals and monthly electric bills.

He is asking for a loan of P10,000 to buy fertilizers and insecticides used in farming. Through the help of this loan he will improve his crop production and thus increase his profits.

In the future, Juanito would like to keep producing abundant harvests to sustain all the needs of his children for a better education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides used in farming

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Touch is a 38-year-old married woman. She is married to Mr. Chomreurn who operates a business as a taxi driver. From this business sector, her husband can earn about $4 per day. Touch and her husband have given birth to three children. One of her daughters is now employed as a sewing factory worker in Phnom Penh city where she can earn an adequate salary per month and the other two children are attending school. 

To upgrade their living conditions, Touch and her husband wish to purchase a motorbike but they lack money so they wish to apply for some funds through HKL, partner with Kiva. Touch and her husband are expecting that this loan will make their family happy and prosperous, and they will be able to send their children to study at higher levels. This is her first loan with HKL.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Jemson

texts.en:
Jemson is 47 years old and lives in Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur, Philippines. He is married with 5 school-aged children. The family is living together in the said place.

Jemson has been engaged in a motorcycle transport business to make a living. He has been driving around his usual routes for over 10 years and maintains his interest in pursuing the job. His wife also works as a designer and earns a quite just amount to suffice daily needs, and for their children's' education. Their total earnings have reached  PHP 12,800 a month. But, a problem with motorcycle parts has been detected that pushes him to request a loan of PHP 18,000 at GDMPC to purchase motorcycle accessories. The money is a big help to fix and resume business operations.

Jemson has been a member of GDMPC since 2008. He did repay all previous loans drawn out from the cooperative. The current loan is his 3rd cycle of loan. In the future, Jemson hopes to push through his business immediately. He plans to expand and improve the business to sustain their daily needs.

loans.use: To purchase motorcycle accessories.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is aged 31 years, married and has two children. He has been in farming for the past four years. He is a humble client. 

He knew about KADET through other clients registered in his area of dwelling. This will be his first loan with KADET and he intends to spend it by preparing the land for farming and the purchase of maize seeds.

His anticipation of the profit generated is to plough it back into the farm and he dreams to be a big farmer. He can do more if provided with resources.

loans.use: purchase maize seeds.

loans.name: Levi

texts.en:
Levi is 25 years old and lives in Dumanhog, Siquijor. He is single with one child. 
Everyday Levi sells fresh fish at the market. He has been doing this type of work for one year. He has requested a loan of 7000 to purchase fish to sell at the market.
He has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for two months. In the future, Levi hopes to grow his business.

loans.use: To purchase fish

loans.name: Domingo

texts.en:
Domingo is 31 years old and lives in Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur, Philippines. He is married with three school-aged children. 

Domingo owns and operates a retail store to support his family. He has been selling grocery items, school and office supplies, a few hardware products and other items for over 3 years. The couple are known for their good characters as community members. Approximately, he earns a total of 2,500 PHP a month. To further enhance his business, he requested a loan of PHP 5,000 from GDMPC to purchase additional inventory.

Domingo became a member of GDMPC recently. This is his first loan transaction made in the cooperative. In the future, Domingo hopes to sustain his store and expand his business. He dreams of giving his children a good education and plans to double his time to attain this.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to add more stock to his shop

loans.name: Bayartsetseg

texts.en: Bayartsetseg is 27 years old and lives with her two sons and husband in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in Govisumber province of Mongolia. Her husband is a security guard at the local prison and her eldest son is a high school student. She started her business many years ago. She operates a clothes trading business. Previously, she rented a commercial space but she bought her own commercial space about two months ago. She has many years of business experience and skills. She is planning to expand her business in the long run. This is her first loan from the bank. Previously her husband received several bank loans. She is requesting a 800,000 MNT loan to purchase more clothes to increase her income.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes

loans.name: Marima

texts.en:
Marima , 41 years old, is married with three children, two of whom are in school. He does mixed farming i.e. rearing sheep, goats, cattle and he is also a wheat farmer. He has been doing this for the past eight years.

He learned about KADET LTD through a KADET staff member. He repaid his previous loan successful and has applied for his third loan which he plans to spend partly on farming and partly on purchasing more sheep for fattening.

He hopes to make a profit and to use it to educate his children. He dreams of expanding his business.

loans.use: to buy maize seeds and sheep to rear and sell later at a profit

loans.name: Fadi

texts.en:
Fadi is a 46-year-old married man and the father of three children. He opened his restaurant in 2009 but he has 15 years of experience in this field.
Fadi is a hard working man. He started his own business to improve his family's living conditions and to cover most of their requirements. 
Fadi is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua to buy a new grill, a french fry cutter and a falafel pan as well as tools needed to improve his business.
This is his first time as an Al Majmoua borrower. He hopes this experience will have a positive effect in improving his career.
Fadi hopes to improve and expand his business more and more in the future. He faced the challenge of starting his own business and is working hard to succeed.

loans.use: To buy new tools and machines for his business

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla is 52 years old and is married to Alfredo who is village farmer. She has worked in her own store for 10 years and is able to earn about P2,000 a month. She uses her income to buy feed and some goes on household expenses.

Perla sells different kinds of daily-use products, cosmetics, ingredients and groceries. She acquires her groceries at the market of Maddela because she gets the best price there. She would like to ask for an additional amount of P25,000 to buy stock such as sugar, oils, milk, snack foods, canned goods, instant noodles, shampoo, detergent soap and assorted biscuits for her general store. In this way, she'll be able to meet costumer demand and increase her income.
